Grease 12 muffin cups.
In a large bowl, combine flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt; set aside.
In a medium bowl, combine applesauce, sugar, eggs, and peaches; mix well.
Add flour mixture to fruit mixture; stir just until moistened.
Divide batter evenly among muffin cups.
Sprinkle each muffin with 1 tablespoon brown sugar.
Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan 5 minutes; remove to wire rack to cool completely.

6e11affa2e.gt:
In a small bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a 1 quart glass container (a mason jar works great!
), layer the flour mixture, sugar, brown sugar, oats, walnuts, cereal and cranberries.
Cover and store in a cool dry place for up to 6 months.
Write this note to go with your gift mix: To Prepare Cookies ~ In a large bowl, beat the softened butter, egg, water and vanilla until blended.
Add cookie mix and mix well.
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake at 350F for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool 1 minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely.
6e11affa2e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a medium bowl, combine sugar, brown sugar, oats, walnuts, and cranberries.
Add butter and egg to the flour mixture; stir until well blended.
Stir in the sugar mixture.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.

af6f74da4c.gt:
Cut the enoki mushrooms into 3 even lengths, and shred apart.
Cut the tofu into 2 cm cubes.
Bring the dashi stock to a boil and add the ingredients.
Add the enoki mushrooms and tofu and bring to a gentle simmer again.
Serve in bowls scattered with some chopped green onion.
af6f74da4c.pred:
Place all ingredients in a pot and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot.

91d53e8b2a.gt:
I would use my own brownie recipe but you can use a box mix.
Prepare the brownie mix as directed on package.
Pour into greased 13x9 baking pan.
Beat cream cheese with electric mixer on med.
speed until smooth.
Add sugar, mixing until blended.
Add egg and vanilla; mix just until blended.
Pour cream cheese mixture over brownie mixture; cut through batter with knife several times for marble effect.
Bake at 350F for 35 to 40 minutes or until cream cheese mixture is lightly browned.
Cool; cut into squares.
Note: Do not use brownie mixes that include syrup pouch.
91d53e8b2a.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix brownie mix, cream cheese, sugar and egg together.
Pour into a 9x13 pan.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Cool completely.
Mix cream cheese, sugar and vanilla until smooth.
Spread over cooled brownies.
Chill for 2 hours.
Cut into squares.

d46848fda2.gt:
In a medium bowl, add rice flour, all-purpose flour, bread crumbs, turmeric, cumin powder, red chili, mango powder, salt, water and make a thick paste.
Set aside.
Cut 1/2 inch thick round pieces of the eggplant.
This will give total of 10 pieces.
Heat the large nonstick pan on high, dab oil and reduce heat to medium.
Take 1 round piece of eggplant, dip it into the batter, making sure its evenly coated on both sides, and put it on the heated pan.
After 2 minutes, turn to the other side and cook for another 2 minutes.
Check both the sides to make sure they are evenly golden brown.
Continue until all eggplant pieces are cooked.
Serve hot.
d46848fda2.pred:
Mix all ingredients together except the eggplant.
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Dip the eggplant slices in the batter and fry until golden brown.
Serve with chutney.

18612275da.gt:
Preheat oven to 350
Lightly butter both sides of bread and place on baking sheet
Add all seasonings to taste.
(I like to put them in my hand first and sprinkle them on them on so they don't get overpowered).
Add the cheese and bake for about 5-7 minutes.
18612275da.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Spread butter on bread.
Sprinkle with basil, oregano, parsley, garlic powder, garlic salt, onion powder, and Italian 5 cheese blend.
Bake in the oven at 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes.

59d1144ae9.gt:
Pour 1 quart of hot water into a large saucepan, and dissolve the gelatin.
Allow to cool.
Pour the cooled gelatin into a large punch bowl.
Stir in: pineapple juice, orange juice concentrate, sugar, and 4 1/2 cups of cold water.
Just before serving, pour in the Ginger Ale.
59d1144ae9.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
Stir until gelatin is dissolved.
Refrigerate until set.
Serve in glasses.

ed226be03e.gt:
Heat oil in a small frying pan over low heat until hot, about 1 minute.
Add chile flakes and remove from heat.
Let cool to room temperature.
Strain through a fine mesh strainer if desired, then transfer to a container and cover until ready to use.
Heat half of a gas or charcoal grill to high (about 400 degrees F) and the other half to low (about 300 degrees F).
Divide dough in 1/2 and roll into 2 rounds about 1/4 inch thick and 10 inches in diameter.
Brush the top of 1 round with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Lay dough oiled side down on the hotter half of the grill and brush the top with oil and sprinkle with salt.
Grill without moving until grill marks form on the bottom of the dough, about 2 minutes.
Flip dough with a spatula or tongs to the cooler half of grill.
Spread 1/2 of the sauce evenly over the dough, sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the Parmesan cheese over the sauce, then top with 1/2 of the peppers, 1/2 of the sausage, and 1/2 of the mozzarella.
Cover and grill, rotating if necessary to avoid any hot spots, until dough is lightly charred and cheese is melted, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Transfer pizza to a cutting board, sprinkle 1 tablespoon more of the Parmesan over top, drizzle with desired amount of chile oil, slice, and serve.
Repeat with second round of dough and remaining toppings.
ed226be03e.pred:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
Brush a 12-inch pizza pan with olive oil.
Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to a 14-inch round.
Transfer the dough to the prepared pan.
Brush the dough with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Bake for 12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
Remove from the oven and brush with olive oil.
Spread the pizza sauce over the crust.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Top with roasted peppers and sausage.
Bake for 12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
Slice and serve.

42ab84ef73.gt:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Thaw pastry according to directions on box (about 40 minutes).
Cut pastry into 3 sections along perforated lines.
Lay one section of pastry on a baking sheet to assemble.
Spread 2 tablespoons of pesto onto the pastry.
Next, space 5 shrimp evenly on top of the pesto.
Sprinkle with slivers of sundried tomatoes and pine nuts.
Using your fingers, fold over the sides of the pastry so they meet in the middle, and pinch to form a seal (although it will open while baking).
Bake one roll at a time, at 450 degrees F for 5 minutes, then lower oven heat to 375 degrees F and cook an additional 5-8 minutes until pastry is brown and puffed.
Repeat assembly and baking process with remaining two pastry sheets.
Slice each roll into five pieces (one shrimp in each piece) and serve warm.
Makes 15 appetizers.
42ab84ef73.pred:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut puff pastry into 4 equal squares.
Spread each square with 1 tablespoon of pesto.
Place 3 shrimp on each square.
Top each shrimp with 1 tablespoon of pesto.
Sprinkle each square with 1/4 cup of sun-dried tomato slivers.
Sprinkle each square with 1/4 cup of toasted pine nuts.
Bake for 10 minutes or until puff pastry is golden brown.

3cb86cf2f4.gt:
Wash 5 potatoes.
Cut into square pieces.
Preheat oil in skillet on stove top.
I use my iron skillet
Chop up 1/4 white onion on cutting board along with potatoes.
Chop up two green peppers on board.
Dust garlic powder over potato, onion, pepper mix
Place potatoes, onion and peppers in skillet.
Dust with salt and pepper for additional flavor.
Cook until golden brown or potatoes are tender.
Serves about 5, can serve more just cut up more potatoes.
One potato per person want to feed.
3cb86cf2f4.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Wash and peel potatoes.
Cut potatoes into 1/2 inch cubes.
Place potatoes in a large bowl and add onion, green peppers, garlic powder, and salt.
Toss to coat.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add potatoes, onion, and green peppers to the skillet.
Saute until potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally.
Transfer potatoes to a 13x9 inch baking dish.
Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes.
Serve hot.

71c5c68d5d.gt:
Preheat your oven to 425 F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with a Silpat or parchment paper and set aside.
Place all the ingredients for the meatballs in a large bowl.
Using your clean hands, mix all of the ingredients until well combined.
(Kind of gross, but kind of fun.)
Cover and refrigerate the pork mixture for 20 minutes to allow the chia seeds to work their gelling magic.
Use your hands to mold the pork mixture into 1-inch meatballs, and arrange them on the prepared baking sheet, making sure they arent touching.
You should have approximately 20 meatballs.
Transfer the tray of meatballs to the oven and bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned and cooked through.
In a small bowl, whisk together all of the ingredients for the glaze.
Pour the glaze into a large non-stick pan over medium heat and keep it warm until meatballs are done.
When hot, add the meatballs and toss to coat.
Serve meatballs warm over your stir-fried vegetables or noodles of your choice.
71c5c68d5d.pred:
Place the pork in a large bowl and add the garlic, ginger, onion, cilantro, tamari, chia seeds, ginger, vinegar, honey, and Sriracha.
Mix well.
Form the pork mixture into 1-inch balls and place on a baking sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
Serve with the spicy ginger-soy glaze.

77ec10e4ac.gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 350F.
Brush a mini cupcake pan with melted, unsalted butter.
Set aside 2.
In a medium bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and ginger.
3.
In another bowl, whisk oil, sugar, eggs, and vanilla; mix to blend.
(I used an electric mixer out of ease.)
4.
Add flour mixture to the creamed mixture a little at a time, mixing as you add.
5.
Fold in the zucchini and pecans.
6.
Fill the mini cupcake pan, filling each hole a little more than 1/2 way full.
Bake 10-15 minutes.
7.
Cool completely on wire racks.
Enjoy them plain or add a little cream cheese frosting to the tops!
77ec10e4ac.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease mini muffin tins.
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and ginger.
In a separate bowl, combine oil, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, and zucchini.
Mix wet ingredients into dry ingredients just until moistened.
Fill mini muffin tins 2/3 full.
Sprinkle tops with pecans.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.

75465ac6f9.gt:
Heat grill to medium-high heat.
Toss meat with 2 Tbsp.
A.1.
; let stand 10 min.
Meanwhile, mix remaining A.1., barbecue sauce and mustard until blended.
Thread meat onto 8 skewers.
Grill 6 min.
or until meat is done, turning after 3 min.
and brushing occasionally with barbecue sauce mixture.
75465ac6f9.pred:
Heat grill to medium-high heat.
Place beef skewers on grill and cook for 4-5 minutes on each side.
Turn skewers over and brush with A.1.
Cook for 1 minute on each side.
Turn skewers over and brush with barbecue sauce.
Cook for 1 minute on each side.
Serve with caramelized onions.

d3a8a169dd.gt:
For crust, preheat oven to 275F; crumble ingredients together until well mixed; Press into a greased 9x13 pan and bake in a slow oven (275F) for 8 minutes; increase temp to 375F and top with second mixture and continue baking.
For topping: Mix all ingredients well; spread mixture over the partially baked crust and continue baking in a moderate oven (375F) until well set and slightly browned, about 30 minutes; cool and cut into squares.
d3a8a169dd.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Grease a 9x13-inch pan.
Mix butter, sugar, flour, brown sugar, coconut, and walnuts in a large bowl.
Beat eggs and add to mixture.
Add baking powder and mix well.
Pour into pan and bake for 20-25 minutes.
Cool and cut into squares.

952ff059c4.gt:
In medium bowl, mix cocoa, sugar and oil.
Beat in the egg replacer; stir in vanilla.
Combine flour, baking powder and salt.
Stir into cocoa mixture.
Cover and chill 4 hours (or put in the freezer for about 30 minutes).
Preheat oven to 350.
Lightly grease cookie sheet.
Roll dough into 1-inch balls.
Using your finger, poke a hole into the ball and place 2 marshmallow pieces inside.
Form dough back into a ball, making sure marshmallow is completely covered; coat with powdered sugar.
Bake in preheated oven for 10-12 minutes.
Leave on cookie sheet for 1 minute and then transfer to a wire rack or brown paper.
EGG REPLACER 1 egg = 2 TBSP water + 1 TBSP oil + 2 tsp baking powder
Make sure you mix these together before adding to the recipe (dont just throw them all into the batter they must be mixed together first).
952ff059c4.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Shape into balls and roll in powdered sugar.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes.
Cool on wire racks.
Melt 1/2 cup of chocolate chips and drizzle over the cookies.
Store in an airtight container.

259241dc1b.gt:
Drain the tuna, reserving 1 tablespoon of the liquid.
Put the tuna in a serving bowl and mash with a fork until it's as mushy as you can get it.
Stir the reserved liquid, the salad dressing, honey mustard, relish, celery, carrot, sugar, and salt into the tuna.
Adjust seasoning to taste.
259241dc1b.pred:
Slice the tuna into bite-sized pieces.
Combine the tuna, salad dressing, honey mustard, sweet pickle relish, celery, carrot, sugar, and salt in a bowl.
Mix well.
Serve chilled.

a4c28c7c57.gt:
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the olive oil and after the oil is hot, stir in the eggplant.
Cook for 3-5 minutes, turning occasionally, until the eggplant is seared.
Stir in the onions, ginger and garlic, and then cook for about 1 minute, or until soft.
(If the pan is too dry from the eggplant absorbing all the oil, add a touch more olive oil when stirring in the onions.)
Reduce heat to low and stir in the coconut milk, fish sauce, curry powder, brown sugar, black pepper and optional chilies.
Simmer for about 2 minutes or until heated through and eggplant has absorbed some of the sauce.
a4c28c7c57.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Place eggplant on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Roast in the oven for 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and set aside.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onion and ginger and cook until onion is softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add coconut milk, fish sauce, curry powder, brown sugar, and fresh cracked black pepper.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.
Add eggplant and cook for 10 minutes more, until eggplant is tender.
Serve with Thai chili slices and chopped cilantro.

8c7a346bad.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Lightly grease a cookie sheet.
Unroll dough on lightly floured surface and press seams together.
Sprinkle one side of block of cream cheese with enough dill to cover.
Place cream cheese, dill side down, in center of dough.
Sprinkle with more dill to cover.
Bring sides of dough up around cheese block and seal to completely enclose.
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for approximately 15 minutes.
Serve warm.
8c7a346bad.pred:
Mix the cream cheese and dill weed together.
Wrap the cream cheese in the dough.
Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

af9fb785aa.gt:
Preheat oven to 275F/135C.
In a large bowl toss oatmeal, coconut, nuts, and sunflower seeds together.
In a separate bowl whisk together oil, honey, cinnamon, and vanilla.
Pour liquid mixture over oats and stir until everything is coated.
Pour mixture into a large rimmed baking sheet.
I also cover the baking sheet with baking paper but it's not necessary if you have a non-stick pan.
Bake for approximately 20-25 minutes, stirring once or twice.
Keep an eye on it so it doesn't burn.
Let it cool completely.
Blend in cornflakes if using.
Store in an airtight container.
af9fb785aa.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Mix well.
Spread on a large baking sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Stir every 10 minutes.
Store in an airtight container.

6f1343402a.gt:
Heat cumin seeds and mustard seed in hot dry skillet over high heat, swirling pan, until seeds start to pop.
Reduce heat to medium; add onions, chilies, and add a small amount of water; cook until onion is tender, adding more water as necessary to prevent sticking.
Add potatoes, ground cumin, coriander, turmeric, salt (to taste), and cayenne pepper, stirring to mix well.
Add 2/3 cup water, cover, reduce heat and cook for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until spices are absorbed and potatoes are tender.
Add a small amount of water at a time if all liquid evaporates.
Fold in cilantro just before serving.
6f1343402a.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the oil and add the cumin seeds and brown mustard seeds.
When they begin to sizzle, add the onion and chilies and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until the onion is softened.
Add the potatoes, cumin, coriander, turmeric, salt, cayenne pepper, and cilantro and stir to coat the potatoes.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are tender and the mixture is dry.
Serve hot.

193bc22f43.gt:
Microwave broccoli and CHEEZ WHIZ in microwaveable bowl on HIGH 1 min.
or until heated through, stirring after 30 sec.
Lightly smash each potato half with fork or spoon; place on crackers.
Top with broccoli mixture and bacon bits.
Serve warm.
193bc22f43.pred:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
Place potatoes on a baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until potatoes are tender.
Remove from oven and top with cheese dip.
Sprinkle with bacon bits.
Return to oven and bake for 5 minutes, or until cheese is melted.
Serve with crackers.

f3d6579000.gt:
Combine milk and mustard in bowl; add cheese.
Microwave, stirring every minute, 2-4 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Serve with desired dippers.
f3d6579000.pred:
In a medium bowl, combine the milk, mustard, and cheese.
Stir until well blended.
Serve with pretzels, breadsticks, or vegetable sticks.

f537025690.gt:
Mix chili sauce, lime juice, fish sauce, and cilantro; set aside.
Divide shrimp into 4 equal portions.
Lay each portion of shrimp in a neat row with tails pointed in the same direction.
Thread 2 thin wood or metal skewers (8 to 10 inches long) about 1 1/2 inches apart through center of each row of shrimp, pushing the shellfish close together.
Place shrimp on an oiled grill above a solid bed of hot coals or high heat on a gas barbecue (you can hold your hand at grill level only 2 to 3 seconds); close lid on gas grill.
Cook, turning once, until shrimp are pink, 2 to 3 minutes a side.
Brush tops of shrimp with the chili sauce mixture, turn over, and cook just until glaze bubbles and browns slightly, about 30 seconds (watch closely; glaze burns easily).
Brush tops with more chili mixture, then turn glaze down and cook just until it darkens slightly, about 30 seconds more.
Transfer shrimp to plates or a platter.
Season to taste with remaining chili mixture and juice from lime wedges.
f537025690.pred:
Slice shrimp into 1-inch pieces.
Mix together the chili sauce, lime juice, fish sauce, and cilantro.
Thread shrimp onto skewers.
Grill over medium-high heat until shrimp is cooked through, about 2 minutes per side.
Serve with the chili glaze.

7a6c6f2959.gt:
Dressing:.
Place the almonds and water into a blender or food proccesor and turn on high speed to puree.
Add remaining ingredients, except for oil, and run to blend and whip thoroughly.
With the motor running, slowly pour in oil and run until the dressing is thick and creamy.
(dressing can be prepared and refrigerated for up to 1 week.
).
As stated in the description, you may use 3/4 cup oil and 1/4 cup water or apple juice(or liquid of choice) and get a little thinner dressing.
Let sit for a few minutes to thicken up.
Salad:.
Put 1/2 cup of the dressing in the bottom of your salad bowl.
Add all ingredients, except lettuce, and toss to coat.
Serve:.
Put several lettuce leaves on each plate and add dressed salad.
Serve extra dressing on the side.
Enjoy!
7a6c6f2959.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the almonds, water, lemon juice, lemon zest, honey, salt, basil, dill, and pepper.
Let stand for 2 hours.
In a blender, puree the almond mixture.
With the machine running, add the oil in a slow, steady stream.
Pour into a bowl.
Add the broccoli, mushrooms, red onions, avocado, tomatoes, and lettuce.
Toss to combine.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve.

c6b05c501b.gt:
Spread 1 bread slice with peanut butter, then spread other bread slice with jam; close to make sandwich.
Cook in skillet sprayed with cooking spray on medium heat 3 min.
on each side or until sandwich is golden brown on both sides.
Let stand 1 min.
; cut into quarters.
c6b05c501b.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Spread peanut butter on one side of each slice of bread.
Top one slice with jam and the other with cherries.
Place peanut butter side down on the other slice of bread.
Press gently to spread jam on the top slice.
Cut into triangles.

1b81060720.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Partially bake the pie crust for 5 minutes according to package (or your recipe) instructions.
Whisk together the sugar, flour, salt and cocoa powder in medium mixing bowl.
Blend in melted butter.
Add the eggs and vanilla and stir until well blended.
Pour into the pie crust and bake 45 minutes.
The filling will be soft in the center but not runny; do not overbake, as it will set up some as it cools.
If crust gets too brown, cover with a pie shield or aluminum foil.
Allow to cool to room temperature (this allows the fudge to set up.)
I think it is best served warmed.
I micowave a slice for about 20 seconds on high.
Top with your choice of ice cream, fudge sauce, whipped cream, nuts and cherries.
1b81060720.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix together the pie crust ingredients and press into the bottom and sides of a 9-inch pie pan.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine the sugar, flour, salt, and cocoa powder.
Add the butter and mix until crumbly.
Add the eggs and vanilla and mix until smooth.
Pour the filling into the pie crust and bake for 40 minutes.
Cool completely before serving.

83d2a64e21.gt:
Heat greased barbecue to medium heat.
Grill wings 7 to 8 min.
on each side or until done.
Meanwhile, mix Miracle Whip and Sriracha sauce in large bowl until blended.
Add wings to Miracle Whip mixture; toss to evenly coat.
Transfer to platter.
Sprinkle with onions.
83d2a64e21.pred:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
Place chicken wings in a single layer in a large baking dish.
Combine Miracle Whip and Sriracha sauce in a small bowl; pour over chicken.
Bake 30 minutes, turning once, until chicken is cooked through and sauce is bubbling.
Serve with green onion slices.

05ef07d575.gt:
In small bowl, toss cheese and flour.
In small saucepan, heat buttermilk and cider.
Add cheese and caraway seeds.
Stir til melted.
Keep warm while serving.
Serve with chunks of rye bread for dipping.
05ef07d575.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve warm.

1bf5668c79.gt:
Brown ground beef and onion powder in a large skillet over medium heat, drain off fat.
Mix together eggs, cream, mayonnaise, garlic powder, pepper and shredded cheddar cheese.
Put browned beef into a 9 inch pie plate, pour remaining ingredients over the beef.
Place in a preheated 350 degree oven and bake for 40-45 minutes.
1bf5668c79.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine ground beef, onion powder, cream, mayonnaise, eggs, garlic powder, and pepper.
Pour into a 9-inch pie plate.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with cheese and bake for 10 minutes more.

f51e8fb184.gt:
Cook dry beans according to instructions on packet.
(No need with canned beans).
Saute onions until they are soft and clear.
Add tomato paste, coconutcream and seasonings, stirring over a gentle heat until they form a smooth and creamy sauce.
Drain beans and add to sauce.
Allow to simmer gently for 15 minutes or so, stirring from time to time.
Serve on brown or white rice accompanied by a salad.
f51e8fb184.pred:
In a large pot, combine the beans, onions, oil, tomato paste, coconut cream, paprika, chili powder, cumin, brown sugar, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour.
Serve with rice.

08d0d4295c.gt:
Wash the sweet potato well and use a paper towel to dry.
Heat the oil.
Cut the parts of the potato that you are going to fry into long strips.
If you aren't going to be washing in water, you should fry it quickly or it'll change color.
Fry slowly at about 170C for a nice color.
Sandwich between paper towels to remove the oil, shake some salt over all of them.
Repeat steps 2 - 4.
08d0d4295c.pred:
Slice the sweet potato into sticks about 1/2 inch thick.
Mix the slices with salt and set aside.
Heat oil in a deep fryer to 375 degrees F.
Fry the sweet potato sticks in batches until golden brown, about 3 minutes.
Drain on paper towels.
Sprinkle with salt.

874ce55813.gt:
Put all marinade ingrediantsin a large ziplock bag.
Mix well.
Add chicken breasts.
For a mild flavour, leave for 30 minutes.
For more intensity, leave up to 4 hours but no longer.
Heat up grill to medium high.
Cook breasts, with lid closed for about 7 (7 1/2) minutes per side.
874ce55813.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the chicken, dill, onion, garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, ouzo, fennel seed, salt and pepper.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 24 hours.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Place the chicken in a roasting pan and bake for 1 hour.
Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes.
Slice the chicken and serve with the marinade.

163b52a061.gt:
Cut broccoli and cauliflower into smaller pieces.
Heat water in a large wok to boiling and add broccoli and cauliflower.
Let sit for 2-3 minutes, then remove from wok, drain and rinse with cold water.
In same wok, heat 1-2 T oil on high.
Add ginger, garlic, carrot, and green onion.
Cook until garlic starts to turn brown.
Be careful not to overcook!
Add broccoli and cauliflower and stir.
Add sauce, stir, and let simmer for several minutes.
Serve immediately!
163b52a061.pred:
In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of oil.
Add the garlic, ginger, and onion.
Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes.
Add the broccoli and cauliflower.
Cook for 5 minutes.
Add the carrot.
Cook for 3 minutes.
Add the oyster sauce, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, and red pepper flakes.
Stir and cook for 1 minute.
Season with salt.
Serve immediately.

283c2400cb.gt:
Transfer cream to bowl of 5-quart electric stand mixer fitted with whisk attachment.
Tightly cover top of bowl and mixer with plastic wrap.
Beat cream at moderately high speed until it holds soft peaks, 10 to 12 minutes.
Increase speed to high and beat until mixture separates into thick, pale-yellow butter and thin, liquid buttermilk, about 5 minutes more.
Strain mixture through colander into large bowl.
Using hands, vigorously knead butter in colander, squeezing out remaining buttermilk, until dense and creamy, about 5 minutes.
Transfer butter to large bowl, reserving buttermilk.
Using hands, knead salt into butter.
Roll into logs and wrap in plastic wrap or transfer to airtight container and refrigerate.
(Butter will keep up to 1 week refrigerated or 1 month frozen.)
Strain buttermilk through fine-mesh sieve, then cover and refrigerate up to 1 week.
283c2400cb.pred:
Preheat the stand mixer and the bowl.
In the bowl of the stand mixer, combine the cream, salt, and butter.
Using the paddle attachment, beat the cream on medium speed until it begins to thicken, about 5 minutes.
Add the buttermilk and continue to beat until the mixture is thick and smooth, about 5 minutes.
Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed.
Transfer the butter to a container and refrigerate until ready to use.
Store in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.

093fcaf5a6.gt:
Start by heating a medium-sized pot (you will cook everything in this pot) on medium heat, then add the oil.
Once oil comes to temperature, add cubed pork belly.
Cook pork belly, turning as it cooks, until all sides are browned.
Once pork is browned, add onions, garlic, and ginger.
Give a good stir, and continue to cook for about 3 minutes or so.
Add the shrimp paste.
Turn on your vent on high as this stuff has some funk (good funk), and continue to stir.
Toss in chilies, stir again, then add coconut milk.
Bring to a simmer and cook for about 1 hour, on low, stirring along the way.
Before serving, taste and season with salt or pepper.
Now you are ready to dig in.
I like to serve with a small bowl of rice to the side, along with a soup bowl of the Bicol Express.
This dish is rich, creamy, spicy, funky, and overall totally comforting and right up my alley.
093fcaf5a6.pred:
Heat a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the oil and swirl to coat the pan.
Add the pork and stir-fry until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the onion and garlic and stir-fry until softened, about 2 minutes.
Add the ginger and chilies and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add the shrimp paste and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add the coconut milk and stir-fry until the pork is cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Add the salt and pepper and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Serve over jasmine rice.

5765949efb.gt:
Combine sugar, pecans and orange peel in small bowl.
Melt butter in small bowl in microwave.
Cut cream cheese into 20 pieces the size of butter pat.
Seperate each biscuit in half part way and place cream cheese piece in and pinch edges back together.
Do all 20 biscuits.
Then dip in melted butter and dredge in sugar, pecan mixture.
Stand upright in lightly greased 12 cup bundt pan, space evenly.
Drizzle any remaining butter over and sprinkle with any remaining sugar,pecan mixture.
Bake at 350-375F for 45 minutes or until golden brown.
Immediately invert onto plate.
Combine powdered sugar, cinnamon and water, stir well.
Drizzle over hot bread.
Serve warm.
5765949efb.pred:
Preheat oven to 350.
Spray a 9x13 pan with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, combine sugar, pecans, orange peel, and cinnamon.
Mix well.
Add melted butter and mix until well combined.
Press mixture into prepared pan.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Cut into squares.
Serve with cream cheese.

5bcb6c7ba1.gt:
Heat oven to 350F (325F for dark or nonstick pans).
Place paper baking cup in each of 24 regular-size muffin cups.
In small bowl, mix 1 1/2 cups pretzel, 2 T sugar and 1/4 cup melted butter or margarine until blended.
Spoon about 1 tablespoon mixture in each cup.
3In large bowl, beat cake mix, margarita mix, water, oil, egg whites and 3 tsp zest with electric mixer on low speed 30 seconds, then on medium speed 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally.
Divide batter evenly among cups (two-thirds full).
Bake 18 to 23 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool 10 minutes; remove from pan to cooling rack.
Cool completely.
In medium bowl, fold whipped topping, yogurt and 2 tsp lime zest until blended; add food coloring if desired and frost cupcakes.
Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup coarsely crushed pretzels.
Store loosely covered in refrigerator.
5bcb6c7ba1.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the crushed pretzels and melted margarine.
Mix well.
Press the pretzel mixture into the bottom of paper-lined muffin cups.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.
Cool completely.
In a medium bowl, combine the cake mix, margarita mix, oil, water, lime zest, and egg whites.
Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds.
Beat on high speed for 2 minutes.
Pour the batter into the prepared muffin cups.
Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.
Cool completely.
In a medium bowl, beat the Cool Whip and key lime yogurt with a whisk until smooth.
Fold in the green food coloring.
Fill the cupcakes with the lime cream.
Garnish with lime slices.

9c5602c4ae.gt:
In large bowl, combine first 6 ingredients.
Mix next 3 ingredients; mix well.
Pour over salad and toss well.
Chill.
9c5602c4ae.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Wash and cut broccoli and cauliflower into bite-sized pieces.
Cook bacon in a large skillet until crisp.
Drain and crumble bacon.
Add broccoli and cauliflower to the skillet and cook until tender.
Add tomatoes, onion and eggs and cook until heated through.
Combine mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar in a large bowl.
Add cooked vegetables and bacon to the mayonnaise mixture and stir to coat.
Serve warm or chilled.

0ddb710349.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
In a small bowl, beat egg with milk.
In a shallow plate or bowl, mix bread crumbs with Italian seasonings.
Dip each piece of chicken into the egg/milk mixture, then into the bread crumb mixture to coat thoroughly.
Place coated chicken in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes, depending on how thick the chicken breasts are (bake until chicken is done and juices run clear).
In the last 3 to 4 minutes of baking, sprinkle the top of the chicken pieces with cheese.
Remove from oven and serve!
0ddb710349.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a shallow dish, beat the egg and milk together.
In another shallow dish, combine the bread crumbs and Italian seasoning.
Dip each chicken breast half into the egg mixture, then into the bread crumb mixture.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes, or until cooked through.
Top with cheese and bake for 5 minutes more.

b4fd5e004b.gt:
Drain the yogurt to 1 1/2 cups: Line a strainer w/a coffee filter, add yogurt & set aside about 1 hour.
Cut off all but 1 inch of the beet stalks and leave the roots intact.
Rinse the beets well but do not peel.
Cook the beets in boiling salted water until tender, 25 to 35 minutes.
Drain, slip off the skins under cold running water, and cut away the root ends and stalks.
Coarsely grate the beets, using the shredding disk of a food processor or the large holes of a hand grater (latex gloves are recommended for the latter or you'll look like an axe murderer!
).
Combine the garlic, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a medium bowl.
Add the beets and yogurt and blend well.
Taste and add a pinch of sugar if desired.
Transfer to a serving dish, cover and refrigerate until well chilled, about 1 hour.
Garnish with sprigs of fresh mint just before serving.
b4fd5e004b.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the yogurt, beets, garlic, salt, lemon juice, pepper, and sugar.
Mix well.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Serve with a sprig of fresh mint.

9efd6dc9bd.gt:
Preheat broiler.Combine minced garlic, olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and asparagus in a large bowl, tossing gently to coat.Combine 1/4 teaspoon salt, pepper, brandy, and garlic powder; rub evenly over steaks.
Place steaks on a broiler pan coated with cooking spray; broil 6 minutes.
Turn steaks over; add asparagus to pan.
Broil 5 minutes or until desired degree of doneness.
9efd6dc9bd.pred:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Combine the garlic, olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a small bowl.
Spread the spice mixture evenly over the steaks.
Place the steaks on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.
Remove the steaks from the oven and brush with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of oil.
Return the steaks to the oven and bake for 10 minutes more.
Meanwhile, toss the asparagus with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Spray the asparagus with cooking spray and bake for 5 minutes.
Remove the asparagus from the oven and set aside.
To serve, slice the steaks and arrange on a platter with the asparagus.
Serve immediately.

fba1dcbbd2.gt:
Sift dry ingredients.
Cut in 1/4 cup of butter.
Add the cream.
Roll out on a floured board.
Cut with a 2-inch cutter.
Bake on an ungreased pan in a hot oven of 400F (200C) for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve with butter, whipped cream, and jam if desired.
fba1dcbbd2.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Mix flour, baking soda, salt, and cream of tartar in a bowl.
Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in cream.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown.

8121dfc152.gt:
Cut herring into small cubes.
Mix herring with onion, eggs, apple and lemon juice.
Combine sour cream, garlic, salt and pepper; add to herring mixture and mix well.
Sprinkle with dill or parsley.
Serve with rye bread.
8121dfc152.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the pickled herring, onion, garlic, eggs, apple, lemon juice, sour cream, salt, pepper, and dill.
Mix well.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Serve with toast.

a67add462f.gt:
Place diced carrots, onion, peppers, and garlic (not the peas yet) in a kettle with a small amount of water and curry powder.
Simmer about 5 minutes until tender.
Add zucchini, cover, and simmer 5 more minutes.
Blend all the remaining ingredients, except the peas and garboanzos or lentils, in a blender until smooth.
Add the blended ingredients, the peas, and the garbanzos or lentils to the rest of the vegetables.
Heat and serve over rice.
a67add462f.pred:
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the carrots, onions, and bell peppers.
Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add the tomato sauce, peanut butter, Braggs liquid aminos, curry powder, and garbanzo beans.
Stir to combine.
Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the cooked rice and peas.
Stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve over rice.
Garnish with cilantro if desired.

5c9b0f1426.gt:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
Rinse asparagus and snap off the tough ends.
Spray a cookie sheet and lay asparagus on it then sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Cook in a preheated oven for 8-10 minutes.
Sprinkle the blue cheese and walnuts on HOT asparagus.
Return the asparagus to the oven for an additional 1-2 minutes.
5c9b0f1426.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Wash and trim the asparagus.
Place the asparagus in a baking dish.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Roast for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and sprinkle with blue cheese.
Return to oven and roast for 5 minutes.
Remove from oven and sprinkle with walnuts.
Serve immediately.

82cd89c4d9.gt:
To steam the chicken tenders: Arrange the chicken on a plate and sprinkle on the ingredients marked with in order.
Place the rosemary (or other herb) on top, wrap it with plastic wrap and cook it at 700W for 1 minute and 30 seconds.
Turn the chicken over and cook it for another 1 minute.
The cooking time depends on the size of the chicken.
Check the chicken when you turn it over, and adjust the cooking time if necessary.
Leave the chicken, with the plastic on, until they are cool.
Shred the chicken from Step 2 with your hand.
Onions: Thinly slice the onion and soak it in water for about 10 minutes.
Drain in a colander and pat dry with paper towels.
Daikon sprout: Cut in half lengths.
In a bowl, mix the ingredients marked with to make the dressing.
Mix the chicken from Step 3 and onion from Step 4 with the dressing.
Add the daikon sprout and toss them evenly.
Serve it on a plate and garnish with the bonito flakes.
I used Cinzano Dry Vermouth; a blend of white wine with essences of herbs and spices, instead of white wine.
This flavorful drink is good for cooking and drinking.
82cd89c4d9.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the chicken tenders, shio-koji, black pepper, white wine, olive oil, rosemary, daikon sprouts, red onion, bonito flakes, ponzu, salt, and pepper.
Microwave the chicken tenders for 5 minutes, or until cooked through.
Add the daikon sprouts and cook for 1 minute.
Serve with the salad.

495600903f.gt:
Heat oven to 300 degrees F.
Place 2-L casserole dish in oven to warm.
Melt butter in large skillet on medium heat.
Add onions and garlic; cook 2 to 3 min.
or until crisp-tender, stirring frequently.
Add rice; cook and stir 2 min.
Stir in wine; cook and stir 1 min.
or until absorbed.
Add chicken and broth; stir.
Bring just to boil.
Spoon into warmed casserole dish; cover.
Bake 30 min.
or until rice is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed.
Add spinach; stir just until wilted.
Add cheese; stir until melted.
495600903f.pred:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic; cook 3 minutes or until tender.
Add rice and wine; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add broth, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly.
Cook until liquid is absorbed.
Add spinach; cook 2 minutes or until wilted.
Remove from heat.
Stir in chicken and cheese.
Spoon into a 13x9-inch baking dish.
Bake 20 minutes or until heated through.

915df993a5.gt:
put it all in the pan on high stir as needed
cook until tender and dark carmalization is apparent
915df993a5.pred:
Slice the squash into medallions.
In a large skillet, heat the bacon fat.
Add the squash medallions and cook until tender.
Season with salt.
Add the onion and cook until translucent.
Add the bacon and cook until crispy.
Sprinkle with pepper.

4f38968f4b.gt:
In a large bowl, using a fork, mix the Gorgonzola with the yogurt, olive oil, vinegar, shallot, lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
Fold in the chicken and celery and season with salt and pepper.
To serve, fill the baguette with the chicken salad, snap peas, radishes and lettuce, then cut the baguette crosswise into 4 sandwiches.
4f38968f4b.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
In a small bowl, combine Gorgonzola dolce, yogurt, oil, vinegar, shallot, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Spread mixture on chicken and bake until chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine chicken, celery, sugar snap peas, radishes, and lettuce.
Toss with dressing and serve on baguette.

31f21b4147.gt:
In a large saucepan, mix all ingredients together.
On medium heat, bring mixture to a boil.
Continue to simmer (on low-medium) heat for one hour, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and allow to cool.
Pour into mason jars and refrigerate for 12-24 hours before serving.
Enjoy cold!
31f21b4147.pred:
Pumpkin Butter:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium saucepan, combine pumpkin puree, apple cider, sugar, brown sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon, and cloves.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and stir in ginger.
Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes, or until bubbly and caramelized.
Cool slightly before serving.

063b119d92.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees .
Cook the broccoli until tender-crisp; drain very well.
Put in a greased 2-quart casserole.
Mix in the cream cheese, cheddar, green onion, salt, pepper and bacon.
Bake for 20-30 minutes, until bubbly.
063b119d92.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large skillet, cook bacon until crisp.
Remove bacon from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, saute onion and broccoli until tender.
Add cream cheese and cheddar cheese; cook until cheese is melted.
Add green onions and salt and pepper to taste.
Pour mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Top with bacon.
Bake for 20 minutes.

0ce043fd75.gt:
in small dry skittle, toast pine nuts over med heat, shaking pan often until light golden 3-5 minutes, transfer to food processor and let cool.
in heatproof bowl, cover tomatoes with 1/2 cup boiling water, soak until softened, about 10 minutes.
drain, reserving 2 tablespoons soaking liquid.
add tomatoes and reserved liquid to food processor.
add tomato paste, pepper and salt, finely chop, with motor running add oil in thin steady stream until pureed.
pulse in Parmesan cheese and garlic.
To Make again:.
Refrigerate in air tight container for up to 5 days, or freeze for up to 6 months.
0ce043fd75.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a food processor, combine the sun-dried tomatoes, pine nuts, tomato paste, pepper, salt, olive oil, and garlic.
Process until smooth.
Transfer to a bowl and stir in the Parmesan cheese.
Spread onto a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes.
Serve with crackers or bread.

09c7610724.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with Reynolds Parchment Paper and set aside.
Whisk together flour, kosher salt, baking powder and baking soda; set aside.
Mix butter, light brown sugar and granulated sugar together with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs, one at a time.
Add vanilla and beat.
Slowly add flour mixture, mixing gently until incorporated.
Fold in caramel filled chocolate candies and chocolate chips.
Roll 2 tablespoons of dough into a ball, covering any candies with dough so they are not exposed.
Place dough balls on parchment lined baking sheets.
Bake cookies for 1012 minutes.
Cool cookies on baking sheet for 5 minutes and transfer parchment paper with cookies onto wire racks to cool completely.
Drizzle cooled cookies with melted chocolate and sprinkle with sea salt.
Chill cookies until chocolate sets.
09c7610724.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and 1/2 teaspoon of the sea salt.
Set aside.
In a medium bowl, beat butter and sugars together until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs and vanilla.
Add flour mixture and mix until just combined.
Stir in chocolate chips, caramel chips, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon sea salt.
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto Reynolds Parchment Paper.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until edges are golden brown.
Cool on wire racks.
Makes 24 cookies.

b9e5fe6154.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
In small bowl, gently stir blue cheese crumbles into mashed potatoes.
Fill each pepper half with potato mixture.
Wrap each with a slice of cooked bacon and place onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
Pop into oven and bake for 5-8 minutes until bacon crisps.
Watch so that the filling doesn't ooze out.
Remove to appetizers plates and serve with sriracha sauce for dipping.
*My recipe title has less than 64 characters, but for some reason it cut off the required hashtag #SP5.
b9e5fe6154.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the Simply Potatoes Sour Cream and Chive Mashed Potatoes, blue cheese, and bacon.
Mix well.
Scoop out a small amount of the mixture and form into a ball.
Repeat with the rest of the mixture.
Place the potato balls on a baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
Serve with sriracha hot chili sauce for dipping.

8220c924d4.gt:
Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook pasta according to package directions.
Drain.
While pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
Cook onion just until softened, about 3 minutes.
Stir in the curry powder and garam masala.
Stir in the pumpkin.
Slowly pour in the chicken broth and heavy cream.
Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until thickened slightly, 3 5 minutes.
Add pasta to the sauce and toss to coat.
Stir in salt.
Add more if desired.
Transfer pasta to a serving dish, sprinkle with green onions and serve.
8220c924d4.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add curry powder and garam masala and cook for 1 minute.
Add pumpkin and chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in cream and salt.
Cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
Drain pasta and add to skillet.
Toss to coat with sauce.
Transfer to a 9x13-inch baking dish and bake until heated through, about 15 minutes.
Garnish with green onions and serve.

78d578c5e4.gt:
heat oven to 400, using a oven safe bowl, it can be a casserole dish to bake ur dip in.
it just needs to bake for 13 minutes
in a bowl put all ingredients, except 1 tablespoon of almonds, reserved till later.
mix well together, put in oven safe dish.
now sprinkle the reserved almonds on top.bake and use crackers to serve.enjoy
78d578c5e4.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees.
In a bowl, combine all ingredients except almonds.
Mix well.
Pour into a 9x13 baking dish.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Stir.
Sprinkle with almonds.
Bake for 10 minutes more.
Serve with crackers.

38b480c606.gt:
Make the cake mix as directed
Make cookie mix as directed
Pour some cake mix in cake pan.
About an inch
Place as many cooked cookies as you can in the middle
Pour remaining cake mix and bake as directed
Eat and be Fat & Happy
38b480c606.pred:
Stir together the cake mixes and the can of icing.
Pour the icing over the cake and sprinkle with the sprinkles.
Serve with a glass of milk.

f15f7c9832.gt:
Cut the chicken into thin diagonal slices, then into 1 cm strips.
Finely julienne the peppers.
Rub the shio-koji into the chicken.
Add the ingredients and rub to flavor the chicken.
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Spread the chicken and cook over high heat until the edges turn white.
Flip over, and brown both sides.
Add the peppers and shio-konbu and stir fry quickly.
Swirl in the sake and it's done!
f15f7c9832.pred:
In a large skillet, heat oil and saute chicken until cooked through.
Add green peppers and saute for 2 minutes.
Add shio-koji, sake, soy sauce, katakuriko, and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve with rice.

57f1deb064.gt:
Heat oven to 400F.
In a large bowl, combine the mustard, vinegar, 2 tablespoons of the oil, the garlic, tarragon, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Add the chicken and toss to coat.
Place the chicken in a roasting pan and roast until cooked through, about 45 minutes.
During the last 15 minutes of roasting, cook the noodles according to the package directions.
Drain and return to the pot.
Add the parsley and the remaining oil and toss to coat.
Transfer the chicken to individual plates.
Place the pan containing the drippings over medium-high heat.
Add the wine and cook, stirring and scraping the bits from the bottom of the pan, until the wine reduces slightly, about 5 minutes.
Divide the noodles among the plates and spoon the sauce over the top.
57f1deb064.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the mustard, vinegar, oil, garlic, tarragon, salt and pepper.
Mix well.
Add the chicken pieces and toss to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Place the chicken in a roasting pan and roast for 1 hour.
Remove from the oven and let rest for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook the egg noodles according to package directions.
Drain and set aside.
Add the wine to the chicken and roast for 15 minutes.
Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
Add the parsley to the pan and cook for 1 minute.
Add the chicken back to the pan and toss to coat.
Serve the chicken with the egg noodles.

0f717fcce7.gt:
Bring a pot of water to the boil, add the oranges, cover and simmer for one hour.
Stain off the water.
Cool the oranges.
If you are in a hurry, I suggest you partly cool them -- (this will still work).
While they are cooling, food process the sugar with the eggs until the sugar is dissolved and pour into a bowl.
Cut the oranges in half and de-seed them and put the oranges (with peel and pith) into a food processor and pulp until reasonably smooth.
Pour the pulp into the sugar/egg mix and add the almond meal.
Gently mix together.
Pour mix into baking paper lined 24 - 26cm springform tin and bake for 50 - 60 minutes at 185C.
Serve with creme fraiche, whipped cream, or vanilla ice-cream -- makes an awesome dessert.
You could drizzle a little citrus liqueur around the plate.
Added thoughts -- This cake DOES NOT need any syrup poured over it.
NB.Simply double this recipe to get two large cakes.
It is just as successful.
Occasionally, I will add a slurp of Grand Marnier, Contreau, or Galliano; however, try it plain initially.
0f717fcce7.pred:
Preheat oven to 180C.
In a large bowl, beat eggs with sugar until light and fluffy.
Add almond meal and mix well.
Add orange juice and zest.
Pour into a greased 20cm round cake tin.
Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes.
Let cool in the tin for 10 minutes.
Remove from tin and cool on a wire rack.

62bf8025cc.gt:
Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium high heat.
Add the onion and saute for three minutes, then add the garlic.
Continue cooking until the onions are soft, 1-2 minutes more.
Add the water and bring to a boil.
Add the jalapenos and carrots and cook for 5 minutes, until slightly softened.
Add the cider vinegar, 1 tbsp pickling salt, oregano and bay leaves and simmer for 1 minute.
Remove from heat and allow to cool completely.
Transfer the jalapenos, carrots and onions with slotted spoon or tongs into sterilized glass quart-sized jars.
Throw away the bay leaves.
Cover the vegetables with the cooking liquid until the jars are three-quarters full.
Add 1 tbsp pickling salt to each jar and fill to the top with white vinegar.
Cap each jar tightly and store in the refrigerator for up to several months.
The pickled vegetables can be used starting one week later.
62bf8025cc.pred:
In a large saucepan, heat the oil and add the onion.
Saute until soft and translucent.
Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute.
Add the carrots and cook for 10 minutes.
Add the water, jalapeno chiles, and vinegar and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add the salt, oregano, and bay leaves.
Simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove the bay leaves.
Add the vinegar and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot.

3af2ae11f5.gt:
Combine salt, pepper, chili powder and bay leaves.
Rub meat completely with liquid Smoke.
Place meat, fat side up, in a large roasting pan.
Sprinkle dry seasoning mixture on top.
Cover tightly.
Bake for 3 1/2 to 4 hours at 325 degrees.
Scrape seasoning off meat and cut in very thin slices across the grain.
Serve with barbecue sauce.
To make sauce, combine all ingredients.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Cook for 10 minutes.
Serve with sliced brisket.
3af2ae11f5.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the first 10 ingredients.
Rub the brisket with the spice mixture and place in a slow cooker.
Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours.
Remove the brisket from the slow cooker and place on a cutting board.
Cut the meat into thin slices.
Serve with the barbecue sauce.
Serve with the barbecue sauce.

db5fd3bd93.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 F.
In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the bacon until almost cooked, but not too crisp.
Remove bacon from the skillet with a slotted spoon and place it in a large bowl.
Drain all but about 1 tablespoon of the bacon grease from the skillet and discard it or use it for another purpose.
Add the onion and green pepper into the skillet, if using.
Saute for a few minutes to soften.
Add them into the large bowl with the bacon.
Into the large bowl add the undrained pork and beans, the 2 cans of rinsed and drained beans and the rest of the ingredients and mix well.
Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish.
Cover the dish with a sheet of foil and bake at 325 F for 45 minutes.
Uncover and continue baking for 20-25 more minutes.
Cooks Notes: Sometime I will add a chipotle chile with a little of the adobo sauce that has been finely diced.
You know I cant get enough of those!
It is also delicious to turn them into cowboy beans (what Nanny called them) and add cooked ground beef or sausage.
db5fd3bd93.pred:
In a large saucepan, cook bacon until crisp.
Remove bacon and drain on paper towels.
Discard all but 3 tablespoons of the bacon drippings.
Add onion and pepper and cook until tender.
Add pork and beans, undrained, and cook until heated through.
Add barbecue sauce, ketchup, picante sauce, molasses, maple syrup, brown sugar, liquid smoke, mustard, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt.
Stir to combine.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, for 1 hour.
Add beans and cook for 15 minutes more.
Serve hot.

85b79cc54f.gt:
In a large skillet over medium heat, add meatless ground burger, water and spices.
Mix well and let simmer for 10-15 minutes until heated through and water is absorbed.
Use this mixture to replace the seasoned ground beef in any of your favorite Mexican recipes!
Another note* One can use 1 cup of TVP in place of the soy crumbles or Boca.
You might need a bit more that 1 cup of water to keep mixture from getting too dry.
85b79cc54f.pred:
Brown the meat in a skillet.
Add the onion, bouillon, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, and cayenne pepper.
Cook for 5 minutes.
Add the water and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the vegetarian ground beef and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with taco shells and your favorite toppings.

1432c540ac.gt:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. In a bowl, whisk the canola oil, vinegar, miso, ginger, sesame oil, honey, lime zest, and lime juice until smooth.
Season with salt.
On a rimmed baking sheet, toss the tomatoes with 3 tablespoons of the miso dressing and season with salt.
Roast for 20 minutes, stirring, until the tomatoes are charred in spots.
Scrape into a large bowl.
Cook the soba noodles in boiling water just until al dente, 4 minutes.
Drain and cool the noodles under cold running water.
Add the soba noodles, scallions, and half of the remaining dressing to the tomatoes and toss well.
Season with salt, transfer to a platter, and garnish with the sesame seeds.
Serve with the remaining dressing.Looking for vegetable recipes?
Try our best asparagus recipes, eggplant recipes, or zucchini recipes.
1432c540ac.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the ginger and toasted sesame oil and cook for 1 minute.
Add the miso and lime zest and cook for 1 minute.
Add the lime juice and cook for 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the scallions and cook for 1 minute.
Add the soba noodles and cook for 1 minute.
Add the vinegar and salt and cook for 1 minute.
Serve with the sesame seeds.

44b3907e95.gt:
Combine all the cupcake ingredients in a bowl and mix until smooth.
If you want them to be more pink, add a bit of red food coloring.
Fill lined cupcake tin 2/3 of the way full.
Bake cupcakes at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes.
Combine Frosting ingredients and beat until smooth.
When cupcakes are cooled, topped with frosting.
Top them off with a maraschino cherry.
44b3907e95.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease 12 muffin cups.
In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs, one at a time, then stir in cherry juice and baking powder.
Stir in flour and salt.
Divide batter evenly among muffin cups.
Bake for 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 5 minutes, then remove from pan and cool completely.
For frosting, in a large bowl, beat butter until creamy.
Add powdered sugar and beat until smooth.
Add food coloring and beat until desired color is reached.
Add chocolate chips and stir until combined.
Frost cupcakes and top with maraschino cherries.

72d89ed4de.gt:
Place all of the ingredients in a medium bowl; stir until they are combined, and transfer to an airtight container for storage.
Season popcorn to taste.
72d89ed4de.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
Store in an airtight container.
Use 1/2 teaspoon of the seasoning mix for each kernel of popcorn.
Place popcorn in a large bowl and toss with 1/2 teaspoon of the seasoning mix.
Store in an airtight container.
Repeat until all popcorn is seasoned.

856a830dc7.gt:
Soak cucumber in cold salted (1 tsp) water for 5 minutes.
Drain and squeeze well.
Bring the water to a boil, add beanstarch vermicelli and cook according to the directions on the package.
Cut into bite sized pieces.
Mix all ingredients and marinate.
856a830dc7.pred:
Mix together in a bowl.
Marinate for 1 hour.
Drain and rinse.
Heat up a pan and add in the vermicelli.
Fry until crispy.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve with salad.

6cd8583372.gt:
Simmer all ingredients in covered saucepan over low heat 20 minutes.
Strain out solids before serving.
6cd8583372.pred:
In a large saucepan, combine the apple cider, quince, brown sugar, cinnamon stick, and cloves.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat, add the nutmeg and stir to dissolve.
Serve hot.

c7ae046d51.gt:
Place buttermilk, butter or margarine, sugar, salt, flour, whole wheat flour, and yeast into pan of bread machine.
Bake on White Bread setting.
Cool on wire racks before slicing.
c7ae046d51.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
In a large bowl, combine the buttermilk, margarine, sugar, salt, and yeast.
Add the bread flour and whole wheat flour and stir until combined.
Stir in enough additional flour to make a soft dough.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 8 minutes.
Place the dough in the prepared pan and cover with a clean towel.
Let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Bake the bread in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack.

3fcf600832.gt:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
In a small bowl, add balsamic vinegar, brown sugar and chicken broth; mix well, set aside.
Rinse pork and pat dry and season with salt and pepper.
In an oven proof skillet, add olive oil and pork.
Sear pork until all sides are seared and lightly brown, about 10 minutes.
Remove pork from pan.
In the same pan over medium low heat, add the balsamic vinegar mixture and stir to loosen up all the brown bits from bottom of pan.
Stir and cook until it resembles a glaze.
Place pork back in pan and turn to coat until all sides are covered with balsamic mixture.
Place in the oven and roast for 25 minutes or until pork is no longer pink.
When pork is done, remove from pan and cover for about 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a skillet, add butter and pears and cook over medium low heat until pears are tender, about 10 minutes.
Just before you take the pears off the stove, add a splash of Stella Artois Cidre and mix well.
Cut pork into 4 equal sizes.
Place 1/2 cup of sweet mashed potatoes on each plate, place the pork over the sweet potatoes, and lay pears over pork.
Sprinkle with goat cheese.
3fcf600832.pred:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a small bowl, combine the vinegar, brown sugar, chicken broth and salt and pepper.
Season the pork with salt and pepper.
Heat the olive oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the pork and brown on all sides.
Transfer the pork to a roasting pan and pour the vinegar mixture over the top.
Roast for 20 minutes, then reduce the heat to 350 degrees F and continue roasting for 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and let rest for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat the skillet over medium-high heat and add the diced pears.
Saute until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the sweet potatoes and cider and cook until the potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
To serve, slice the pork and place on a bed of mashed sweet potatoes.
Top with the sauteed pears and sweet potatoes.
Garnish with goat cheese crumbles and serve.

16241b3374.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and move a rack to the middle of the oven.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside.
Combine the peanut butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar, vanilla extract and egg in a large bowl and stir until fully combined.
Form 24 balls, 1-inch in diameter, and set evenly spaced apart on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake until lightly browned and crisp on the edges, 15 minutes.
Remove the cookies from the oven, and cool for 5 minutes.
Use your thumb or the back of a spoon to press into the middle of each cookie to create an indent about 1/4-inch deep.
Spoon 1/2 teaspoon of the chocolate-hazelnut spread into each cookie indent, refrigerate until the chocolate-hazelnut filling is no longer runny, 10 to 15 minutes.
Cook's Notes: These tasty cookies last for up to 2 weeks.
16241b3374.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, cream together peanut butter, sugars, and vanilla.
Beat in egg.
Stir in flour, baking soda, and salt.
Shape dough into 1-inch balls.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Press thumb into center of each ball.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool 2 minutes on cookie sheet; remove to wire racks to cool completely.

2af4ecd0e3.gt:
Mix butter, margarine, flour, sugar, vanilla together.
Keep dough in refrigerator overnight.
After the dough has refrigerated overnight, take it out of the fridge, and start making small balls (a little smaller than a golf ball I use a Tablespoon full) out of the dough.
After you make your balls, roll each one out into a flat disc, and add hoop cheese and nuts and a Tablespoon of preserves (or more if youd like) into the center of the disc.
Then roll the discs up.
Seal edges by pinching them together (you can add a little water too, if you need some adhesive) and bake at 350 degrees F until golden brown (roughly 8 10 minutes).
*Hoop cheese is also known as farmers cheese.
2af4ecd0e3.pred:
Combine first 5 ingredients in large bowl.
Mix well.
Shape into 1 inch balls.
Roll in nuts.
Place in ungreased 13x9x2 inch pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.
Combine preserves and 1/2 cup water.
Drizzle over warm cookies.
Bake 2 to 3 minutes longer.
Cool.
Store in tightly covered container.

b5234384e0.gt:
Heat oven to 325
Sautee onion and celery
Cook noodles as directed.
Mix tuna with mayo and soup.
Once noodles are cooked mix into tuna and mayo mix.
Spoon into casserole dish.
Sprinkle crumbled potato chips on top.
Bake for 30 mins or until potato chips are browned.
b5234384e0.pred:
In a small casserole dish, combine the tuna, soup, mayo, and noodles.
Top with the crushed potato chips.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

587189f28c.gt:
Okay.. so, not everyone is going to be extremely lucky like we were and have their friends spend over 12 hours smoking a pork shoulder with pineapple injection and giving you a Tupperware full to go home with...
But if you are or you know how to smoke your own.. this recipe is super exciting.
Spread out some delicious, crunchy tortilla chips, (I used Calidad brand) on a small baking sheet and cover with shredded cheese of your choice,( again, I used marble cheddar), be thorough, every hates a cheeseless chip.
Put in oven on 350 for about 3-4 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Take chips out of the oven and sprinkle with sliced black olives
Add a moderate layer of refried beans and another layer of cheese and stick back in the oven for 2 minutes
Sprinkle with Tapatio(or your favorite hot sauce
Spread a layer of your shredded meat and another layer of cheese.
Place back in oven for two more minutes.
Get out your salsa, sour cream and guacamole!
I just sliced up an avocado :P. Its time to eat!
587189f28c.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the tortilla chips, cheese, olives, and meat.
Mix well.
Add the Tapatio hot sauce and refried beans.
Mix again.
Spread the mixture onto a large baking sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.
Serve with a side of sour cream.

bf7afbd2d2.gt:
In a large mixing bowl combine lettuce, carrots, cilantro, olive oil, lime juice, and salt and pepper to taste.
Lay out tortillas and divide mixture among tortillas; top with turkey breast strips.
Fold in half and enjoy.
Serves 2.
bf7afbd2d2.pred:
Mix all ingredients except the turkey and tortillas.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the carrots and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the turkey and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
Add the lettuce and cilantro and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve with the tortillas.

48d0d21f53.gt:
Stir in a mixing glass with ice.
Strain into a cocktail glass.
48d0d21f53.pred:
Place all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice.
Shake well and strain into a chilled coupe.
Garnish with a cherry.

d99c985b0e.gt:
Combine all ingredients.
except the sesame seeds.
Cover and refrigerate mixture for 15 to 20 minutes.
Add sesame seeds.
(If desired).
mix well.
Serve over salad.
d99c985b0e.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and whisk until well blended.
Store in a tightly covered jar in the refrigerator.
Use as a salad dressing.

8a45727c6f.gt:
Remove stems from mushrooms.
Make a light mushroom broth by simmering stems in 2 cups water for 15 minutes, then strain and reserve broth (discard stems).
Dice mushroom caps and set aside.
Cut tofu into 1-inch cubes.
Cover with boiling salted water, let steep for 15 minutes, then drain.
Put oil in a wok or wide skillet over medium heat.
Add red peppers, black beans and bean paste and cook, stirring until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add garlic and ginger and let sizzle, then add mushrooms, soy sauce, sesame oil and Sichuan pepper.
Add 1 1/2 cups mushroom broth and cook mixture gently for 2 minutes.
Carefully add tofu cubes.
Shake pan to distribute sauce, using a wooden spoon to help.
Try to avoid smashing tofu.
Drizzle in cornstarch mixture, gently swirling pan to incorporate (sauce will thicken) and simmer tofu in sauce for 2 minutes more.
Thin with a little mushroom broth if necessary.
Transfer to a low bowl or platter.
Sprinkle with scallions and cilantro sprigs.
8a45727c6f.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are softened and lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the water and bring to a boil.
Add the tofu and cook, stirring occasionally, until it is softened and the water has evaporated, about 10 minutes.
Add the peppers, doubanjiang, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, and Sichuan pepper.
Stir well and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the corn- or potato starch mixture and stir until it thickens slightly, about 2 minutes.
Remove from the heat and stir in the scallions.
Serve hot, garnished with cilantro.

dfa22ec3cd.gt:
Combine (sift, if possible) the whole wheat flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder.
Add the olive oil to the dry ingredients and mix until crumbly.
Add the milk a little at a time, kneading until it forms a dough.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap, then chill in the refrigerator for 20 to 30 minutes.
If you're in a hurry, you can skip this step.
Dust your working surface with flour, then knead the dough, just a little bit.
Do not knead too much.
Evenly spread out the dough, then cut into desired shapes.
I use a cup to cut them into circles!
Then all you need to do is bake them for 20 minutes in an oven preheated to 170C.
Keep an eye on the oven and adjust the baking time.
They're done!
If they don't taste sweet enough, serve them with maple syrup or your choice of sweetener.
Have them for breakfast.
I found them delightful.
dfa22ec3cd.pred:
Heat oven to 200C.
Mix together flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and olive oil.
Add milk and mix until dough is soft and pliable.
Turn out onto a floured surface and knead lightly.
Roll out to 1/2 inch thickness.
Cut into 6 wedges.
Place on a baking sheet and brush with milk.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve warm with butter.

bd3bd0a131.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large bowl, cream together margarine, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in the eggs and vanilla.
In a separate bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add to egg mixture, and mix well.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Instead of just dropping them onto the cookie sheet, I roll the cookies into balls - it makes them all look very uniform and nice!
Bake in preheated oven for 12 to15 minutes, or until light brown.
Cool on a wire rack.
bd3bd0a131.pred:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a large bowl, cream together margarine, white sugar, and brown sugar.
Beat in vanilla and eggs.
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt; add to creamed mixture and mix well.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool on cookie sheets 1 minute; remove to wire racks to cool completely.

9b3acc9089.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with two long sheets of Reynolds Wrap Aluminum Foil, overlapping them in opposing directions so you make a cross, with plenty of foil at each end to eventually fold over into the center.
Lightly spray with cooking spray and set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, stir together cream, shallot and garlic.
Add parsnips, sweet potato and turnip and carefully toss together until all the pieces are well coated.
In another mixing bowl combine 1 cup of cheese, green onion and thyme and toss together.
To assemble, place a single layer of cream-coated root vegetable pieces onto the foil-lined baking sheet and season generously with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle 1/4 of the cheese mixture over the surface.
Repeat with another layer of vegetables, salt and pepper and cheese mixture and continue with this pattern until all the ingredients have been used (finishing with a layer of vegetables).
Bring each side of the excess foil hanging over the baking sheet together and seal tightly, leaving room for heat circulation inside.
Bake gratin in the oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until vegetables are fork tender.
Open foil carefully by cutting along top fold with a sharp knife, allowing steam to escape; then open top of foil.
Uncover gratin and sprinkle remaining cheese over the top.
Place gratin under a broiler and broil for 30 seconds to 1 minute or until cheese has melted and the top has browned slightly.
Allow gratin to cool for about 10 minutes before cutting up and serving.
9b3acc9089.pred:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Place the root vegetables in a large baking dish.
Drizzle with 1 cup of the heavy cream.
Sprinkle with the shallot, garlic, and thyme.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cover with Reynolds Wrap Aluminum Foil.
Bake for 1 hour.
Remove foil and bake for 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup of Gruyere cheese.
Return to oven and bake until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve immediately.

32d7fb7310.gt:
To roast vegetables: Preheat oven to 400.
Wrap peeled garlic cloves together in foil with a few drops of olive oil and put in oven for the same time you will be roasting the peppers and potatoes, around 35 minutes.
Cut potatoes in half and cut red peppers into half inch pieces.
In a large bowl, toss potatoes, bell peppers and 3 TBS olive oil, along with salt and pepper to taste.
Arrange potatoes and bell peppers in one layer, divided amongst 2 shallow baking pans.
Roast in the middle and lower third of the oven, switching positions of the pans halfway through the roasting time, for a total of 35 minutes, or until potatoes are golden brown and tender.
To make salad: After potatoes are done,remove pans from oven and immediately toss roasted potatoes and peppers with 2 TBS balsamic vinegar.
Cool and remove garlic from foil.
Squeeze cloves into a small bowl and mash with a fork with remaining 1/2 TBS olive oil and 1 TBS balsamic vinegar.
Toss together with potatoes and peppers.
Just before serving, add fresh basil.
Serve at room temperature.
Optional items you could add for a main dish meal: goat cheese, toasted pine nuts, grilled chicken, grilled tuna, etc.
32d7fb7310.pred:
In a large bowl, toss potatoes with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil.
Place in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool.
In a large bowl, toss potatoes with remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil, red bell pepper, basil, salt and pepper.
Cover and refrigerate until chilled.
Serve with balsamic vinegar.

bf91ac4066.gt:
Saute onion in vegetable oil until clear.
Add all other ingredients and simmer for 10mins
Puree with hand mixer until smooth
bf91ac4066.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Marinate for 24 hours.
Grill over medium heat until sauce is reduced to a glaze.

97ad761304.gt:
Preheat oven to 250 degrees.
Grease a springform pan; dust with cocoa.
Line bottom with kitchen parchment.
In 2 qt saucepan over low heat, melt chocolate with butter.
In large bowl, with wire whisk beat egg yolks and vanilla.
Slowly beat warm chocolate mixture into yolk mixture until blended.
In small bowl with mixer at high speed, beat egg whites until soft peaks form.
Gradually beat in 1/4 cup powdered sugar until sugar dissolves and whites stand in stiff peaks.
Fold beaten egg whites into chocolate mixture, one third at a time.
Spoon batter into pan spreading evenly.
Bake torte 1 hour or until toothpick inserted in center comes out almost clean.
Cool torte in pan.
When torte is cool, remove side of pan then remove torte from pan bottom; discard parchment.
Cut torte in 12 wedges.
Sprinkle 6 wedges with cocoa, remaining 6 wedges with confectioners sugar.
Arrange wedges alternately on cake plate.
97ad761304.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Grease a 9-inch springform pan.
Line bottom of pan with parchment paper.
Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine chocolate and butter.
Microwave on high for 1 minute.
Stir until chocolate is melted.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add vanilla.
Beat until smooth.
Add confectioners' sugar.
Beat until smooth.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack.
Remove sides of pan.
Cut into wedges.

887374647e.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Lightly grease one 9x13 inch pan.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, flour, baking soda, vanilla, butter or margarine, honey and brown sugar.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Lightly press mixture into the prepared pan.
Bake at 325 degrees F for 18 to 22 minutes or until golden brown.
Let cool for 10 minutes then cut into bars.
Let bars cool completely in pan before removing or serving.
887374647e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Line a 9x13 inch baking pan with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine oats, flour, baking soda, and vanilla.
In a medium bowl, melt butter and honey together.
Add butter mixture to oat mixture and stir until combined.
Stir in brown sugar and chocolate chips.
Press mixture into prepared pan.
Bake for 15 minutes, then remove from oven and let cool completely.
Cut into bars and store in an airtight container.

d939f3ae1c.gt:
Use cooking spray and heat garlic and ginger over medium-high heat till golden brown.
Stir in tomato sauce, coriander, cumin, pepper, masala, salt, and reduce heat to low.
Partially cover and summer for 8-9 minutes stirring frequently.
Stir in spinach.
Simmer 8-10 minutes until spinach turns olive green.
Stir in whipping cream.
Stir in cheese.
Simmer for 3-4 minutes or until cheese is hot and remove from stove.
d939f3ae1c.pred:
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
Add garlic and ginger and cook until garlic is golden.
Add tomato sauce, spinach, and panir.
Cook until spinach is wilted.
Add cream and whipping cream and stir.
Add garam masala, coriander, cumin, red cayenne pepper, and salt.
Cook for 5 minutes.
Serve over rice.

fc1f93e1ef.gt:
Preheat oven to 325F.
Crumble the ginger snaps in a food processor and add the melted butter.
Use this mixture to line a deep pie plate or spring form pan.
Bake this at 325F for 19 minutes.
Beat the egg yolks well, and add the sugar.
Soak the gelatin in the cold water and heat gently over low flame until fully dissolved.
Pour over sugar and egg mixture, stirring briskly.
Whip the cream until stiff.
Fold in the egg mixture and flavor with the rum.
Cool in the refrigerator until mixture begins to set and pour into the pie shell.
