Add eggs and mix with a fork to combine.
Add all the dry ingredients and mix with a large spoon or spatula to combine (no need to break out the mixer for this one!).
Now add your sour cream and vanilla.
Divide mixture between your 2 loaf pans.
(Its ok that it only fills them each 1/2 way upthis loaf will rise!
I made the mistake once of putting all the batter in one pan.
Total overflow to the max!)
For the streusel topping, combine brown sugar, white sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl.
Sprinkle generously on top of each unbaked loaf.
Bake at 325 degrees for about an hour (check after 50 minutes in case your oven runs hot), until a toothpick inserted in center of the loaf comes out clean.
This banana bread is so moist and flavorful, youll never look back!
d899465f16.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
Mash bananas.
In a large bowl, mix bananas, sugar, butter, eggs, flour, baking soda, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, sour cream, vanilla, brown sugar, and white sugar.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
Remove from pan and cool completely.

794b47fa63.gt:
Saute onions in a small amount of oil until translucent.
Add garlic and ginger and saute until fragrant.
Add the rest of the ingredients except the prawns.
Bring to a boil.
Turn down the heat and add the prawns.
Simmer until the prawns turn pink and are cooked through.
794b47fa63.pred:
Place the onions, garlic, ginger, chili powder, cayenne, tomato paste, coconut milk, sugar, salt and pepper in a large pot.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the prawns and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with rice.

b1e11bd33e.gt:
Toss zucchini and salt together in a large colander and place in sink to drain for 10 minutes.
Put zucchini in the middle of a piece of cheesecloth; wrap cheesecloth around zucchini and squeeze to drain as much moisture from zucchini as possible.
Mix flour, Parmesan cheese, egg, garlic, kosher salt, and pepper together in a large bowl.
Stir in zucchini.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Scoop batter by the tablespoon into the hot skillet and fry until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side.
b1e11bd33e.pred:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
Mix zucchini, salt, flour, Parmesan cheese, egg, garlic, and seasonings.
Drop by teaspoonfuls into hot oil in a large skillet.
Cook over medium heat 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve warm.

f1113a39b1.gt:
put bread on plate and spread mustard on all 4 pieces
put pan on stove n heat on medium , spray pay with cooking spray then put in bologna one at a time and it will bubble up like a hat , press down with a spatula then turn over and continue doing the same thing .
put bologna on the bread prepared with mustard and put the cheese on that make another piece of bologna and put on top of cheese then top with the other slice of bread
make other sandwich the same way then eat with your favorite beverage
f1113a39b1.pred:
Spread the mustard on the bread.
Place 2 slices of cheese on the bread.
Place 4 slices of bologna on the cheese.
Fold the bread over the bologna and cheese.
Fry the sandwich in a pan until the bread is golden brown.

a1302a9a8e.gt:
In a large saucepan, combine the chicken broth and whipping cream.
Bring to a boil.
Add the grits, and return to boiling.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer 5-7 minutes.
Add the cheese, stirring until melted.
Allow to sit for about 10 minutes.
Serve.
a1302a9a8e.pred:
Place the chicken broth, whipping cream, and grits in a large saucepan.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly.
Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring frequently, until grits are tender and creamy, about 20 minutes.
Stir in the cheese and cook until melted and the grits are well blended, about 5 minutes.
Serve immediately.

6e7daaa7a7.gt:
In large bowl, mix ground beef, bread crumbs, and onion soup mix.
Form into meatballs.
Place in 9x13" pan.
In saucepan, combine chili sauce, cranberry sauce, sauerkraut, brown sugar and water.
Simmer over low heat till mixed.
Pour over meatballs.
Bake at 325 for 2 hours.
6e7daaa7a7.pred:
Cut the beef into small pieces and place in a large bowl.
Add the bread crumbs and onion soup mix.
Mix well.
Form into balls and place on a baking sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.
Serve with chili sauce and cranberry sauce.

df687bb6ec.gt:
Spray a 9x14 casserole dish with cooking spray.
Place the chicken in the casserole dish.
Mix all remaining ingredients in a bowl.
Pour over chicken breasts in dish.
Bake at 350 degrees (F) for 30 minutes.
Serve with potatoes or egg noodles.
df687bb6ec.pred:
To make the sauce:Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium saucepan, combine the soup, sun dried tomatoes, mushrooms, onion, vinegar, garlic, bacon, sage, oregano, roasted garlic seasoning, basil, and water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in the chicken and cook for 10 minutes or until chicken is done.
Serve over rice.

0213dcf418.gt:
Heat non stick skillet.
Tear a circle out of the center of bread.
Spread a very, very thin layer of mayo to both sides of bread.
Place the bread in the skillet; add a very small amount of butter in the hole.
Crack the egg into the hole in the bread.
Cook egg till set and bread is browned turn over and brown the other side and egg is done to your desire.
Salt and pepper to taste and enjoy!
J.R. liked to put a little maple syrup on his.
You can also toast the holes you tear out of the bread in the pan while egg is cooking and serve on the side.
0213dcf418.pred:
Place the bread on a plate.
Cut the bread in half.
Mix the egg and butter together.
Spread the mixture on the bread.
Top with the mayonnaise.
Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

b305dd0b36.gt:
Combine and store in an air-tight container.
Notes: To make taco meat, brown 1 lb ground beef in skillet; drain.
Add seasoning mix and 3/4 cup of water.
Bring to a boil then reduce heat.
Simmer uncovered, 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
b305dd0b36.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a small bowl.
Store in an airtight container.
Use 1/4 teaspoon of the seasoning mixture for every 1/2 cup of taco meat.
Makes 1/2 cup seasoning mixture.

e3cdb21cdf.gt:
In a large pot with boiling salted water cook spaghetti pasta until al dente.
Drain.
Meanwhile, in a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion, garlic, basil, sliced mushrooms, and chopped tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in California-style vegetables, salt, and ground black pepper.
Cook for approximately 10 minutes, stirring often, until vegetables are tender and crisp.
Pour vegetable mixture over cooked and drained pasta.
Toss well.
Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese and serve.
e3cdb21cdf.pred:
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic; cook and stir 1 minute.
Add mushrooms, tomatoes, and vegetables; cook and stir 5 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Add spaghetti; cook and stir 3 minutes or until heated through.
Season with salt and pepper; sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

0ce6309a49.gt:
Preheat the oven broiler.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
Add linguine, and cook for 9 to 13 minutes or until al dente; drain.
Brush the mushrooms with 1/2 the olive oil, and arrange on a medium baking sheet.
Broil in the prepared oven 6 to 8 minutes, turning frequently, until browned and tender.
Cut the mushrooms into 1/4 inch slices, and place in a medium bowl.
Mix with the remaining olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, basil, rosemary, garlic, and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, toss together cooked linguine and the mushroom mixture.
0ce6309a49.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the mushrooms and cook until they are soft and golden brown, about 5 minutes.
Add the vinegar and cook for 1 minute.
Add the oregano, basil, rosemary, and salt and pepper to taste.
Cook for 1 minute.
Add the pasta and cook until al dente, stirring frequently.
Add the lemon juice and toss to coat.
Serve immediately.

6a751b3cb8.gt:
Crumble the tofu and chop the vegetables.
You can also use other vegetables you like, such as spinach, kale, bell pepper, black olives, broccoli, onion.
Put a little splash of extra virgin olive oil in a pan on medium heat and saute mushrooms and asparagus (or whatever veggies you are using that take a little longer to cook).
Once they are cooked and starting to brown, set aside for a few minutes.
Add a little more oil to the pan to prevent the tofu from sticking.
Add tofu crumbles, and start with 1 teaspoon ground turmeric, adding more if needed.
Mix together until turmeric is evenly dispersed and tofu is a nice yellow egg-y color.
Add cheese shreds and nutritional yeast (adds more cheesiness) to the tofu and mix until cheese starts to melt.
Add all veggies to the pan, including sauteed mushrooms and asparagus.
Gently mix in salt, pepper, and garlic powder to taste.
6a751b3cb8.pred:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the tofu and cook until it is golden brown, about 5 minutes.
Add the asparagus, mushrooms, tomato, avocado, turmeric, and salt and pepper.
Cook until the asparagus is tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the cheese and nutritional yeast and stir until the cheese is melted.
Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish and bake for 20 minutes.
Serve hot.

ef00415f9c.gt:
Wash the rice and leave for 30 minutes.
This is 900 g of asari clams with shells.
Steam the clams in sake and remove the meat from the shells.
Save the soup left behind from steaming the clams.
Refer to steps 6 - 9 to find out how to steam the clams with sake.
Add the washed rice to the rice cooker, along with the soup we took in step 3, cooking sake and soy sauce.
Fill with water until you reach the 2 cups mark (or however much liquid you would normally use for the amount of rice you want), and cook the rice.
Once the rice has cooked, add the clam meat and let them steam for a while.
How to steam clams: Add the asari clams to a frying pan, pour over some cooking sake, put on the lid, and steam-cook on a low-medium heat.
If you overcook the clams the meat will shrink so take them off the heat as soon as they start to open up.
This is how they look when they're opened.
Take a look at this related recipe too Fukagawa Don (Rice bowl).
ef00415f9c.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a pot.
Bring to a boil.
Cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve with a side of soy sauce.

ea93239d44.gt:
In a 3 cup or larger bowl, whisk the 1st 8 ingredients to combine.
Gradually add olive oil in a stream & whisk to combine well.
Add salt & pepper to taste & refrigerate for 24 hrs to allow flavors to blend.
NOTE: I use a wide-mouth jar w/screw-on lid + my immersion blender to make & store this in a single step.
TO SERVE: Simplicity is the most-favored presentation - as a bruschetta-type appy where 1/2-in slices of baguette bread are spread w/cream cheese, topped w/very thinly sliced smoked salmon & then this sauce is spread over the salmon slices.
A few tiny capers can be centered as an opt garnish.
HINT: For never fail perfect slicing of smoked salmon, freeze the salmon to a near frozen state & use your sharpest knife to shave slices of desired thickness.
ea93239d44.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the honey, brown sugar, mustard, lemon juice, dill, coriander, sour cream, olive oil, salt and pepper.
Mix well.
Pour the mixture over the gravlax and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Serve with rye bread.

6ec14869d3.gt:
In a nonstick pan over medium heat, heat the oil.
Saute the garlic until soft; add the bell pepper, rosemary, and 1 tablespoon of parsley and saute 5 minutes longer.
Add the tomatoes; bring to a boil then reduce the heat and simmer, stir frequently for 10 minutes.
Add the chickpeas and cook, stirring occasionally, until heated through (5 minutes).
Stir in the ditalini, cheese and remaining parsley.
Top with a little more shredded cheese.
6ec14869d3.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil.
Add the garlic and red pepper and saute for 1 minute.
Add the rosemary and parsley and saute for 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes, chickpeas, and pasta.
Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve with shredded parmesan cheese.

8132be5a91.gt:
Heat 4 tablespoons of the oil in a large heavy-bottom soup pan.
Add garlic and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the drained chickpeas, water, cumin and coriander.
Bring to boiling, then reduce heat and simmer for 2 1/2 hours or until tender.
Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a separate pan.
Add the vegetables, cover and cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, for 20 minutes.
Stir the vegetable mixture into the chickpeas.
Transfer half the soup to a food processor or blender and process until smooth.
Return the puree to the pan, then add half the lemon juice.
Taste and adjust lemon juice.
Season with S&P.
Heat through.
Ladle into warm bowls and sprinkle with the chopped fresh cilantro and garnish with cilantro sprigs.
8132be5a91.pred:
In a large saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the garlic and cook, stirring, until the garlic is softened, about 1 minute.
Add the chickpeas, water, cumin, coriander, carrots, onions, celery, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for 1 hour.
Remove from the heat and let cool slightly.
Stir in the cilantro and serve.

ad5d547737.gt:
Cut each cheese piece into 4 chunks; cut each cucumber half into 8 chunks.
Thread cheese and cucumbers onto 16 (6-inch) wooden skewers with all remaining ingredients except dressing.
Place on platter.
Drizzle with dressing.
ad5d547737.pred:
Mix all ingredients except dressing.
Place cheese and tomatoes on skewers.
Dip skewers in dressing and arrange on a plate.
Serve immediately.

8198c69331.gt:
Place all ingredients in your bread machine in the order given.
Set bread machine to dough cycle.
IMPORTANT!
CHECK YOUR MACHINE WHILE IT IS KNEADING and ADD MORE WATER IF NEEDED 1 TABLESPOON AT A TIME.
The dough should not be too dry - it should look smooth and satiny after kneading for a few minutes.
When dough cycle is complete, remove dough from machine and shape into long loaf (like french bread).
Place on a cookie sheet and let loaf rise for about 45 minutes or until doubled in size.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until nicely browned.
You can also just cook this in your bread machine on the regular bread cycle if you want.
It still tastes great, you just don't get the cuban shaped loaf.
8198c69331.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Place water, sugar, salt and bread flour in bread machine.
Select dough cycle and start machine.
When dough cycle is complete, remove dough and place on floured surface.
Knead dough for 10 minutes.
Place dough in a greased bowl and cover with plastic wrap.
Let dough rise for 1 hour.
Punch down dough and divide into 12 equal pieces.
Roll each piece into a ball.
Place balls on greased baking sheet.
Let rise for 30 minutes.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Cut into 12 slices.

96a66bd364.gt:
Whisk the milk and oil together.
(The key to making this good and not tasting like oil is using a little less oil and a little more milk.)
Add flour, salt, and sugar.
Press on bottom of pie plate.
With a fork, poke holes in bottom and sides of crust.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
So easy and so good.
See Amazing Blueberry Cream Cheese Pie for ideas on what to make this with.
96a66bd364.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Roll out pie crust on a floured surface.
Place in a 9 inch pie plate.
Prick bottom and sides of crust with a fork.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Cool on a wire rack.
Fill with pie filling.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes.
Cool completely before serving.

61afcadcb1.gt:
1.
In a small bowl, combine almonds and brown sugar; set aside.
2.
In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Beat in the almond extract.
3.
Combine flour, baking soda and baking powder.
Add this to the creamed mixture alternately with bananas and sour cream.
Fold in the vanilla or white chips.
4.
Spread into a greased 13x9x2 inch baking pan.
Sprinkle with reserved almond and brown sugar mixture.
5.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack.
61afcadcb1.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan.
Mix together the almonds, brown sugar, and butter.
Press 1/2 of the mixture into the bottom of the pan.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and spread the bananas over the crust.
Sprinkle the remaining crumb mixture over the bananas.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Cool completely.
Cut into squares and serve.

6a6db8c9e3.gt:
trim away middle of bun
put 1 Cheddar cheese and 1tbsp of jam
add 3 hazelnut on each bun and bake 180 C for 5 minute till cheese melted
6a6db8c9e3.pred:
Mix the cheese and jam together.
Slice the bun in half and spread the cheese mixture on the bottom half.
Top with the jam.
Place the top half of the bun on top.
If desired, sprinkle hazelnuts on top.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.

8590091d29.gt:
Lightly oil grill and preheat to high.
Loosen skin on chicken pieces with fingers, by sliding hand between skin and flesh.
In a small skillet, saute green onion and 2 cloves garlic in butter or margarine for 1 minute.
Stir in breadcrumbs and parsley.
Push this seasoning under chicken skins, working it down well.
Combine 1 cup butter or margarine with mustard, 1 clove garlic and curry powder.
Spread this seasoned butter or margarine over chicken and put on preheated grill.
Cook 10 to 15 minutes each side, or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.
Brush with remaining seasoned butter while grilling.
8590091d29.pred:
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add chicken legs and cook until browned, about 10 minutes.
Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
Add onions and garlic to skillet and cook until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add parsley, bread crumbs, butter, mustard, and curry powder.
Mix well and cook until mixture is well blended and heated through, about 5 minutes.
Return chicken to skillet and toss to coat with sauce.
Serve immediately.

baa571bacd.gt:
Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 400F.
Drain 1 can tomatoes, reserving juice, then break up tomatoes into 1/2-inch pieces with a spoon if necessary; puree the second can of tomatoes,including juice and reserved juice (from other can), 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon allspice in a blender OR use hand blender, until smooth.
Transfer tomato puree to a 2-quart heavy saucepan and boil uncovered, stirring occasionally, until reduced to about 1/2 cup, about 20 minutes, remove from heat.
Heat a dry 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat until hot, then brown lamb with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon allspice, stirring and breaking up lumps (but leaving meat slightly chunky), about 5 minutes; add drained tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until juices are absorbed, about 1 minute.
Cut polenta into 1/4-inch-thick slices with a sharp knife and cover bottom of a 9-inch glass pie plate with half of polenta slices (overlapping slightly); scatter half of lamb mixture over polenta, then top with half of mozzarella, then remaining polenta; scatter remaining lamb on top and spread tomato sauce over meat, then top with remaining mozzarella.
Bake, uncovered, until bubbling and beginning to brown, about 20 minutes; let stand, loosely covered with foil, 15 minutes before serving, Enjoy.
baa571bacd.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Spray 13x9-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
In large bowl, combine lamb, 1/2 cup of the stewed tomatoes, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Mix well.
Spread 1/4 cup of the tomato mixture in bottom of prepared baking dish.
In same bowl, combine polenta, remaining 1/2 cup tomatoes, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Mix well.
Spread 1/4 cup of the polenta mixture on top of lamb mixture in baking dish.
Repeat layers twice, ending with polenta mixture.
Cover with foil.
Bake 45 minutes.
Remove foil and bake 15 minutes longer or until top is golden brown.
Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

b5c909ba3f.gt:
Heat grill.
Slice onion into slightly larger than 1/4-inch slices and brush both sides of each slice with olive oil.
Place onion on grill and cook 4-5 minutes per side or until brown and tender.
Let onion cool and then chop.
Place potatoes into boiling salted water for about 20-25 minutes or until just tender; drain.
When cool enough to handle, peeled and cut into 3/4 inch pieces.
In a large bowl, stir milk and vinegar together and let sit 1-2 minutes to thicken.
Whisk in mayo, salt and pepper.
Stir in onions.
Add potatoes to bowl, stir and then add celery.
Stir gently.
Cover and refrigerate for several hours before serving.
b5c909ba3f.pred:
1.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2.
Cut the onion into thin slices and place on a baking sheet.
3.
Drizzle the onion with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
4.
Grill the onions until they are lightly charred and tender, about 10 minutes.
5.
Transfer the onions to a large bowl.
6.
Add the milk, vinegar, mayonnaise, salt and pepper to the onions.
7.
Mix well.
8.
Add the potatoes and celery to the bowl.
9.
Mix well.
10.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
11.
Serve cold.

6cb33feaa0.gt:
Preheat oven to 375F Lightly grease cookie sheets.
Combine dry ingredients.
Set aside.
In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugars together.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time.
Stir in the vanilla.
Stir in the dry ingredients until well mixed, then stir in the chocolate chips, coconut and almonds.
Drop by rounded tablespoons onto the prepared cookie sheets.
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
6cb33feaa0.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix butter, sugars, eggs, vanilla, and flour in large bowl.
Stir in chocolate chips, coconut, and almonds.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool 1 minute on cookie sheet; remove to wire rack to cool completely.

ed047c7fd8.gt:
Add the milk, and small pieces of torn up cheese into a small saucepan.
Heat it up over medium-low heat until right before it starts to boil.
When the cheese has melted, mix well with a wooden spatula.
Let the mixture cool down.
Separate the egg yolks and egg whites.
Add the egg whites, 1/2 of the sugar into a bowl, and whip into a firm meringue.
Add the egg yolks and the remaining sugar into a separate bowl, and mix with a whisk.
Add the Step 1 mixture, and mix well.
Sift the cake flour into the Step 4 bowl, and mix well with the whisk.
Add the lemon juice as well, and mix well.
Add 1/3 of the Step 3 meringue into the Step 5 bowl, and mix well with the whisk.
Add the remaining meringue, and mix well with a spatula.
Pour the batter into a cake pan lined with parchment paper.
Place it in a baking sheet filled with hot water in the preheated oven, and bake for about 50 minutes at 160C.
Cover with aluminium foil halfway through so that it won't get burned.
If you don't mix the mixture really well during Step 6, it will separate into 2 layers, so please be careful.
If you are using a cake pan with removable bottom, the hot water will come into the pan while steam-baking in a water bath during Step 8, so please cover the bottom with aluminium foil and bake.
ed047c7fd8.pred:
Preheat oven to 180C.
Melt cheese in a saucepan.
Add milk and eggs and mix well.
Add cake flour and sugar and mix well.
Add lemon juice and mix well.
Pour into a greased oven dish and bake for 30 minutes.
Serve hot.

0f248f2042.gt:
In a large frying/saute pan add oil, butter and garlic, saute on low flame until oil starts to bubble.
Add tomatoes, salt and pepper.
Cook covered on a low flame for about 30 minutes.
Add vodka.
Cook uncovered for 25 minutes.
Add prosciutto-- cook 5 more minutes.
Add basil and heavy cream-- cook just 5 more minutes.
SERVE IT NOW!
I like this over penne pasta.
I only use Barilla.
0f248f2042.pred:
Place the vodka and prosciutto in a large saucepan and bring to a boil.
Add the tomatoes, garlic, salt and pepper.
Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour.
Add the basil and cream.
Simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve over pasta.

3c84706338.gt:
Preheat oven to 400?.
Spray a 2 qt casserole dish, or 9x9 baking pan with non-stick cooking spray.
In this order, layer the chicken, broccoli, 1 1/2 cups cheddar cheese and 2/3 of the bacon-bits in prepared baking dish.
Reserve the remaining cheese and bacon for topping.
Blend the eggs, milk, Bisquik, and 1/8 tsp.
fresh ground pepper until well combined.
Pour evenly over chicken mixture.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.
Sprinkle remaining cheese and bacon evenly on top.
Let cool 5 minutes before serving.
3c84706338.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the chicken, bacon, cheese, Bisquick, eggs, milk, and pepper.
Pour into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and top with broccoli.
Bake for 10 minutes more.

022318dd52.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Spray a large casserole dish with cooking spray.
(I have a 4 quart casserole dish I use for this.)
In a large skillet, brown together ground beef and onion; drain grease and return to pan.
Add tomato sauce, mushroom soup, 1/2 cup of the cheese, salt, pepper, and garlic.
Simmer uncovered.
While meat mixture is simmering, cook the pasta according to package directions.
Combine the pasta and the meat mixture together in the casserole dish; mix well.
Sprinkle remaining cheese on top.
Bake for 20 minutes or until cheese is bubbly.
022318dd52.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, brown the ground beef and onion.
Drain the shell pasta and add to the skillet.
Stir in the tomato sauce, cream of mushroom soup, and pepper.
Cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in the cheese and cook until melted.
Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.

565fbfd08a.gt:
NB: I like to use a fairly strong flavoured, but creamy blue cheese, like Gorgonzola, but Stilton is also nice.
Stock-wise, you may need a little more or less than in the ingredients list.
Bring stock up to a simmer.
Halve the leeks and remove any gritty bits from inside the rings.
Cut the leek into fine strips rather than semi-circles, of approx 1-2 inches in length.
Melt half the butter with the olive oil and cook the leeks for approx 10 minutes over a low-medium heat until soft and tinged with brown.
Add bacon to pan and cook for about 5 minutes.
Stir in garlic and rice, cook for a further minute or two, stirring the rice until it's coated in the butter and oil and starts to go slightly translucent.
Add the wine to the pan, turning up the heat to bubble most of it away.
Add a ladleful of hot stock to the leek and rice mixture at a time, stirring more or less constantly.
Add more stock each time that most of the liquid has been absorbed.
Add the fresh sage.
Keep doing this for approximately 15 - 25 minutes, until the risotto is creamy, but the rice grains still have a slight bite.
You'll need to start testing the rice after about 15 minutes, but it may take a little longer.
Turn off the heat.
Stir in the lemon juice, zest, remaining butter, parmesan and blue cheese.
Leave the risotto for another 2 minutes until rich, creamy and luscious.
Season to taste with black pepper and salt if needed.
565fbfd08a.pred:
In a large saucepan, melt the butter and olive oil together over medium heat.
Add the leeks and garlic and cook until the leeks are softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the rice and stir to coat with the butter and oil.
Add the wine and cook until it has been absorbed by the rice.
Add the stock, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly.
Continue adding the stock, 1/2 cup at a time, until the rice is tender and creamy, about 20 minutes.
Stir in the sage, lemon zest, and juice.
Remove from the heat and stir in the blue cheese.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

7b4784ea40.gt:
Slice the body of the prepped squid into rounds, then cut into 1cm dice.
Combine the flours, dashi stock granules, and water, and mix until it's slightly sticky (meaning the gluten in the flour has formed).
Add the squid to the batter, and leave for at least 30 minutes.
If the batter becomes too firm, add a little water so that it's the consistency of crepe batter.
Add oil in a pan, and pour in the batter (You can add an egg here to upgrade the pancake to a deluxe version.)
When one side is browned, turn the pancake over.
Cook the other side while pressing down hard on the pancake with your spatula.
When the pancake is cooked, spread the combined okonomiyaki and takoyaki sauces, fold in half and press.
If you add too much squid, the pancakes will be hard to cook.
I'm not too good at cooking these myself.
If you're not used to making pancakes, try cooking one with just a little squid added to the batter.
7b4784ea40.pred:
Mix together the squid, cake flour, bread flour, katakuriko, dashi stock granules, water, vegetable oil, and okonomiyaki sauce.
Mix well.
Heat the oil in a frying pan.
Pour the batter into the pan and cook over medium heat until the bottom of the pancake is golden brown.
Turn the pancake over and cook the other side.
Serve with okonomiyaki sauce and takoyaki sauce.

58c85cf057.gt:
Mix 2 Tbsp flour and the salt and pepper in a ziptop bag.
Add chicken; shake to coat.
Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet.
Add chicken; saute 5 minutes, or until cooked through.
Remove to a plate.
In a cup, mix remaining flour, the broth and garlic.
Add asparagus to skillet and saute 1 minute until bright green.
Stir chicken broth mixture, add to pan and cook 1 minute until thickened slightly and asparagus are tender.
Add chicken back to pan.
Stir in tomatoes; remove from heat.
Stir in scallions and dill.
58c85cf057.pred:
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add asparagus and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add broth and garlic and cook until reduced by half, about 3 minutes.
Add tomatoes and scallions and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.

613e75a520.gt:
In a large bowl, mix mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, sugar and salt until combined.
Add cabbage mix, apples, celery and raisins to bowl with dressing, toss well.
Cover and refrigerate at least 30 minutes to allow cabbage to soften.
To serve, sprinkle with walnuts.
Garnish with radishes.
613e75a520.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, sugar, and salt.
Stir in the coleslaw mix, apples, and celery.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Stir in the raisins and walnuts.
Garnish with radishes and serve.

4b92540ad2.gt:
heat oven to 425
line 9in pie plate with pastry
combine lemon juice with flour,sugar,nutmeg,cinnamon,lemon rind
place half of apples in plate, sharp edges inward
sprinkle with half of sugar mixture
top with rest of apples, heaping in center sprinkle with rest of sugar mixture
dot with butter
adjust top crust as directed and glaze
bake 40-50min or until apples test tender with fork and crust is brown
4b92540ad2.pred:
Preheat oven to 400F.
Combine lemon juice, flour, sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon, and lemon rind in a bowl.
Add in apples and butter.
Pour into a 9-inch pie plate.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Reduce heat to 350F and bake for 40 minutes more.
Cool on a wire rack.

f7ca0c32fa.gt:
Place greens on serving plate.
Top with chicken and corn.
Drizzle with salsa, then dressing.
f7ca0c32fa.pred:
Mix dressing and salsa together.
Add chicken and corn to salad greens.
Toss gently to coat.

0509ec4c83.gt:
Mix milk and vinegar together, and set aside.
Mix flour and salt.
Cut in shortening with fork.
Add milk and vinegar.
0509ec4c83.pred:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Mix milk, vinegar, flour and Crisco shortening in a large bowl.
Add salt and mix well.
Roll out pie crust on a floured surface.
Place in pie pan.
Bake for 10 minutes at 425 degrees.
Reduce heat to 350 degrees and bake for 30 minutes.
Cool on a wire rack.

83b98d7ee9.gt:
Saute diced onion in olive oil, add to crock pot.
Pour canned ingredients into crock pot, do not drain beans.
Add spices.
And the diced chicken.
(I used bagged chicken breast that was still partially frozen).
Heat on medium heat for 6 hours.
Microwave cream cheese for 45 seconds until it is easy to stir and pour.
Add the the soup.
Using a blender or immersion blender, blend until smooth.
Add 1 cup of favorite shredded cheese.
I used Colby Jack.
Hollow out your bead bowl if you so desire and pour soup into it.
Top with remaining shredded cheese.
83b98d7ee9.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat.
Add onion and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add beans, broth, chicken, cumin, oregano, and chili powder.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in cream cheese and shredded cheese.
Serve in bread bowl or in a bowl.

9980565108.gt:
Wash fruit and discard any skin (from peaches or the like).
Cut fruit into pieces no larger than 1 inch each.
In a large heavy-duty saucepan add the sugar and stir over medium heat while the sugar melts and the fruit softens.
Cook, stirring constantly until the jam thickens.
this may take an hour or more.
Cool, then spoon into very clean jars, cover with clean lids and refrigerate up to 3 weeks.
9980565108.pred:
Cut fruit into small pieces.
Put fruit in a large bowl.
Add sugar.
Let stand for 24 hours.
Strain and put in jars.
Seal.
Store in refrigerator.

08c1e0e854.gt:
break the banana into small pieces.
crush the cereal into big pieces
sieve flour and salt, beat in eggs, milk, vanilla, cream cheese, cereal and banana
heat a teaspoon of oil in a nonstick frying pan on a medium heat
depending on how big you like your pancakes depends on how big a spoon you use.
drop some batter in so its about 1/4 inch thick.
when the edges dry start to work a spatula around the edges and flip.
leave for a few mins.
check by lifting on end with the spatula
repeat steps 3 and 4 until all mixture is used up.
during cooking keep the ready pancakes warm in the oven
08c1e0e854.pred:
Mix all ingredients together and pour into a hot non stick pan.
Cook until golden brown on both sides.
Serve with maple syrup.

8b434331f6.gt:
Heat oven to 425F.
Cook broccoli according to pkg directions.
Mix margarine, onion salt, parsley, onion powder in saucepan.
Heat until melted.
Set aside.
Mix baking mix, wine, & chicken until soft dough forms.
You can add a little extra wine if there is still some of the baking mix not mixed in.
Press into bottom of baking dish.
Pour butter mixture over biscuit mixture.
Sprinkle with paprika.
Bake uncovered for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Pour broccoli over biscuit mix.
Cut into squares & serve.
8b434331f6.pred:
Mix all ingredients except chicken and broccoli.
Add chicken and broccoli.
Pour into a greased 9x13 pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

582a1779fb.gt:
Put all ingredients into a blender or food processor.
Process until smooth.
Pour into glass.
Enjoy!
582a1779fb.pred:
In a blender, combine the milk, orange juice, strawberries, yogurt, peanut butter, and chocolate drink mix.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a glass and add honey to taste.

e65b0ff688.gt:
Combine chicken strips, orange juice, and 1 teaspoon cornstarch in a medium bowl; cover and chill 1 hour.
Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add cashews; cook, stirring constantly, 30 seconds.
Remove from skillet; set aside.
Add chicken mixture to skillet.
Cook, uncovered, over medium-high heat 8 minutes or until chicken is lightly browned, stirring constantly.
Add water chestnuts and next 3 ingredients; cook 5 minutes.
Combine broth, soy sauce, and 1 tablespoon cornstarch; add to chicken mixture.
Bring to a boil; reduce heat, and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Remove from heat; stir in oranges.
Spoon chicken mixture over rice, and sprinkle with cashews.
Serve immediately.
e65b0ff688.pred:
Combine chicken, orange juice, cornstarch, oil, cashews, water chestnuts, green pepper, green onion, ginger, broth, soy sauce, and mandarin oranges in a large bowl.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken mixture and cook, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is thickened, about 10 minutes.
Serve over brown rice.

fa898117da.gt:
These few potatoes weighed about 1 kg this time.
Peel them, cut into pieces, and soak in water.
Bring the butter to room temperature.
Boil the sweet potatoes until they become soft.
When finished boiling, drain the water.
Mash with a masher while they are still hot.
Add the butter, sugar, and heavy cream into a pot, and mix over medium heat, without burning the mixture, until the butter melts.
When the butter is melted, add the Step 3 potatoes and evaporate the water while kneading and mixing.
Add vanilla extract, as well.
Preheat the oven to 200C.
Form into your desired shapes and brush with the egg yolk and water mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 ~ 20 minutes at 200C.
fa898117da.pred:
Place sweet potatoes in a pot and cover with water.
Bring to a boil and cook until tender.
Drain and mash.
Melt butter in a saucepan.
Add sugar and cream.
Cook over medium heat until sugar dissolves.
Add sweet potatoes and cook until heated through.
Remove from heat and add vanilla and egg yolks.
Beat with a whisk until smooth.
Pour into a serving dish and chill.
Serve cold.

143f7e5182.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix bread dough following the directions on the box (or use your favorite recipe).
Wrap the dough around the smokies, one at a time.
Place on a greased cookie sheet, or use Silpat or parchment paper.
Bake for 15 minutes.
143f7e5182.pred: Sausage,1/2 cup Vegetable Oil,1/2 cup Water,1/2 cup Brown Gravy Mix,1/2 cup Milk,1/2 cup Ketchup,1/2 cup Mustard,1/2 cup Onion,1/2 cup Chopped Green Pepper,1/2 cup Chopped Red Pepper,1/2 cup Chopped Onion,1/2 cup Chopped Celery,1/2 cup Chopped Bell Pepper,1/2 cup Chopped Mushrooms,1/2 cup Chopped Green Beans,1/2 cup Chopped Carrots,1/2 cup Chopped Zucchini,1/2 cup Chopped Corn,1/2 cup Chopped Peas,1/2 cup Chopped Tomatoes,1/2 cup Chopped Cabbage,1/2 cup Chopped Spinach,1/2 cup Chopped Broccoli,1/2 cup Chopped Cauliflower,1/2 cup Chopped Pumpkin,1/2 cup Chopped Squash,1/2 cup Chopped Cucumber,1/2 cup Chopped Bell Pepper,1/2 cup Chopped Onion,1/2 cup Chopped Celery,1/2 cup Chopped Bell Pepper,1/2 cup Chopped Onion,1/2 cup Chopped Celery,1/2 cup Chopped Bell Pepper,1/2 cup Chopped Onion,1/2 cup Chopped Celery,1/2 cup Chopped Bell Pepper,1/2 cup Chopped Onion,1/2 cup Chopped Celery,1/2 cup Chopped Bell Pepper,1/2 cup Chopped Onion,1/2 cup Chopped Celery,1/2 cup Chopped Bell Pepper,1/2 cup Chopped Onion,1/2 cup Chopped Celery,1/2 cup Chopped Bell Pepper,1/2 cup Chopped Onion,1/2 cup Chopped Celery,1/2 cup Chopped Bell Pepper,1/2 cup Chopped Onion,1/2 cup Chopped Celery,1/2 cup Chopped Bell Pepper,1/2 cup Chopped Onion,1/2 cup Chopped Celery,1/2 cup Chopped Bell Pepper,1/2 cup Chopped On

27f4409414.gt:
In a large bowl, combine chicken broth with 3 cups ice.
Add chicken; chill 1 hour.
Meanwhile, in a resealable bag, combine bread crumbs, flour, salt, cayenne, oregano, garlic, parsley, and pepper; shake.
Preheat oven to 400F Coat a large baking sheet with vegetable or olive oil spray; set aside.
Place yogurt in a medium bowl.
Remove chicken from broth.
One piece at a time, dip chicken into yogurt, then place in bread crumb mixture and shake.
Place breaded chicken on baking sheet.
Spray tops of chicken with vegetable spray.
Bake 45 to 50 minutes, until golden brown.
Serve hot or at room temperature.
27f4409414.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine the chicken broth, chicken, panko, flour, salt, cayenne pepper, oregano, garlic, parsley, and pepper.
Mix well.
Place a large baking sheet in the oven.
Heat the oven to 400 degrees.
Spread the chicken mixture on the baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Turn the chicken over and bake for 10 minutes more.
Serve with your favorite sides.

9f341bf6c9.gt:
Preheat oven to 350.
Grease a 9x9" pan.
Melt white chocolate and butter in the top of a double boiler, or in microwave on med power.
Set aside to cool.
In a large bowl, beat eggs until foamy.
Gradually add the sugar and vanilla, mixing constantly.
Drizzle in the melted white chocolate mixture.
Combine the flour and salt and fold into the white chocolate mixture.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Spread the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Do not over-bake.
4.
Serve heated.
Top with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, some real whipped cream and a drizzle of chocolate sauce.
9f341bf6c9.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, combine the butter, white chocolate, vanilla, and sugar.
Beat until well blended.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the flour, salt, and chocolate chips.
Spread the batter evenly in the prepared pan.
Bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool completely in the pan before cutting into squares.

555c73c04a.gt:
Thoroughly combine seasoning mix ingredients in a small bowl and set aside.
Cook pasta according to package directions and set aside.
Heat a skillet over high heat until it is hot, about 4 minutes.
Meanwhile, stir chicken pieces into seasoning.
Mix well.
Add 2 oz butter to pan.
Add chicken pieces and brown them.
Add the green onions, parsley, garlic and stock.
Cook two minutes or until the sauce is at a rolling boil.
Add the remaining butter (cut into pats) stirring to incorporate.
Cook for 3 minutes and add the cooked pasta.
Mix well.
Serve immediately.
I like to add parmesan on top.
555c73c04a.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add chicken and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
Add onion powder, salt, pepper, sage, and thyme to skillet and cook until onion is tender, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic powder, garlic, and chicken stock.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until chicken is cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Add pasta and cook until al dente, about 10 minutes.
Add chicken and onions to pasta and toss to combine.
Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

5c4e65b3c5.gt:
Preheat oven to 200F.
Place flour for dredging in a shallow bowl; coat each fillet with seasoned flour and shake off excess.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat for 3-4 minutes; add butter/olive oil combination then add the fillets, without crowding.
Increase heat to high and saute, shaking the pan from time to time, until bottom of the fish is nicely browned, about 3 minutes; turn and brown the other side.
Remove fish to a plate and keep warm in the oven; repeat with remaining fillets.
Deglaze the pan with white wine; cook, stirring over high heat until reduced by about 1/3; stir in remaining butter and drained capers.
Place fillets on individual serving plates and drizzle sauce around each fillet.
5c4e65b3c5.pred:
Place the fish in a large bowl and cover with the flour.
Shake off the excess flour and place the fish in a large skillet.
Heat the butter and olive oil in the skillet over medium-high heat.
When the butter is foaming, add the fish and cook for 3 minutes on each side.
Remove the fish from the skillet and set aside.
Add the wine to the skillet and reduce by half.
Add the capers and cook for 1 minute.
Add the fish to the skillet and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve with lemon wedges.

b6f5004817.gt:
Combine all together, cook on low in crock-pot 6-8 hours.
Serve with brown rice.
b6f5004817.pred:
Place chicken in crock-pot.
Add pineapple juice, brown sugar, and soy sauce.
Cook on low for 4 hours.
Serve with rice.

708886aaca.gt:
Heat oil in a five to six quart pot over moderately high heat.
Add garlic and pepper flake, saute until golden.
Be careful not to burn the garlic.
Stir in tomatoes and salt.
Simmer uncovered for 35 minutes.
Serve with pasta.
708886aaca.pred:
In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add red pepper flakes and cook for 30 seconds.
Add tomatoes, salt, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Serve over spaghetti.

bfebd12211.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with foil (enough to go up the sides) then spray the foil with cooking spray.
In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat butter until smooth and creamy.
Add the sugars and salt and beat until well incorporated.
Beat in the egg and vanilla extract until smooth.
With the mixer on low speed, slowly add the flour, baking powder, and baking soda, stirring until incorporated.
The mixture will be thick.
Scoop the mixture into the prepared pan and use your fingers to press it into an even layer.
Bake in the preheated oven for 22 minutes, or until golden, puffed, and slightly cracked.
Remove the cookie layer from the oven and immediately spread the chopped chocolate evenly over the top.
Return to the oven for 2-3 minutes or until chocolate begins to melt.
Remove from the oven and use a spatula to smooth the chocolate over the top.
Cover the chocolate with the chips and marshmallows (or other toppings like toasted coconut or chopped nuts, peppermints, or other candies) and gently press them into the chocolate.
Allow bars to cool, then use the foil to pull them from the pan.
Slice and serve.
Recipe adapted from Bon Appetit.
bfebd12211.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 13x9-inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, beat the butter and sugars with an electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy.
Add the egg and vanilla; beat well.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture; beat on low speed until just combined.
Stir in the chocolate and toppings.
Spread the batter in the prepared pan.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack.
Cut into bars.

f951ae3f61.gt:
Light the grill.
In a food processor, puree the butter and olives with the anchovy paste, orange zest, orange juice, garlic, and pepper.
With a rubber spatula, scrape the butter into a small bowl and refrigerate.
Rub the hens with oil and cook over moderate heat for 12 minutes.
Turn and cook until just done, about 12 minutes longer.
Remove the hens from the grill and serve with the rice.
Top each serving with 2 tablespoons of the flavored butter, letting the butter melt over both the hen and the rice.
f951ae3f61.pred:
In a small bowl, mix the butter, olives, anchovy paste, orange zest, orange juice, garlic, and pepper.
Spread the butter mixture over the hens, then grill them until cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Serve the hens with the rice and butter mixture.

4ca2ec2109.gt:
In a heavy bottomed saucepan, combine the heavy cream, sugar and basil and bring to a simmer.
Remove from heat and let steep for half an hour.
Place this mixture in a blender and puree.
In a large stainless steel bowl place the egg yolks.
Add the half and half mixture while constantly whisking.
Place entire mixture back onto heat.
Add the vanilla bean and the half and half and heat for one to two more minutes, stirring constantly until the mixture has thickened and coats the back of a spoon.
Do not boil!
Remove from heat and strain the entire mixture through a fine mesh sieve.
Cool over an ice bath.
Freeze in an ice cream machine according to manufacturers instructions.
4ca2ec2109.pred:
In a medium saucepan, bring the cream, sugar, basil, and egg yolks to a simmer.
Remove from the heat and let cool.
Strain through a fine sieve into a bowl.
Refrigerate until cold.
Freeze in an ice cream maker according to the manufacturer's instructions.
When the ice cream is almost frozen, add the half and half and vanilla bean.
Freeze until firm.
Serve immediately.

e9acd2e2b9.gt:
Cook couscous in well-salted boiling water, uncovered, until tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in sugar snaps 3 minutes before couscous is done.
Drain and transfer to a bowl, then stir in 1/2 tablespoon butter and salt and pepper to taste.
While couscous and sugar snaps cook, toss shrimp with 1/8 teaspoon each of salt and pepper.
Heat remaining tablespoon butter in a 10-inch heavy skillet over medium-high heat until foam subsides.
Saute shrimp, turning once, until just cooked through, about 3 minutes total.
Transfer shrimp with a slotted spoon to a plate.
Add wine, tomato, and sugar to skillet and boil until tomato starts to fall apart, about 4 minutes.
Return shrimp to skillet and stir in tarragon.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve shrimp and pan sauce on top of pearl couscous.
e9acd2e2b9.pred:
Heat oven to 450F.
In a large bowl, toss pearl couscous with 1 tablespoon of the butter.
In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of the butter over medium-high heat.
Add the snap peas and cook, stirring occasionally, until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes.
Remove from heat and add to the couscous.
Add the shrimp, wine, tomato, sugar, and tarragon.
Toss to combine.
Transfer to a 13x9-inch baking dish and bake until the shrimp are opaque and the couscous is golden, about 15 minutes.
Sprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon butter.

bce4690032.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a baking sheet (or 2) with parchment paper.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, chile powder and salt.
With a stand mixer, beat the butter and reserved bacon fat drippings on medium-high until smooth, about 1 minute.
Beat in the white and brown sugar until creamy, about 4 minutes.
Then add the egg and vanilla and beat until fluffy for about 2 minutes.
Reduce the speed of the mixer to low and add the flour.
Mix until just combined and then add in the chocolate chips and crispy bacon.
Form the cookie dough into 12 even-sized balls and arrange them on the cookie sheet about 2 inches apart from each other.
Flatten the cookie balls with your fingers and then bake for 12-14 minutes until golden brown.
Let the cookies cool for about 2 minutes on the baking sheet before transferring to a cooling rack.
bce4690032.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, chile powder, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream butter with sugar until light and fluffy.
Add egg and vanilla; beat well.
Stir in flour mixture until well blended.
Stir in chocolate chips and bacon.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned.
Cool on cookie sheets for 2 minutes; remove to wire racks to cool completely.

e10d62e4d9.gt:
To make the crust, preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Crust cookies in a food processor (or smash in a Ziploc bag with a rolling pin).
Stir in melted butter until all combined.
Pour into a regular pie pan and press crumbs all over the pan and up the sides.
Bake for 3 to 4 minutesjust long enough for it to set.
Cool crust completely.
Place raspberries on a plate or in an empty pan.
Smash them with a fork, then sprinkle on 3 tablespoons of sugar.
Stir together and allow to sit for 15 minutes.
In the bowl of an electric mixer, combine raspberry yogurt with the instant vanilla pudding mix (just the powder itself.)
Beat on low until combined, about 1 minute.
Pour in heavy cream and whip on low for 30 seconds.
Stop the mixer and scrape down the bowl with a rubber spatula.
Turn mixer on medium-high speed and beat for two minutes, or until mixture is thick.
Turn off mixer, then fold in raspberries until just combined.
Pour into cooled pie pan and spread evenly.
Freeze for two hours, or until very firm.
Cut into slices and top each slice with cookie crumbs, dollops of whipped cream, and extra raspberries.
Keep in freezer, allowing time to thaw before serving.
e10d62e4d9.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, combine the melted butter and sugar.
Add the Oreo cookies and mix until well coated.
Press into the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and set aside to cool.
In a medium bowl, combine the raspberries, sugar, and 1/2 cup of the cream.
Mash the raspberries with a fork.
Stir in the yogurt and pudding mix.
Pour into the cooled crust.
Refrigerate for 2 hours.
In a medium bowl, beat the remaining cream until stiff peaks form.
Fold into the pie.
Garnish with extra raspberries.

50ad0077cb.gt:
Put all ingredients except the olive oil with the tuna steak to marinade.
Leave it for approximately 30 minutes to marinade (if you leave it longer it with take more in flavor but not necessary for this type.)
After marinating the tuna do not throw away the marinade you will use it as cooking liquid.
Start with a pan and place the olive oil to heat up, place in the tuna 1 minute per side to sear.
Return to low heat and leave it for 8 minutes per piece when the cooking liquid is getting low put some of the marinade.
It will enhance the taste and give it a great taste.
I decorated the plate with some coleslaw, tomatoes, lemon and deep fried potato shavings.
50ad0077cb.pred:
Cut the tuna steak into 1/2-inch cubes.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the tuna cubes and cook until just opaque, about 2 minutes.
Add the wine and cook until it has reduced by half, about 2 minutes.
Add the soy sauce and cook until the tuna is cooked through, about 2 minutes.
Add the garlic and lemon juice and cook until the garlic is fragrant, about 1 minute.
Serve immediately.

d34f8abc06.gt:
Saute pepper and onion in skillet with Pam.
Add soup, Rotel tomatoes and chicken.
Alternate layers of tortillas and soup mix.
Sprinkle cheese on top.
Bake at 325F for 40 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
Serves 4.
WW Points: 5 pt.
d34f8abc06.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
Place green pepper, onion, and soup in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Top with chicken, Rotel tomatoes, and cheese.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Serve with corn tortillas.

b7705a9251.gt:
Saute -- In a large pan, heat the oil.
Add the garlic, onion and red pepper and saute for 2-3 minutes on medium until slightly soft.
Beans and spinach -- Add the beans, seasoning and saute on medium high to high until cooked through, about 5 minutes.
As they cook I like to take a fork and slightly mash the beans a bit to get a good consistency.
I like to get them a little crisp and browned but not fried dark brown.
Just a light browning is good.
Add the spinach and break up as it cooks.
If too dry you can use a little white wine, chicken broth or just water to loosen the sauce if necessary.
Garnish with some good olive oil and ground pepper.
b7705a9251.pred:
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onion and saute until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and saute for 1 minute.
Add spinach and saute until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Add beans, parsley, rosemary, red pepper flakes, salt and pepper.
Stir to combine.
Add wine and cook until the liquid has reduced by half.
Add 1/2 cup water and cook until the sauce has thickened.
Drizzle with olive oil and serve.

db15adcf9f.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut tops off of heads of garlic in a straight line across.
Rub extra virgin olive oil all over heads; wrap loosely in foil and place on a baking sheet.
Roast garlic at 400 degrees F until caramelized and soft, approximately 30-35 minutes.
Leave oven at 400 degrees F and line large baking sheet with nonstick foil for easy cleanup.
In a large bowl, add ground turkey breast, chopped baby spinach, chopped fresh parsley, beaten egg, melted palm shortening (or olive oil), salt, pepper, and carefully squeeze roasted garlic heads to release the roasted garlic into the bowl.
With your hands, mix everything together well until all ingredients are incorporated evenly.
Roll balls by hand in uniform sizes to ensure even cooking in the batch.
Place on nonstick foil-lined (or parchment paper) baking sheet.
Bake at 400 degrees F for about 25-30 minutes or until thoroughly cooked.
db15adcf9f.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together the ground turkey, spinach, parsley, egg, and salt and pepper.
Form into 1-inch balls and place on a baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and bake for 20 minutes.
Serve with roasted garlic sauce.

70b786a095.gt:
Preheat the oven to gas 4 / 180C / 350F with and line 2 baking trays with foil and have 2 spare baking trays handy
Peel the beets and slice very thinly, 1/16 inch thick with a mandolin but be careful of your fingers.
In a large bowl, toss the sliced beets with the extra virgin olive oil
Arrange the beets in a single layer on each tray and sprinkle with a small amount of the salt.
You can use plain sea salt or any flavoured salt of preferrence.
Stack an extra baking tray on top of each layer of beetroot.
This keeps the crisps flat.
Put one tray on the oven top shelf and the other on the bottom
Bake until the edges of the beets begin to dry out, about 20 minutes.
Peek around 17 minutes to check!
Remove the extra trays that are on top of the beets and rotate the trays so the top one now goes in the bottom and the bottom one goes to the top
Bake a further 17 - 20 minutes.
Remove the crisps as they become lighter in color.
Transfer to a wire rack, they will crisp up as they cool
Keep in a lidded container for up to a week
70b786a095.pred: mix,1/4 cup pumpkin seeds,1/4 cup sunflower seeds,1/4 cup chia seeds,1/4 cup flax seeds,1/4 cup sesame seeds,1/4 cup walnuts,1/4 cup almonds,1/4 cup cashews,1/4 cup pistachios,1/4 cup pecans,1/4 cup peanuts,1/4 cup chocolate chips,1/4 cup dried cranberries,1/4 cup dried apricots,1/4 cup dried cherries,1/4 cup dried mango,1/4 cup dried pineapple,1/4 cup dried apples,1/4 cup dried peaches,1/4 cup dried plums,1/4 cup dried figs,1/4 cup dried apricots,1/4 cup dried dates,1/4 cup dried raisins,1/4 cup dried cranberries,1/4 cup dried cherries,1/4 cup dried mango,1/4 cup dried pineapple,1/4 cup dried apples,1/4 cup dried peaches,1/4 cup dried plums,1/4 cup dried figs,1/4 cup dried dates,1/4 cup dried raisins,1/4 cup dried cranberries,1/4 cup dried cherries,1/4 cup dried mango,1/4 cup dried pineapple,1/4 cup dried apples,1/4 cup dried peaches,1/4 cup dried plums,1/4 cup dried figs,1/4 cup dried dates,1/4 cup dried raisins,1/4 cup dried cranberries,1/4 cup dried cherries,1/4 cup dried mango,1/4 cup dried pineapple,1/4 cup dried apples,1/4 cup dried peaches,1/4 cup dried plums,1/4 cup dried figs,1/4 cup dried dates,1/4 cup dried raisins,1/4 cup dried cranberries,1/

d5926ad471.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 F. Lightly grease and flour a pie dish.
Rub the seasoning on the chicken breasts.
Place in a medium saucepan and add enough water to cover.
Bring to a simmer and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
Drain and dice chicken.
In a large bowl, combine chicken, cream of chicken soup, cream of mushroom soup, cheddar cheese, mozzarella cheese, mixed vegetables, and salt and pepper.
Mix thoroughly.
Lay one sheet of pastry in the bottom of the greased and floured pan.
Pour chicken mixture over pastry.
Cover with second sheet of pastry.
Seal edges of the top and bottom pastries by pinching them together.
Cut steam vents in the top crust.
Bake in preheated oven for 50 minutes, until pastry is golden brown.
d5926ad471.pred:
In a large skillet, brown chicken in 1 teaspoon of Old Bay Seasoning.
Add in the cream of chicken soup and mushroom soup.
Stir to combine.
Add in the cheese and vegetables.
Pour into a 9 pie crust.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

830e83ffb1.gt:
Halve your bread crosswise.
Hollow out the inside of the bread halves to make the pockets.
Do your best to keep from putting holes in the roll.
Fill with your favorite pasta!
Note: Push the pasta mixture down into the bread pocket to allow more spaghetti to fit inside.
Once hollowed out, you can stuff your bread with any pasta.
Try it with a butter sauce, olive oil, pesto, tomato sauce or anything you like.
Go all out and add sausages and peppers, chicken, or mini meatballs.
You can even throw in a Caesar or mixed green salad tossed with dressing.
You are only limited by your imagination.
830e83ffb1.pred:
Spread bread with butter and cheese.
Cut bread into 1/2 inch slices.
Place a spoonful of pasta in the center of each slice.
Top with a meatball.
Add a few pieces of ceasar salad and greek salad.
Place a roasted veggie on top.
Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.

0dddf99191.gt:
Trim pork tenderloin removing fat and sinew, slice thinly across the grain (1/4" thickness), place in a bowl.
Add marinade ingredients (soy sauce, white wine, sriracha sauce, honey and ginger), mix to distribute sauce evenly and set aside.
Chop veggies.
Heat wok on high heat for a few minutes, add sesame oil, when oil just starts to smoke, add pork slices, turning frequently.
Stir-fry until pork is mostly cooked and opaque, about 5 - 8 minutes.
Remove pork from wok into a clean bowl/plate, set aside.
In the juices left in the wok, stir in chopped garlic, then add broccoli & carrots.
Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, adding more sesame oil if desired.
Add baby corn and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes.
Return pork to wok and stir into veggies, add more soy sauce, sriracha, and honey if needed to create a liquid gravy of about 1/2 cup in volume.
Push food to the outer edges so liquid is settled in the bottom of wok.
In a seperate bowl combine cool water & corn starch.
Add mixture to liquid gravy in the wok and stir until thickened.
Mix everything together and voila!
Serve immediately with cooked rice.
(Basmati/wild blend cooked in chicken stock and nutmeg is nice!)
0dddf99191.pred:
In a large skillet, heat sesame oil over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add pork and stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Add broccoli and carrots and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add corn and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add garlic, ginger, honey, sriracha sauce, wine, soy sauce, and black pepper.
Stir until well combined.
Cook for 2 minutes.
Serve over rice.

7d493176df.gt:
In a large saucepot, combine the potatoes, coleslaw, carrots, and chicken stock.
Add 4 cups water; the liquid should barely cover the vegetables.
Bring to a boil, then cover halfway and reduce the heat to simmer until tender, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, whisk the beer and mustard.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to simmer and add the bratwurst.
Simmer gently until cooked through, about 20 minutes.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the bratwurst to the vegetable mixture; discard the beer mixture.
Divide the stew among dishes and serve with mustard.
7d493176df.pred:
Heat the beer and add the bratwurst.
Add the potatoes, carrots, and coleslaw.
Simmer for 1 hour.
Serve with mustard.

8237def972.gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 375.2.
To prepare cake, combine rhubarb and 2 tablespoons flour in a medium bowl; toss well to coat.3.
Place brown sugar and 5 tablespoons butter in a large bowl; beat with a mixer at medium speed until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add sour cream, rind, and vanilla; beat until well combined.4.
Lightly spoon 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour and whole wheat flour into dry measuring cups; level with a knife.
Combine flours, baking soda, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, and salt, stirring with a whisk.
Gradually add flour mixture to butter mixture, beating at low speed just until combined.
Fold in rhubarb mixture.
Spread batter into a 9-inch square baking pan coated with cooking spray.5.
To prepare streusel, combine turbinado sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon in a small bowl.
Cut in 2 tablespoons butter with a pastry blender or 2 forks until mixture is crumbly; stir in nuts.
Sprinkle streusel evenly over batter.
Bake at 375 for 50 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8237def972.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 10-inch tube pan.
In a large bowl, combine the rhubarb, flour, brown sugar, butter, eggs, sour cream, orange rind, vanilla, and 1/2 cup flour.
Beat at medium speed until smooth.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake for 45 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
In a small bowl, combine the turbinado sugar, cinnamon, and butter.
Sprinkle over the cake.
Bake for 10 minutes longer, or until the sugar is melted and lightly browned.
Cool completely.
Cut into 12 slices.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

de5ceb6ef3.gt:
Put yogurt in a bowl.
Stir in ginger, diced chile and salt.
Put oil in a small skillet over medium heat.
Add mustard and cumin seeds and let sizzle until seeds begin to pop, about 1 minute.
Carefully stir hot contents of skillet into yogurt.
Add chopped mint, cover and let flavors mingle for at least 15 minutes.
Raita may be prepared several hours before serving.
de5ceb6ef3.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Serve immediately.

c577db5950.gt:
Squeeze the lime wedges into a small glass; add wedges and mint to glass.
Crush with the back of a spoon for 30 seconds.
Add soda, rum, Simple Syrup, and nectar; stir gently.
Serve over ice.Note: Nutritional analysis includes Simple Syrup.
c577db5950.pred:
Place the lime wedges and mint leaves in a cocktail shaker.
Add the club soda, rum, Simple Syrup, mango nectar, and crushed ice.
Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a mango wedge and serve.

2069c35857.gt:
Bring water to a boil in a covered saucepan.
Add butter, cumin, raisins, currants, zest, and rice.
Stir the rice and return to a rolling boil.
Cover and reduce heat to low.
Cook 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and add chives.
Fluff rice with fork and transfer to a serving dish.
Cover rice liberally with toasted sliced almonds or smoked almonds.
2069c35857.pred:
In a large saucepan, combine the water, butter, cumin seed, raisins, currants, lemon juice, and rice.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove from the heat, and let stand, covered, for 10 minutes.
Fluff with a fork and transfer to a serving bowl.
Sprinkle with the chives and almonds.

e55ff056b8.gt:
1.
Mix soy sauce, lime juice, vegetable oil, chili garlic sauce and ketchup.
2.
Add chicken breasts to mixture and refrigerate for at least 6 hours.
3.
Remove from refrigerator and season chicken with salt and pepper.
4.
Place on a hot grill or bake in a 400 degree oven until cooked completely through.
A meat thermometer should read at least 155-160 degrees.
5.
Mix mayonnaise and Thai chili sauce.
Both the Thai chili sauce and the chili garlic sauce should be available in the Asian food section of the grocery store.
4.
Brush 1 Tbl of the mayonnaise-Thai chili sauce mixture over each hamburger bun.
5.
Place chicken on the bun and serve with lettuce and tomato.
e55ff056b8.pred:
Mix all ingredients except the chicken and buns.
Place chicken in a bowl and pour the sauce mixture over it.
Marinate for 1 hour.
Remove chicken from marinade and discard marinade.
Grill or broil chicken until cooked through.
Cut chicken into strips.
Place chicken strips on bottom half of buns.
Top with sauce mixture.
Place top half of buns on top.

f1211da4d4.gt:
In a serving dish, add quinoa, watermelon, red onion, feta and mint.
Gently toss to combine.
Drizzle in olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Toss to combine.
Top with mint garnish.
Serve chilled.
f1211da4d4.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the quinoa, watermelon balls, onion, feta crumbles, mint, and olive oil.
Toss to coat.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve with the extra mint leaves and balsamic vinegar.

ee5c4e9487.gt:
Arrange cauliflower and carrots in four half-pint canning jars; set aside.
Heat remaining ingredients to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat, cook 10 minutes.
Turn off heat; let steep 5 minutes.
Pour mixture over the vegetables to cover.
Cover jars tightly; cool to room temperature, about 1 hour.
Refrigerate at least three days before serving.
ee5c4e9487.pred:
In a large pot, bring the vinegar, salt, mustard, cumin, and turmeric to a boil.
Add the cauliflower, carrots, garlic, chiles, and cilantro.
Reduce the heat and simmer, covered, for 20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Stir in the dill.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

97b16dfccd.gt:
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Drain and set aside in a large bowl.
Cook bacon.
When cool enough, crumble into bite-size pieces.
Set aside.
In a small bowl, stir together the ranch dressing, green onions, cheddar cheese and black pepper.
Pour mixture over the pasta and add chopped bacon.
Stir together and serve.
97b16dfccd.pred:
In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the pasta until al dente.
Drain and rinse under cold water.
In a large bowl, toss the pasta with the bacon, buttermilk ranch dressing, and green onions.
Add the cheese and black pepper.
Toss well to combine.
Serve immediately.

f78a4f2c70.gt:
Preheat oven to 425F.
Coat baking sheet with cooking spray.
Heat large, deep skillet over medium heat.
Add 1 Tbs.
oil, and swirl to coat pan.
Add onion and cook 5 minutes, or until onion becomes translucent, stirring often.
Stir in button mushrooms, garlic, and salt, and cook 8 to 10 minutes, or until mushrooms are soft and most of liquid is evaporated, stirring frequently.
Stir in rice, and cook 1 to 2 minutes longer, or until heated through.
Remove from heat, and stir in goat cheese.
Fill each portobello with about 1/3 cup filling mixture.
Toss tomatoes with lemon juice in bowl, and lay tomato halves cut-side up over tops of filled portobellos.
Place stuffed portobellos on baking sheet greased with remaining 1 Tbs.
oil, and sprinkle each with 1 tsp.
breadcrumbs.
Bake 30 to 35 minutes, or until mushrooms are cooked through and breadcrumbs are golden.
Sprinkle with parsley.
f78a4f2c70.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, heat 1 Tbs.
oil over medium-high heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add mushrooms and garlic and cook until mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes.
Add salt and cook for 1 minute.
Add wild rice and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine goat cheese, 2 Tbs.
oil, lemon juice, breadcrumbs, and 1 Tbs.
parsley.
Stuff mushroom caps with wild rice mixture and place on a baking sheet.
Bake until heated through, about 20 minutes.
Garnish with parsley and serve.

d1d3e72257.gt:
Dice the tomato into 2-3 cm cubes.
Thinly slice the garlic.
Salt and pepper the cod.
Prep the shrimp.
Put the olive oil, red chili pepper, and garlic into a frying pan and saute over low heat.
Add the cod and cook both sides over medium heat.
Add the shrimp.
Quickly cook both sides, and add the water and tomatoes.
When it comes to a boil, simmer for 4 minutes over medium to high heat as you pour the broth over the fish.
Add the olive oil, and season with herb salt once the acqua pazza comes to a boil.
Dish it up, and scatter parsley on top.
d1d3e72257.pred:
Place the cod fillets in a bowl and cover with water.
Place the shrimp in a separate bowl and cover with water.
Add the tomatoes, red chili pepper, garlic, and herb salt to the bowl with the cod.
Add the olives and parsley or Italian parsley to the bowl with the shrimp.
Add the water to the bowl with the cod and let sit for 10 minutes.
Drain the cod and place in a large pot.
Add the shrimp and the water from the shrimp bowl to the pot.
Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the olive oil and the tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the garlic and the red chili pepper and cook for 1 minute.
Serve with pasta.

a0e261ef2d.gt:
Stir liquid soap into baking soda.
Add the water, and stir to be as smooth as possible.
Add the vinegar and stir again.
Pour into a squeeze bottle.
(A clean, empty ketchup or syrup bottle works well.)
Shake well before using, and keep tightly closed between uses.
a0e261ef2d.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
Store in a tightly sealed container.
Use 1/4 cup per load.
Mix well before using.
Use 1/4 cup per load.
Mix well before using.

8afb34ca7c.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Quarter the large strawberries and halve the smaller ones.
Place the strawberries in a 9-inch pie plate or 8x8 baking dish.
Sprinkle the sugar over the strawberries and toss several times.
Roast the strawberries for 15-20 minutes, stirring once during the baking time.
The strawberries are done when they have softened and the juices are thick and bubbly.
Cool completely and store in the fridge.
8afb34ca7c.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place strawberries in a shallow baking dish.
Drizzle with sugar and toss to coat.
Roast in the oven for 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and serve.

bbff2a5297.gt:
Clean the shrimp and pat dry.
Slice and toast the baguette.
Peel all the garlic and mince finely.
Add to a pan over medium low heat with the olive oil.
We have a clay pot from Spain, but any pan will work.
Keep stirring, allowing the garlic to sizzle lightly (you want to make sure not to burn the garlic) for a few minutes.
Add the paprika, salt and pepper, and stir.
Bring the heat up to medium and add the shrimp to the pan.
Let the shrimp cook for 90 seconds, flip, and add the white wine.
Let everything cook together for another 2 minutes, or until the shrimp is just cooked through.
Place shrimp on toasted bread, drizzle with garlic oil, and garnish with parsley.
bbff2a5297.pred:
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add the shrimp and cook until pink and opaque, about 2 minutes.
Remove from the heat and set aside.
Preheat the broiler.
Place the sliced baguette on a baking sheet and broil until lightly toasted, about 1 minute.
Remove from the broiler and set aside.
In a small bowl, combine the paprika, smoked paprika, salt, and black pepper.
Brush the shrimp with the olive oil and sprinkle with the spice mixture.
Place the shrimp on the baguette and top with the broiled baguette.
Serve with the chopped parsley.

53ee6640d1.gt:
Using an espresso machine or cappuccino maker, prepare 2 shots espresso.
Fill a large serving glass 2/3 with ice.
Do not use extract or ice cream topping in place of syrup (use types specially made for beverages).
Add vanilla syrup, sugar (if desired), and espresso to glass and top up with cold milk.
Stir or shake briskly until syrup and sugar is nicely blended in the drink.
53ee6640d1.pred:
Combine espresso, sugar, and vanilla syrup in a cup.
Add milk and ice.
Stir until the sugar is dissolved.
Top with foam.

b3eb381c7e.gt:
Finely grind almond paste in processor.
Add softened butter, flour, and egg; blend until smooth.
Preheat oven to 400F.
Roll out puff pastry on floured surface to 13x11-inch rectangle.
Fold 3/4 inch of edges over; press to adhere to make 11 1/2x9 1/2-inch rectangle.
Transfer to rimmed baking sheet.
Pierce surface evenly with fork, avoiding folded edges.
Spread almond paste mixture evenly over crust within folded edges.
Arrange pear slices atop filling, overlapping slightly.
Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon sugar.
Bake until crust is deep golden and pears are tender, about 38 minutes.
Cool slightly.
Meanwhile, stir vinegar and remaining 1/4 cup sugar in heavy small saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves.
Increase heat; boil until syrup is reduced to 1/4 cup, about 6 minutes.
Place tart on platter.
Drizzle syrup over.
Sprinkle lightly with peppercorns and serve warm.
b3eb381c7e.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a food processor, pulse almond paste, butter, flour, and egg until well combined.
Transfer to a bowl.
Stir in sugar and vinegar.
Divide pastry dough into 4 equal pieces.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out 1 piece of dough to a 12-inch round.
Transfer to the prepared baking sheet.
Arrange pear slices in a single layer on top of the pastry.
Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons sugar.
Roll out the remaining dough and place on top of the pears.
Press edges together to seal.
Crimp edges decoratively.
Brush with egg wash.
Sprinkle with pink peppercorns, if desired.
Bake until golden brown, about 25 minutes.
Cool on a wire rack.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

048c81274c.gt:
in small sauce pan boil chiles and tomatillos.
when tender add to blender with onion and garlic.
blend on high until smooth.
in large fry pan melt butter/margerine and add cooked pasta.
cooke mixing every few minutes to prevent burning.
the color ur looking for is about 1/4-1/2 of the pasta turning golden brown.
add salsa from blender to pasta and mix thoroughly.
Then add sour cream/ crema mexicana and mix thoroughly.
salt to taste at this time.
lower heat to low and let simmer and obsorb juices.
crumble cheese on top and cover with lid to allow some melting...
serve right away and enjoy..goes well with any meat dish or even just a salad...
048c81274c.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large skillet, cook the spaghetti until al dente.
Drain and set aside.
In the same skillet, melt the butter or margarine.
Add the tomatillos and jalapenos and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes.
Add the cheese and cook until melted.
Add the crema mexicana and garlic and onion and cook for 1 minute.
Add the spaghetti and toss to coat.
Season with salt to taste.
Transfer to a baking dish and bake for 15 minutes.
Serve with additional crema mexicana or sour cream if desired.

18f9bb7f6e.gt:
Mix all ingredients except the Romaine and the whole croutons in a small bowl or a "cruet".
Toss with Romaine and croutons.
Serve with a sprinkle of fresh shredded parmesan.
18f9bb7f6e.pred:
In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, and garlic.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add the parmesan cheese and croutons and toss to coat.
Add the romaine lettuce and toss to combine.
Garnish with croutons and anchovies, if desired.

5f080b5a48.gt:
Preheat oven to 375.
Cream together eggs, butter, both sugars, crisco, and vanilla.
In separate bowl mix dry ingredients and slowly add to the wet.
Spoon on to cookie sheets.
You can roll each dough ball in sugar or icing them later if desired.
Bake at 375 for 12-15 minutes.
5f080b5a48.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease cookie sheets.
In a large bowl, cream butter and Crisco.
Add sugar and vanilla.
Beat well.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add flour, salt, baking soda, and cream of tartar.
Mix well.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheets.
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool on cookie sheets for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

ede4b858c3.gt:
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil over both sides of each mushroom.
Sprinkle the mushrooms with salt and pepper.
Grill until the mushrooms are heated through and tender, about 5 minutes per side.
Meanwhile, add the extra-virgin olive oil and garlic in a medium bowl, and whisk until well blended.
Toss the tomatoes, cheese, and basil until evenly coated.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Place 4 hot grilled mushrooms gill side up on 4 individual plates.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper if needed.
