Fill up the mushroom cap with the bruschetta and cheese mixture.
Drizzle a little bit more extra-virgin olive oil over if needed.
Serve and enjoy!
ede4b858c3.pred:
Preheat grill to medium heat.
Brush the mushrooms with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Grill the mushrooms for 3-5 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and tender.
Remove from grill and set aside.
In a small bowl, combine the garlic, tomatoes, basil, and olive oil.
Mix well and set aside.
Place the mozzarella cheese on a plate and drizzle with olive oil.
Place the mushrooms on top of the cheese and sprinkle with the tomato mixture.
Serve immediately.

b65ea7e6a7.gt:
Boil the pasta according to the instructions on the package.
In a large frying pan, heat the oil and over a medium heat, soften the garlic.
After a couple of minutes, add the tomatoes, tomato puree and sugar, and leave to stew over medium-low heat for 10 minutes.
Add the mascarpone and stir until it has melted into the sauce.
Add the parsley or basil and season to taste with salt and pepper.
When it is ready, drain the pasta and add it to the pan with the sauce.
Mix well and then serve.
b65ea7e6a7.pred:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes and cook for 3 minutes.
Add the tomato puree and sugar and cook for 3 minutes.
Add the mascarpone cheese and cook for 1 minute.
Add the parsley and basil and cook for 1 minute.
Season with salt and pepper.
Pour the sauce over the tagliatelle and toss to coat.
Spread the pasta out on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.
Serve warm.

fcb625ec64.gt:
Cut the carrot into thin strips.
Rehydrate the kanpyo in water.
Place the pork into the kombu, and then place the carrots on top.
Roll it up from the front with the carrot, and tie in two places with the kanpyo.
Add the A condiments and Step 2 to a pot, cover with a drop lid, and boil for at least 40 minutes until the kombu softens.
Stick with a toothpick, and cook until it pierces straight through.
After it has softened, turn off the heat, let cool, cut into half, and arrange on a plate.
fcb625ec64.pred:

Combine the ingredients marked with a .
Combine the ingredients marked with a .

fd96b8b1a7.gt:
Heat about 1-2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium low heat.
Add the mushrooms.
Cook them with the lid on for about 9 minutes or until golden brown, stirring occasionally.
Transfer to a food processor and pulse until finely ground.
In the same saucepan (add a little more oil if needed), over medium low heat, combine the minced mushrooms and onions.
Saute until onions are nice and soft and then add the ground turkey.
As it cooks, break up the turkey.
After a few minutes add all of the remaining ingredients (except the buns).
Continue to cook until the turkey is browned and no longer pink.
Spoon mixture onto buns and top with shredded cheddar cheese, if desired.
(Recipe adapted from Pass The Sushi, who in turn adapted it from Americas Test Kitchen.)
fd96b8b1a7.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
Add mushrooms, onion, and turkey.
Cook until turkey is no longer pink, stirring occasionally.
Add ketchup, mustard, BBQ sauce, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper.
Stir until combined.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve in hamburger buns.

643060cd52.gt:
Throw all ingredients into a bowl and combine!
(You can add 3tsp of Cacao powder for a slight chocolatey flavour)
643060cd52.pred:
Place the dates in a food processor and pulse until finely chopped.
Add the peanut butter, honey, and water and process until the mixture is smooth.
Add the protein powder and pulse until the mixture is combined.
Roll into 1-inch balls and place on a baking sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.

84fd3c9208.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees, cut top off of squash and remove pulp and seeds, place upside down on cookie sheet and fill pan 1/2 way up with water, cover with foil and bake 45 minutes, remove and make sure it is fork tender, if not continue cooking in 10 minute intervals, leave on pan to cool.
While it is baking, in rice cooker cook rice with 2 cups vegetable broth, diced zucchini, 1 diced carrot, chopped parsley, and about 1/2 cup water.
When rice is done cooking, stir it well and add the raw tomato, pepper and 1/2 of the onion diced.
In a Large skillet add olive oil and brown 1/2 of the diced onion, when brown add the ground turkey, sage, garlic and mushrooms -- continue cooking until meat is done -- add the rice mixture to the meat mixture and stir well, use the remaining vegetable broth to deglaze pan and get moisture level up for oven baking.
Remove about 3/4 of the squash meat and puree for pie or freeze for later use.
Fill squash with the rice/meat mixture about 1/2 full then add 1/2 the cheese, then layer remaining rice mixture on top and top it all with the remaining 1/2 cup of cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes just to get the cheese melted and the flavors melded.
Makes a great presentation to the table with the squash full of the meal!
84fd3c9208.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Cut squash in half lengthwise, scoop out seeds and pulp.
Place squash halves cut side down on a baking sheet.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool.
In a large pot, cook rice according to package directions.
In a large skillet, saute mushrooms, onion, carrots, and garlic until tender.
Add turkey and cook until no longer pink.
Add broth, water, parsley, pepper, and sage.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Spoon rice into squash shells, top with turkey mixture.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.

0f967b0694.gt:
In a large bowl, toss together the spinach, cranberries, blue cheese, tomatoes, avocado and red onion; set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together jam, vinegar, walnut oil, pepper and salt.
Taste, and adjust amounts to suit your liking.
Pour over the salad and toss to coat.
0f967b0694.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the spinach, cranberries, blue cheese, tomatoes, avocado, onion, raspberry jam, vinegar, walnut oil, pepper, and salt.
Serve immediately.

ec81905a61.gt:
Place the dry pancake mix into a large bowl.
Add the eggs, club soda and melted shortening.
Use a wire whisk to mix carefully until there are no lumps (dont over mix).
Allow the batter to rest while you preheat your griddle or skillet over medium-high heat.
Use about 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in the preheated skillet for each pancake; use 1/2 cup batter for each pancake.
Flip pancake only once when you see open bubbles appear on the surface and the edges appear dry around the pancake.
Makes about 10 pancakes 8 inches in diameter.
ec81905a61.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Mix together the Bisquick, eggs, club soda and shortening.
Spray a griddle with nonstick spray.
Pour batter into a 1/4 cup measure.
Cook on medium heat until bubbles form on top.
Flip and cook until golden brown.
Serve with syrup.

e531d7ab07.gt:
Cut the fat cap side off of the beef.
Rinse meat in water, then place in a slow cooker.
Sprinkle all sides of meat with salt generously.
Add up to 4 cups of baby carrots to the slow cooker.
Fill a large measuring cup with 4 cups of hot water.
Pour contents of seasoning envelope into the water and stir until blended.
Pour water and seasoning into the slow cooker.
Set slow cooker to cook on low for 8 to 10 hours.
If you only have 6 to 8 hours for cooking, set slow cooker on high for the last 3 hours, or all of the cooking time.
Additional ingredients can be added to the slow cooker during preparation, such as: quartered red potatoes, sliced celery, sliced onions, green peas.
If adding these extra ingredients, you may need to use a smaller meat portion in order to fit everything in your slow cooker.
My preference is to cook the largest meat portion I can and prepare mashed potatoes just before serving.
This option provides enough meat for pot roast leftovers the next night and two nights of beef enchiladas through the week.
Check out my recipes for Easy Extraordinary Mashed Potatoes and Pot Roast Turned Enchiladas.
e531d7ab07.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Place roast in a Dutch oven.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Add carrots and seasoning packet.
Cover with water.
Bake for 2 hours.
Remove from oven and let stand 10 minutes.
Cut into slices and serve.

c78e924f69.gt:
Whisk mayonnaise, yogurt, vinegar and crushed red pepper to taste in a medium bowl.
Add pineapple and coleslaw mix and stir to combine.
Place cornmeal in a shallow dish.
Sprinkle both sides of fish with Cajun seasoning and salt.
Dredge the fish in the cornmeal.
Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add half the fish and cook until golden, about 2 minutes per side.
Transfer to a plate and repeat with the remaining 2 teaspoons oil and fish, adjusting heat as needed to prevent burning.
Top toasted bread with the fish and pineapple slaw to make sandwiches.
Serve immediately.
c78e924f69.pred:
Heat grill to medium-high.
Brush fish with 1/4 cup of the oil; sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of the cajun seasoning and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt.
Grill fish until just cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.
Meanwhile, combine the remaining 1/4 cup oil, the vinegar, the remaining 1/2 teaspoon cajun seasoning, and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in a small bowl.
Brush the pineapple slaw with the dressing.
Grill the pineapple slaw until heated through, about 2 minutes.
To assemble, spread 1/4 cup of the mayonnaise on 4 of the bread slices; top with 1/4 cup of the yogurt, 1/4 cup of the pineapple slaw, and 1/4 cup of the remaining mayonnaise.
Top with the remaining 4 bread slices, mayonnaise side down.
Cut each sandwich into 4 pieces.

a203693020.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Roll out half of pastry to line pie pan, and roll out other half to cut into strips for lattice top.
In a medium mixing bowl combine eggs, sugar, flour, salt, lemon juice, and grated lemon rind.
Mix well then stir in pineapple.
Spread filling into pastry-lined pie pan, make lattice top, and crimp edges.
Place in preheated oven and bake 40 minutes or until filling is set and crust is lightly browned.
Chill before serving.
a203693020.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a medium bowl, combine the flour, salt, and lemon zest.
In a large bowl, beat the eggs and sugar together.
Add the lemon juice and beat until smooth.
Pour the egg mixture into the flour mixture and stir until just combined.
Pour into a 9 inch pie plate.
Bake for 45 minutes or until the filling is set.
Cool on a wire rack.
Serve with whipped cream.

df9193a49e.gt:
In a large pot, heat 1 tablespoons of the oil on high heat.
When hot, add the pork cubes and cook until soft.
Stir in the garlic, curry powder, coriander, cumin, and crushed red pepper.
Cook 1 minute.
Add ginger, cinnamon, bay leaf, salt, chicken broth, and tomato paste.
Bring liquid to a boil, cover and simmer on low for 45 minutes.
Add peanut butter and blend well.
Cook stew another 3 minutes, uncovered to blend.
Stir in chopped tomato and bell pepper.
Simmer 2-3 minutes, just until the vegetables soften but still retain shape.
Before serving, taste to correct seasonings; You may wish to add a final splash of lemon juice to refresh the flavors.
df9193a49e.pred:
In a large pot, heat 1 tablespoon peanut oil over medium-high heat.
Add pork and cook until browned, about 10 minutes.
Add onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add curry powder, coriander, cumin, red pepper flakes, ginger, cinnamon, and bay leaf.
Cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
Add chicken broth, tomato paste, and salt.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, covered, for 1 hour.
Add peanut butter, tomatoes, green pepper, and cilantro.
Cook, stirring, until peanut butter is melted and sauce is thickened, about 15 minutes.
Remove bay leaf.
Serve over rice.

fcf4d62dec.gt:
Measure the sugar and 1 tablespoon of water, and put into a pan.
You don't have to dissolve the sugar.
Measure out the water you will add later, and prepare in a cup.
Start heating over a medium-high heat.
It will gradually bubble up.
Keep watching it, and you'll see it starting to brown from the edges.
When all of the syrup has browned, turn off the heat.
It will keep cooking and the flavor will continue to deepen, so watch out!
If you like bitter caramel wait for a while before adding the water.
If you prefer less bitter caramel or you're serving this to little kiddies, add the water immediately.
It will splatter, so be careful.
Shake the pan to even out the consistency of the mixture.
If you added too much water, put the pan back on the heat to evaporate some.
Pour the caramel sauce into flan or pudding cups while it's still hot.
If you don't add it right away, it will harden!
Swirl the cups around so that the sauce is evenly distributed.
When the surface of the sauce hardens and no longer sticks to your fingers when you touch it, add the flan mixture and get going!
fcf4d62dec.pred:
Place the sugar and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
Add the water later, when the sugar has dissolved.
Boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
Remove from the heat and add the butter.
Stir until the butter has melted.
Pour the caramel sauce over the custard flans and serve.

88803603ec.gt:
Place sardines in 11 x 7 x 2-inch glass baking dish.
Sprinkle fish with 1 teaspoon coarse salt.
Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare barbecue (medium-high heat).
Combine cilantro, parsley, and lemon peel in small bowl.
Mix olives and onion in another small bowl.
Brush sardines lightly with oil.
Sprinkle half of herb mixture over sardines; turn to coat.
Grill sardines until just opaque in center, 1 to 2 minutes per side, depending on size.
Arrange sardines on platter.
Sprinkle with olive mixture, then remaining herb mixture.
Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper.
Garnish with lemon wedges.
88803603ec.pred:
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Brush the sardines with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and lemon peel.
Grill the sardines, turning once, until just cooked through, about 3 minutes per side.
Transfer the sardines to a serving platter and garnish with lemon wedges.
Sprinkle the sardines with the cilantro, parsley, and olives.
Serve with the red onion and cucumber slices.

e4f1c20d6c.gt:
Preheat oven to 400F
Beat egg yolks thoroughly with salt and paprika.
Beat in oil a little at a time.
Beat in butter a little at a time.
Stir in 3/4 of the cheese.
Combine with spinach.
Pour one third of spinach mixture into a greased shallow 9" square baking dish.
Season both sides of fish with lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Roll fish up and place rolls, loose side down, in pan on top of spinach.
Top with remaining spinach mixture.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes.
e4f1c20d6c.pred:
Cut fillets into 4 equal pieces.
In a bowl, beat egg yolks with salt and paprika.
In a saucepan, melt salad oil and butter.
Add egg yolk mixture and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Remove from heat and add cheese, spinach, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Stir until cheese is melted.
Spoon mixture into a 13x9 inch baking dish.
Arrange fish pieces on top.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
Serve with lemon wedges.

5a22f9a832.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Grease an 8-inch square baking dish.
Combine ground beef, rolled oats, French onion soup, and eggs in a bowl until thoroughly combined; transfer to prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until the meat loaf is no longer pink in the middle and an instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the center of the loaf reads at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C), 60 to 75 minutes.
5a22f9a832.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Combine ground beef, onion soup, eggs, and oats in a bowl.
Mix well.
Shape into a loaf and place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 45 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool for 10 minutes.
Cut into slices and serve.

7d71040d61.gt:
In a skillet, cook the spinach, stirring, until wilted; transfer to a colander and squeeze dry.
Finely chop the spinach.
In a bowl, combine 1 1/2 teaspoons of the soy sauce, the sesame oil, sherry, salt, sugar and white pepper.
Mix in the pork, scallion, ginger and spinach.
Chill for 10 minutes.
Dust a large baking sheet with cornstarch.
Arrange 4 wonton wrappers on a work surface, keeping the other wrappers covered with plastic wrap.
Brush the edges of the wrappers with water and spoon 1 teaspoon of filling in the center of each.
Fold the wrappers diagonally over the filling to form triangles; seal.
Bring the two opposite corners of the triangle together; press to seal.
Transfer to the baking sheet and cover.
Repeat.
In a large saucepan of boiling water, simmer the wontons over moderate heat, stirring occasionally.
When they float, cook for 3 minutes longer.
Drain the wontons well.
In a large bowl, combine the remaining soy sauce with the chile oil, peanut oil and garlic.
Add the wontons and toss.
Sprinkle with the cilantro and serve.
7d71040d61.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine spinach, soy sauce, sesame oil, sherry, salt, sugar, and pepper.
Set aside.
In a small bowl, combine the pork, scallion, ginger, cornstarch, and 1 tablespoon of chile oil.
Set aside.
Lay out the wonton wrappers on a clean work surface.
Place a small amount of the spinach mixture in the center of each wrapper.
Spoon a small amount of the pork mixture over the spinach.
Fold the wrapper over the filling, pressing the edges to seal.
Sprinkle a little cornstarch over the top of each wonton.
Heat the peanut oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the wontons and cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side.
Transfer to a baking sheet and bake until the wontons are crisp and the filling is hot, about 10 minutes.
Serve with the remaining chile oil and cilantro.

10dc73989c.gt:
Cook pasta as directed on package, omitting salt.
Meanwhile, heat large skillet on medium-high heat.
Add shrimp, tomatoes and cream cheese spread; cook and stir 3 to 4 min.
or until cream cheese is melted and shrimp are done.
Drain pasta; place in large bowl.
Add spinach and shrimp mixture; mix lightly.
10dc73989c.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Cook pasta in the boiling water until al dente.
Drain pasta and return to pot.
Add shrimp and cook for 3 minutes.
Drain shrimp and add to pasta.
Add tomatoes and spinach.
Stir in cream cheese spread.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

de0b779581.gt:
In 2-cup glass measuring cup, combine chicken broth and enough water to equal 2 cups.
In 2-quart saucepan, heat broth mixture, thyme, and nutmeg to boiling over high heat.
Add bulgur, reduce heat to medium-low.
Cover and simmer 10 to 15 minutes until liquid is absorbed.
Garnish each serving with a thyme sprig.
de0b779581.pred:
Cut the chicken into 1/2 inch cubes.
Add the chicken, broth, thyme, and nutmeg to a saucepan.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in the bulgur and cook for 10 minutes.
Garnish with thyme sprigs.

55c9dcc2b4.gt:
Cut each cake roll into eight slices; set aside any chocolate coating that separates from rolls for garnish.
Line a 9-inch springform pan with cake slices so that the swirl of cream and chocolate is on it's side and can be seen when you take the springform pan off, completely covering the bottom and sides.
In a small bowl, whisk milk and pudding mixes for 2 minutes.
Let stand for 2 minutes or until soft-set.
Pour over cake.
Spread with whipped topping; sprinkle with any reserved chocolate coating.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.
**Cook time does not include refrigeration time of two hours.
55c9dcc2b4.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
Spray 13x9-inch baking pan with cooking spray.
Unroll chocolate swiss rolls; separate into 12 rectangles.
Place 1 rectangle in bottom of prepared pan.
Spread 1/2 cup chocolate pudding over rectangle.
Top with 1/2 cup whipped topping.
Repeat layers with remaining rectangles and pudding and whipped topping.
Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool completely.
Cut into 12 bars.

e03a36dd25.gt:
Place popcorn kernels in paper bag.
Fold the top of the bag 3 times.
Place in microwave.
Set time for 40 to 60 seconds.
(this will vary depending on your microwave, Mine takes 3 minutes total)
When popping has stopped pour popcorn in a bowl and finish popping any unpopped kernels for 15 to 20 seconds (depending on your microwave).
Add rest of popcorn to bowl, when done.
Salt popcorn to your taste and enjoy!
Note: Add melted butter and/or other seasonings over top of popcorn and stir well to distribute butter and seasonings.
e03a36dd25.pred:
In a small brown paper bag, place 1/4 cup of popcorn.
Add 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/2 teaspoon of butter, if desired.
Close the bag and shake it up.
Place the bag on a paper plate and microwave for 2 minutes.
Remove the bag from the microwave and shake it again.
Repeat microwaving for 1 minute and shaking for 1 minute until the popcorn is popped.
Enjoy!

6febef31e3.gt:
Pour the water in a saucepan and heat it until medium hot.
Mix the cocoa powder with the water.
Add in Splenda and mix until the mixture becomes creamy and thick.
Do not add too much Splenda as biscuits themselves are the major source of sweetness in the recipe.
Crush the biscuits separately in a bowl.
Make sure the pieces are neither too big nor extremely powdery.
We just need small pieces.
Add the cocoa mixture to the bowl and mix it lightly with a spoon.
Take a small plastic bag and put in the resulting mixture, roll the plastic bag in a cylinder like shape.
Put the bag in a Refrigerator and allow it to cool for 4-6 hours.
6febef31e3.pred:
Place the cocoa powder and sugar-free shortbread cookies in a food processor.
Process until the cookies are finely ground.
Add the water and process until the mixture is smooth.
Add the Splenda and process until the mixture is well blended.
Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch pan.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 25 minutes.
Cool for 10 minutes before cutting into squares.

35d5f29f3c.gt:
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Meanwhile, saute onion in the olive oil, along with the dried basil.
Saute over medium heat and stir frequently so the basil does not burn.
Cook until onions are tender and translucent.
Add salt to taste.
When pasta is done, drain and add onion basil mixture.
Add cheese and toss to coat.
Serve warm.
Add salt to taste if needed.
35d5f29f3c.pred:
In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook pasta until al dente.
Drain.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add basil and cook for 1 minute.
Add pasta and toss to coat with oil.
Add cheese and toss until melted.
Serve immediately.

08a07f6ff5.gt:
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the rye, Licor 43, lemon juice and egg white and shake vigorously.
Strain into an ice-filled highball glass and top with half of the club soda.
Wait a moment for the drink to froth, then top with the remaining club soda.
08a07f6ff5.pred:
In a cocktail shaker, combine ice, rye whiskey, Licor 43, lemon juice and egg white.
Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Top with club soda and serve.

1c75a448ec.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Combine all ingredients except flour and walnuts in a mixing bowl.
Mix well.
Gradually add flour until well mixed.
Add walnuts.
You can substitute any nut you prefer.
Variation: I have occasionally omitted the nuts for chocolate chips - or used both.
I would almost say they are better than the toll house recipe.
Bake cookies for about 12 minutes on a cookie sheet.
Enjoy!
1c75a448ec.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in flour, baking soda, and salt.
Stir in walnuts.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.

b69844d37b.gt:
Chill 4 Martini glasses in freezer 30 minutes.
Combine all liquors in cocktail shaker; add ice cubes and shake to chill.
Strain mixture into cold glasses.
Garnish each with orange peel strip.
b69844d37b.pred:
In a cocktail shaker, combine the first 4 ingredients.
Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with the orange peel strips and serve.

a89ec9f9d3.gt:
* See my TastyKitchen recipe box for my Fail-Proof Pizza Dough recipe, if interested.
Preheat oven to 500 degrees F with a pizza stone inside.
If you dont have a pizza stone, use an upside down cookie sheet.
Mix butter and garlic in a small bowl and set aside.
Spread pizza dough out into a 12-inch circle on parchment paper.
(This makes it easier to transfer the dough to the pizza stone.)
Spread the butter and garlic mixture over dough and top with parmesan and mozzarella cheeses.
Top with a light sprinkling of salt and pepper, if desired.
(That step is totally optional!)
Transfer the dough to the preheated stone or pan.
Bake 9-10 minutes or until bubbly and golden.
Remove from oven and cool 1-2 minutes before cutting.
Serve hot, with marinara.
a89ec9f9d3.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the butter and garlic.
Stir in the Parmesan cheese and mozzarella cheese.
Add salt and pepper, if desired.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out the pizza dough into long strips.
Cut each strip into 4 pieces.
Place the pieces on a baking sheet.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, or until golden brown.
Serve hot.

865f667783.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Mix together ground beef, chestnuts, soy sauce, brown sugar, onion powder, and garlic powder thoroughly in a large bowl.
Form the mixture into 2 tablespoon-sized balls, and place onto a baking sheet.
Bake in preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, about 15 minutes.
Stir together the apricot preserves and the cider vinegar, toss with meatballs in a clean bowl, then return to baking sheet, and bake for an additional 5 minutes.
865f667783.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together ground beef, water chestnuts, soy sauce, brown sugar, onion powder, garlic powder, and apricot preserves.
Form into 1-inch balls and place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Serve with rice and a green salad.

d1c9619b01.gt:
Mix and bake cake according to the package
In a large bowl combine and mix the evaporated, condensed and heavy cream...
When the cake is at room temperature pour the milks over the cake...slowly letting the cake absorb the milk...let it rest in the fridge for 2 to 4 hours and then frost the cake with the cool whip frosting and top it off with the cinammon and sprinkles...
Enjoy!!
!
d1c9619b01.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix cake mix, evaporated milk, condensed milk, and whipping cream in a large bowl.
Pour into a greased 9x13 pan.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Cool completely.
Frost with cool whip.
Sprinkle with cinnamon and sprinkles.

449991b9b4.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix first 9 ingredients in large bowl until well blended.
Fill pepper halves with sausage mixture, dividing equally and mounding slightly.
Arrange in 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish.
(Can be made 1 day ahead.
Cover; chill.)
Bake peppers uncovered until tops are browned and thermometer inserted into filling registers 165F, about 1 hour.
Transfer peppers to platter.
Garnish with rosemary sprigs and serve.
449991b9b4.pred:
Place the sausages in a large skillet and cook over medium heat until browned, about 10 minutes.
Remove from the skillet and set aside.
Add the zucchini, onion, parsley, breadcrumbs, egg, pepper, salt, and rosemary to the skillet.
Cook and stir until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the sausages and cook for 5 minutes more.
Spoon the mixture into the peppers and place in a 13x9-inch baking dish.
Bake in a 350F oven for 30 minutes.
Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the rosemary sprigs.
Serve hot.

0ca9bd3da2.gt:
Preheat oven to 350.To prepare aioli, combine first 5 ingredients in a small bowl; set aside.To prepare crab cakes, combine bell pepper and next 7 ingredients (through black pepper) in a large bowl; stir well with a whisk.
Add panko and crabmeat; toss gently.
Divide the crab mixture into 12 equal portions, shaping each into a 1-inch-thick patty.Heat oil in a large ovenproof skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat.
Add patties; cook 2 minutes.
Carefully turn patties over.
Place pan in oven; bake at 350 for 6 minutes.
0ca9bd3da2.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a medium bowl, combine the first 6 ingredients.
Add the crabmeat, panko, and remaining ingredients; mix well.
Shape into 12 small patties.
Coat with cooking spray and place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

c651774003.gt:
Wrap each banana slice with a piece of bacon.
Fry wrapped banana in a skillet until bacon is desired crispness, 15 to 30 minutes.
Remove wrapped bananas from skillet with a toothpick and place on a serving dish.
c651774003.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place bacon slices on a baking sheet.
Bake for 10 minutes, until bacon is crisp.
Remove bacon from oven and set aside.
Wrap each banana half in a bacon slice.
Place wrapped bananas on the baking sheet.
Bake for 10 minutes, until bananas are soft.
Remove from oven and serve.

59de26d69e.gt:
Saute onions and celery
Add chicken powder & 4 cups of water add chicken pieces (wingdings) & cook on med high for 45mins
Add cream of chicken let cook for another 30 mins
Cook rice as it states on the box
Place rice on plate top with chicken and enjoy
59de26d69e.pred:
to boil chicken],1/2 cup flour,1/2 cup milk,1/2 cup water,1/2 tsp salt,1/2 tsp pepper,1/2 tsp onion powder,1/2 tsp garlic powder,1/2 tsp paprika.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Place chicken in a 9x13 baking dish.
Mix all ingredients for gravy in a small bowl.
Pour gravy over chicken.
Bake for 1 hour or until chicken is done.
Serve with rice.

e4e4b2152e.gt:
Heat oven to 400 degrees.
Add 3/4 can water to soup.
Heat.
Mix 3/4 can water with flour.
Stir into soup.
Cook, stirring until it thickens.
Add tuna.
Pour into a baking dish.
Mix Bisquick with milk.
Roll into an 8x10 rectangle.
Spread with cheese and pimiento.
Roll like a jelly roll.
Cut into 12 slices.
Place on the tuna mixture.
Bake for 15 minutes.
e4e4b2152e.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix together the flour, milk, cheese, pimiento, and soup.
Place tuna in a greased 13x9 inch baking dish.
Pour the flour mixture over the tuna.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Serve with a salad and garlic bread.

01eb818f49.gt:
Cook the chicken breast pieces in the water in a large pot over high heat until done (170 degrees).
Remove the chicken pieces to plate and cover with plastic wrap; set aside.
Pour the dried pasta in to the same boiling water and cook until tender, about 6 minutes.
Drain in a colander; set aside.
Place the Greek yogurt, the Hidden Valley Original Ranch Seasoning Mix, the reserved marinating juice from the artichoke hearts, Parmesan cheese, the zest and juice of the lemon, white pepper, curry and cayenne powders in a small sized bowl and whisk until well blended and smooth.
Add in the 2 diced chives, carrots, celery, parsley, shallots and pimento and gently stir.
Pour this mixture over the cooked pasta in a larger bowl and add the cooked chicken breast pieces that have been diced into small cubes.
Mix until all is evenly coated.
To serve, plate a serving of the pasta mixture and garnish with (optional) parsley, several grape tomatoes, 1 purple cabbage leaf, chives pieces and several quarters of artichoke hearts.
01eb818f49.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine chicken, water, yogurt, and seasoning mix.
Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Drain chicken and discard water.
In a large skillet, cook chicken over medium heat until no longer pink.
Remove from skillet and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine pasta, chicken, yogurt, parmesan cheese, lemon juice and zest, white pepper, curry powder, cayenne pepper, carrots, celery, shallots, artichoke hearts, pimientos, parsley, and 2 Tablespoons of reserved artichoke juice.
Toss to combine.
Transfer to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, for 25 minutes.
Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

22df25b9dd.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Mix baking crumbs and butter; press onto bottom of 9-inch springform pan.
Beat cream cheese and granulated sugar in large bowl with mixer until blended.
Add chocolate and liqueur; mix well.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, mixing on low speed after each addition just until blended.
Pour over crust.
Bake 45 to 50 min.
or until centre is almost set.
Run knife around rim of pan to loosen cake; cool before removing rim.
Refrigerate cheesecake 4 hours.
Sprinkle icing sugar over cheesecake just before serving.
Top with berries.
22df25b9dd.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Lightly grease a 9-inch springform pan.
In a food processor, pulse cookies until finely crushed.
Add the butter and pulse until combined.
Press onto the bottom of the prepared pan.
Bake 10 minutes.
Cool completely.
In a large bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
Add chocolate and liqueur and beat until combined.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Pour into the crust.
Bake 40 minutes.
Turn off oven and leave cake in oven with door closed for 1 hour.
Remove from oven and cool completely.
Refrigerate overnight.
To serve, run a knife around the edge of the pan to loosen cake.
Remove the sides of the pan.
Garnish with berries.

f0e77c97c6.gt:
Preheat oven to 350.
Brown onion, garlic and ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat for about 4 minutes.
Add red pepper flakes and continue cooking until the ground beef is fully cooked.
(If using fresh cabbage, add here and cook until soft.)
Drain extra fat out of the skillet then stir in drained sauerkraut and Worcestershire.
Heat through and set aside.
Press 1 package of crescent roll dough into the bottom of a lightly greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
Spread beef mixture on top and cover with cheese.
Lay second package of crescent roll dough over the top of the beef and cheese mixture.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown.
f0e77c97c6.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until beef is no longer pink; drain.
Stir in sauerkraut, red pepper flakes, Worcestershire sauce, and garlic.
Spoon into a 13x9-inch baking dish.
Cover with crescent rolls, sealing edges.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake 25 minutes or until rolls are golden brown.
Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

93479dc342.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
In a large mixing bowl, cream sugar, shortening, and salt.
Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
Add extract and mix well.
In a separate bowl, sift flour and baking powder.
Add milk to creamed mixture.
Add flour mixture to creamed mixture.
Fold in coconut.
Bake in a greased and floured bundt pan for 1 hour.
About 10 minutes before cake is done, combine sugar, extract and water in a small saucepen.
Bring to a boil and boil one minute.
Pour over cake immediately after removing cake from the oven.
Let cake sit 30 minutes before removing from pan.
93479dc342.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan.
In a large bowl, combine sugar, Crisco, salt, eggs, coconut extract and flour.
Beat at medium speed for 2 minutes.
Add milk and beat for 2 more minutes.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 1 hour or until cake tests done.
Remove from oven and cool in pan for 10 minutes.
Remove from pan and cool completely.
Frost with coconut cream cheese frosting.

18c37b1d2b.pred:
Place ricotta cheese, peanut butter, vanilla extract and sugar substitute in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a serving dish.
Refrigerate until chilled.
Serve with a spoon.

9bde591cc5.gt:
In a large skillet, brown the ground meat and drain off any grease.
Add the chopped onion and cook for about 3 minutes, until the onions are softened.
Add the cabbage and water and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the cabbage starts to wilt.
Add the tomatoes, brown sugar, vinegar, salt, caraway seed and garlic.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat and cover.
Simmer until the cabbage is cooked to the desired tenderness, about 30 minutes.
Serve with white rice.
9bde591cc5.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large skillet, brown meat and onion.
Add cabbage and water.
Cover and cook on medium-low heat for 10 minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes, brown sugar, vinegar, salt, caraway seeds, and garlic powder.
Cover and cook for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes.
Spoon into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.

e1cc65aa99.gt:
Grease 9 x 13 inch pan.
Heat syrup, butter and morsels to boiling stirring constantly.
Remove from heat, stir in vanilla.
Pour over cereal in bowl, toss until coated.
Fold in marshmallows 1 cup at a time.
Press into pan with buttered back of spoon.
Let stand 1 hour.
Cut into 2 inch squares.
Store at room temperature.
e1cc65aa99.pred:
Mix all ingredients except marshmallows in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Stir until butter is melted.
Remove from heat.
Stir in marshmallows.
Spread into a greased 13x9-inch pan.
Cool completely.
Cut into 16 squares.

f3de3243b2.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Cut twelve 1/2 slices on the diagonal from the baguette.
Lay them out on a baking sheet and lightly brush the tops with olive oil and sprinkle with black pepper.
Bake for 10-15 minutes or until golden-brown.
When done remove the pan from the oven and set it aside.
Meanwhile, cook the bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crispy.
When done, set bacon aside on a paper towel-lined plate.
Very thinly slice the brie and set aside.
Cut the peaches in half and remove the pit.
Lay the halves flat-side down and cut into 1/4 thick slices.
Heat a grill pan over medium-high and lightly coat with cooking spray.
Grill the peaches for no more than 60 seconds on each side, brushing lightly with balsamic vinegar.
Place a piece of brie on each crostini, followed by half a piece of bacon and a peach slice.
Arrange them on a platter, sprinkle with chopped basil, and serve.
Makes 12 crostini.
f3de3243b2.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the olive oil, pepper, and vinegar.
Spread the mixture over the cut sides of the baguette.
Sprinkle the bacon over the oiled bread.
Top with the cheese and peaches.
Place under the broiler until the cheese is melted and the bread is toasted.
Remove from the oven and drizzle with the balsamic vinegar.
Sprinkle with basil.

4c06a6e6ee.gt:
Mix the sugar and Boric Acic well.
Add the warm water slowly, mixing all the while so it won't be too lumpy.
Store in a jar.
When ready to use, put cotton into the top of a jar lid to fill it, and then saturate the cotton to the top.
Place where you want it; make several if you need it.
Will keep for a long while.
NOTE: I usually drip a drop or two over the edge of the lid to rest on the counter so they will find it sooner.
It sometimes takes a little while for them to find it, but find it they will.
When they do, let them alone; you will want to kill them because they look so creepy; but don't because they will hang over the edge of the lid and drink, drink, drink, and then take it back to the nest.
Almost over night, they will be gone.
4c06a6e6ee.pred:
Place all ingredients in a spray bottle and mix well.
Spray around the area where ants are present.
Repeat the treatment every 3 days for 3 weeks.
This will kill the ants and keep them away.

cfc57858dc.gt:
Chill a serving bowl in the freezer while you make the salsa.
In a mixing bowl, combine the chopped green chiles, onion, green olives, and black olives.
Lightly mix in the Cheddar cheese and tomatoes; season to taste with garlic salt and black pepper.
If desired, mix in a little bit of the olive brine.
Serve in the chilled bowl.
cfc57858dc.pred:
In a small bowl, combine all ingredients.
Stir well.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Serve with pita chips or vegetables.

21827f90ac.gt:
Bring carrots and cauliflower to boil in 1 inch water in Dutch oven or large deep skillet; cover.
Cook 2 min.
Add broccoli; cook, covered, 3 to 5 min.
or until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Meanwhile, heat oil in small saucepan on medium-high heat.
Add onions; cook and stir 1 min.
Add cream cheese product and milk; cook and stir 2 to 3 min.
or until cream cheese is completely melted and mixture is well blended, stirring frequently.
Drain vegetables; place in bowl.
Top with cream cheese sauce.
21827f90ac.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place carrots, cauliflower, broccoli, oil, and green onions in a large baking dish.
Mix together the cream cheese product and milk until smooth.
Pour over the vegetables and toss to coat.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.

12da18d9e5.gt:
In a large pot, cook the wheat berries according to the package directions.
Set aside and let cool to room temperature.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the apple cider vinegar, orange juice, salt, pepper, nutmeg, cinnamon, olive oil and lemon juice.
Set aside.
In a large bowl, toss the cooked wheat berries, Goji berries, apple, celery, scallions, parsley and pecans together until combined.
Pour half the dressing over the salad and stir thoroughly.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Prior to serving, pour the remaining dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve immediately or store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.
12da18d9e5.pred:
1.
Combine the par-cooked wheat berries, apple cider vinegar, orange juice, salt, pepper, nutmeg, and cinnamon in a large bowl.
2.
Let the wheat berries soak in the vinegar mixture for at least 1 hour.
3.
Drain the wheat berries and transfer them to a large salad bowl.
4.
Add the remaining ingredients, except the pecans, and toss to combine.
5.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.
6.
Before serving, add the pecans and toss again.

9008821dbd.gt:
In large bowl, whisk together oil and lime juice.
Add cilantro, cumin, salt and pepper to taste, mixing well.
Stir in beans, bell pepper, corn, onion, and jalapeno pepper.
Taste and adjust seasoning.
To serve, garnish with cilantro sprigs.
Serve at room temperature.
9008821dbd.pred:
In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lime juice, cilantro, cumin, and salt.
Add the black beans, red bell peppers, corn, red onion, jalapenos, and radishes.
Toss to combine.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Serve chilled.

13da1b6a5b.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350F.
Coat a pie pan with cooking spray.
Heat a medium nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium heat.
Cook the scallions, bell pepper, and bacon for 3 minutes, or until softened.
Spoon into the prepared pie pan.
Top with the Cheddar.
In a large bowl combine the milk, egg substitute, mustard, and nutmeg.
Pour into the pie pan.
Sprinkle with the Parmesan.
Bake for 35 minutes, or until golden and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.
13da1b6a5b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine scallions, green pepper, Canadian bacon, cheese, evaporated milk, egg substitute, mustard, nutmeg, and parmesan.
Pour into a 9-inch pie plate.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Serve warm.

c8dbf06636.gt:
Season chicken on both sides, pushing in seasoning.
Once seasoned get a fork or knife and tenderize by poking repeatedly.
Then cover meat place in fridge about 2 hours.
After 2 hours wash your potatoes cook in microwave 1 at a time for about 4 or 5 minutes until soft.
Set aside
Chop and wash broccoli add to boiling water steam to your liking 5 or 10 minutes.
Drain water add some butter season to your taste.
Add olive oil to pan heat on medium heat.
Once heated add 2 breast at a time cooking about 5 minutes on each side.
Once almost done cover with lid cook about 5 more minutes.
(Make sure the fire is not to high the key is to cook slow)
In a pot add some butter and seasoning and peeled potatoes to pot mash up potatoes add milk , cheese, and green onions.
Blend until cheese melts.
Lumps are ok.
Time to grub place on plate lick fingers yummm!
I only used paprika on chicken..
c8dbf06636.pred:
Heat oven to 400 degrees.
Cut chicken into 1/2 inch strips.
Place chicken in a large bowl.
Mix with paprika, accent, black pepper, garlic powder, garlic salt and 1/2 teaspoon of salt.
Set aside.
Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch slices.
Place in a large bowl.
Add butter and toss to coat.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Set aside.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add green onions and cook until softened, about 2 minutes.
Add broccoli and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add milk and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes.
Add chicken and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes.
Remove from heat.
Place potatoes in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Spoon chicken mixture over potatoes.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake at 400 degrees for 25 minutes.
Serve with green onion sprigs.

77d4a763dd.gt:
Add 1 tbsp oil into pan and add 1/2 tsp 'WK Seed Blend'
Cut the following into 1 1/2 inch long by 1/2 inch wide strips and set aside: - tofu (1 cup) - onions (1/2 cup) - tomatoes (1/2 cup) - bell pepper (1 cup)
Set to medium heat and heat oil into there is small movement in spices (usually 2 min)
Immediately add onions to pan; stir until golden brown (usually 3 min)
Add 2 tsp 'WK Sabji Blend' and 3/4 tsp salt (to your taste)
Add bell peppers and tomatoes to pan, stir; cover and cook for 3 min
Add tofu to pan; cover and cook for 3 min
Uncover pan and cook for 2 min
Optional: garnish with 2 tbsp coarsely chopped cilantro
For a full meal add: - Rice, naan, bread or heated whole wheat tortilla - Salad - Any bean curry - Yogurt - Red wine
77d4a763dd.pred:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
In a non-stick pan, heat the oil.
Add the onion and cook until soft and translucent.
Add the bell pepper and cook until soft.
Add the tomato and cook until it starts to break down.
Add the cilantro and cook for a minute.
Add the tofu and cook until it is heated through.
Add the WK Seed Blend, WK Sabji Blend, and salt.
Stir well.
Cover the pan and cook for 10 minutes.
Uncover the pan and cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve with rice.

7b189a7aea.gt:
Grind cookies in a food processor into fine crumbs; transfer to a large mixing bowl.
Grind pecans in the food processor; add to cookie crumbs.
Stir 1 cup confectioners' sugar, bourbon whiskey, cocoa powder, and corn syrup with the cookies and pecans until the mixture holds together; roll into 3/4-inch balls.
Spread coconut onto a plate and 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar onto a separate plate.
Roll balls in coconut and sugar to coat.
Arrange balls onto a platter, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until hardened, at least 1 hour.
7b189a7aea.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Line a 15x10x1-inch baking pan with foil.
In a medium bowl, combine the vanilla wafer cookies, pecans, confectioners' sugar, bourbon whiskey, cocoa powder, corn syrup, and coconut.
Mix well.
Press 2/3 of the mixture into the prepared pan.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from the oven and spread the remaining 1/3 of the mixture over the top.
Bake for 10 minutes more.
Cool completely.
Cut into 2-inch squares.
Store in an airtight container.

b379bad205.gt:
Place potato and 3 tbs water in a small bowl.
Cover with plastic wrap, vent and microwave 4 minutes or until tender, stirring once.
Set aside.
Heat a 10" skillet over med-high heat.
Coat pan with cooking spray and add onion.
Cover and cook 10 minutes or until lightly browned, stirring occasionally.
Uncover and cook 10 minutes or until golden brown, stirring frequently.
While onions cook, add 1/3 cup water, 1 Tbs at a time to prevent sticking.
Stir in potato, sage, salt and pepper.
Spoon into bowl and cool.
Combine 1/4 cup cheese, milk, egg whites and eggs in a bowl.
Add egg mixture to potato mixture and stir well.
Preheat broiler.
Pour mixture into skillet coated with cooking spray.
Cook over medium heat for 7 minutes or until bottom of frittata is browned and top is almost set.
Sprinkle remaining cheese on top and broil for 5 minutes or until cheese melts and top is set.
b379bad205.pred:
In a large skillet, saute onion in water until tender.
Add water, potatoes, sage, salt, pepper, and 1/2 cup of the cheese.
Cook over medium heat until potatoes are tender.
Remove from heat and stir in milk.
Beat egg whites and eggs together and pour into potato mixture.
Stir until well blended.
Sprinkle remaining cheese on top.
Cover and cook over low heat until eggs are set.
Serve hot.

625c3e8493.gt:
Add coarsely chopped or halved cherries to a large pot.
Add lemon juice, cherry Kirsch, and vanilla extract and bring the mixture to a slow boil over medium-high heat.
In a bowl, whisk together cocoa powder and 2 cups of sugar until it is evenly distributed and there are no clumps.
Add the cocoa/sugar mixture to the cherries.
Add the remaining sugar.
Bring the mixture back up to a boil.
Stir in the butter and reduce the heat to medium.
Simmer for 1215 minutes, stirring often, until the sugar has completely dissolved and the mixture has thickened slightly.
The sauce will thicken further once it cools.
To can and store the Black Forest Sundae Sauce: Ladle hot sundae sauce into sterilized half pint jars, leaving 1/4 headspace.
Wipe jar rims and add lids.
Process jars in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes.
Remove the jars and cool on wire racks.
Store in a cool, dark place.
Store any opened jars in the refrigerator.
625c3e8493.pred:
Heat the butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
Add the cherries, lemon juice, cherry kirsch, vanilla extract, and cocoa powder.
Stir until the cherries are coated with the sauce.
Remove from heat and allow to cool.
Spoon the sauce over ice cream.

3c3a00487b.gt:
combine first 5 ingredients in large bowl -- make well in center.
combine egg, milk and oil, stir well.
add to dry ingredients, just till moistened --
combine blueberries, 1 tbls flour and 1 tbls sugar, toss gently to coat.
fold into batter.
spoon batter into 6 greased jumbo muffin cups, 2/3 rds full --
combine 1/4 cup sugar, 2 1/2 tbls flour and cinnamon, cut in butter -- till crumbly --
sprinkle over batter.
bake at 400* for 20 minutes or golden.
remove from pan to wire rack immediately.
3c3a00487b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Grease 12 muffin cups.
In a large bowl, combine flour, salt, baking powder, sugar, lemon rind, and milk.
Beat in eggs and oil.
Stir in blueberries.
Spoon batter into muffin cups.
Sprinkle with streusel topping.
Bake for 20 minutes.

e77203d622.gt:
Throw the ingredients in a blender and whizz until smooth.
Easy!
Great for a fast breakfast and packed full of fruit for a healthy start or snack
Using frozen fruit means there's no need to chill.
If you have leftovers, stir in some lemon juice to keep the colour nice.
It gives an added yogurty tang too
Makes 500mls/2 cups.
I classed it as 4 kid sized portions as I make it for Jack
e77203d622.pred:
In a blender, combine the bananas, frozen fruit, rice / coconut milk, vanilla, agave nectar and blend until smooth.
Serve immediately.

c3b113f071.gt:
Cook bacon and set aside.
Fry beef with mushrooms and salt and pepper (or seasoning of your choice).
Unroll crescent triangles on baking sheet.
Add a thick slice of cheese, bacon, beef mixture and green onions to each triangle and roll up.
Place a thin piece of cheese on top of roll.
Cook stuffed crescent rolls as per the package instructions and ENJOY!
!
c3b113f071.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, cook beef and onions over medium heat until beef is no longer pink.
Drain.
Stir in the mushrooms and season with salt and pepper.
Spread 1/4 cup of the beef mixture on each of the 8 crescent rolls.
Top with 1 slice of bacon and 1 slice of cheese.
Roll up and place seam side down on a baking sheet.
Repeat with remaining crescent rolls, beef mixture, bacon, and cheese.
Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve warm.

337c3e4209.gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees.
Wash potatoes and leave the skins on.
Cut into large, equal-sized chunks, and place them in a large mixing bowl.
Slice the onion thickly, separate and place them in the bowl as well.
Add all of your dry ingredients, along with the olive oil, and give it a good mix to evenly distribute everything together.
Cut each sausage link into thirds and place in the bowl with the potatoes and onions.
From here, I mix this all together with my hands.
Gently mix the sausage into the potato and onion mixture, trying not to break apart the sausage as you do this.
Dump this all into a 13 x 9 baking dish and cover with aluminum foil.
Place in the oven and allow this to cook for a minimum of one hour.
After an hour, turn the oven up to 400 degrees, remove the foil and place back in the oven until the sausage is nicely brown.
Stir every few minutes so all the sausage gets some equal browning space.
This can take anywhere from 15 to 30 minutes to achieve.
Make sure you watch this closely after returning to the oven so your potatoes and sausage dont burn.
Notes: I used light tasting olive oil, which is my preference.
If you prefer a stronger tasting oil, like extra virgin olive oil, feel free to use it.
While I normally cook with fresh, chopped garlic, I dont use it in this recipe, and substitute the garlic powder.
Fresh garlic tends to pool in the bottom of the dish, or on the top, and burns when browning the sausage.
337c3e4209.pred:
In a large pot, cook sausage and onion over medium heat until sausage is browned and onion is soft.
Add potatoes and cook until tender.
Drain fat.
Add olive oil, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Stir to coat.
Cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve with your favorite sauce.

11e9299476.gt:
Preheat the oven according the directions for the biscuits.
Have the biscuits ready to put in oven
Start cooking the Sausage.
Once cook drain out the oil that's in the pan
Leave sausage in pan.
Add the flour and the milk.
Put heat to high and continue to mix.
Don't stop mixing until the gravy starts to boil.
Once its boiling, lower down heat to simmer for 5min.
Don't touch for those 5min.
Now put in the biscuits in the oven
Once the 5min is up give the gravy a little mix and set aside to cool down.
The longer it sits outside the thicker it would get.
When the biscuits are ready open them up and pour the sausage gravy on top.
Enjoy.
11e9299476.pred:
Mix the sausage, flour, milk, salt and pepper together.
Form into a ball and roll out into a 1/4 inch thick circle.
Place the sausage in the center of the circle and fold the dough over the sausage.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
Serve with gravy.

ea0c63b401.gt:
In a medium saute pan, bring the stock to a boil.
Add the orzo and cook for 7 to 8 minutes until liquid is almost absorbed and orzo is tender.
Turn off heat.
Stir in the remaining ingredients.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.
Enjoy!
ea0c63b401.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large saucepan, bring the stock to a boil.
Add the orzo and cook until al dente.
Drain and set aside.
In a blender, combine the lemon juice, cream, parmesan cheese, cream cheese, butter, chives, and pepper.
Blend until smooth.
Add the cooked orzo and toss to coat.
Transfer to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Sprinkle with the lemon zest and bake for 20 minutes.
Serve hot.

c3ac924e63.gt:
Light a grill.
Shape the meat into 4 patties and season on both sides with salt and pepper.
Wrap each hamburger with 2 slices of pancetta.
Grill the burgers over a medium-hot fire for about 4 minutes, or until nicely browned on the bottom.
Flip the burgers and top them with the Gorgonzola.
Grill for about 4 minutes longer, or until nicely browned and cooked through.
Meanwhile, brush the cut sides of the buns with the butter and grill them, cut side down, until lightly toasted.
Set the burgers on the bun bottoms and top with the lettuce, tomato and onion.
Serve at once.
c3ac924e63.pred:
Prepare grill for medium heat.
In a large bowl, combine the ground sirloin, salt and pepper.
Form into 4 patties, about 3/4-inch thick.
Grill over medium heat until cooked through, about 5 minutes per side.
Remove from grill and set aside.
In a large skillet, cook the pancetta over medium heat until crisp, about 5 minutes.
Remove from pan and set aside.
In the same skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the Gorgonzola cheese and cook until melted, about 2 minutes.
Add the pancetta and toss to combine.
Season with salt and pepper.
Divide the cheese mixture among the 4 patties.
Top each patty with a slice of pancetta and a slice of Gorgonzola cheese.
Place the patties on the grill and cook until the cheese is melted, about 2 minutes.
Serve on buns with lettuce, tomato and onion.

ffcb21a60b.gt:
In a pot combine vegetable broth and milk and bring to a boil.
turn off heat, stir in polenta and cook until thickened (abut 3-5 minutes).
Set aside to thicken further.
Clean, wash and peel the carrots.
Slice lenghtwise.
Heat butter in a skillet and add carrots.
Saute for some minutes, then add 5 tbs of water and cook covered on medium heat for another ten minutes until soft.
Season with sugar, salt and pepper.
Add sour cream or yoghurt, sage and half of the cheese to the polenta and stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Pour into a casserole dish (about 20X12 cm) and top with the carrots (I used their liquid too since it was full of flavour, but that way the casserole may get a bit soggy).
Sprinkle with remaining cheese and bake in the preheated oven at 200C (~400F) for 20 minutes.
Let stand for about 5 minutes until polenta has set and can be sliced.
ffcb21a60b.pred:
Preheat oven to 180C.
In a saucepan, combine vegetable broth, milk, butter and sage.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes.
In a large bowl, mix polenta, carrots, sour cream, yoghurt, cheese and sugar.
Pour the milk mixture over the polenta mixture and stir until combined.
Pour into a 2-litre ovenproof dish.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Serve warm.

167bcf0a2a.gt:
FRIED SCRUMBLE EGGS
fried scrumble egg set aside
BAKE BACON
bake bacon on parchment paper at 200 C for 15 minute then set aside
SAUTE SPINACH
with oiled pan quick saute spinach for 1 minute with a dash of salt then set aside
FRIED GARLIC AND SHALLOT
fry garlic and shallot till fragrant then add light soy sauce and off heat then add fried eggs and bacon mix well
top on cooked spinach and serve immediately
167bcf0a2a.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, garlic, shallot, and salt.
In a large bowl, toss the spinach with the dressing.
Spread the spinach on a baking sheet and bake for 5 minutes.
Cut the bacon into 3 pieces and fry in a skillet until crispy.
In a large bowl, whisk the eggs with a fork.
Add the bacon to the spinach and toss to combine.
Place the spinach mixture in a 9x13 baking dish.
Pour the egg mixture over the spinach.
Bake for 15 minutes or until the egg is set.

73a84e1f5e.gt:
Wash and peel the zucchini and cut into long strips.
Season with salt and pepper.
Mix the eggs, milk and salt, dip the zucchini strips into the mixture and then roll in the breadcrumbs.
Saute until crisp on the outside but not overcooked, about 2-3 minutes.
Serve.
73a84e1f5e.pred:
Mix together the zucchini, eggs, milk, salt and pepper.
Heat oil or butter in a skillet.
Dip the zucchini in the egg mixture and then in the breadcrumbs.
Fry in the hot oil until golden brown.
Serve immediately.

6bf369490a.gt:
Stir boiling water into dry gelatin mix in large bowl at least 2 min.
until completely dissolved.
Drain pineapple, reserving juice.
Add enough ice to juice to measure 1-1/2 cups.
Add to gelatin; stir until ice is completely melted.
Refrigerate 45 min.
or until slightly thickened.
Remove 1-1/2 cups of the gelatin; place in medium bowl.
Stir in pineapple; set aside.
Add 1-1/2 cups of the whipped topping to remaining gelatin; stir with wire whisk until well blended.
Pour into 9-inch square dish.
Refrigerate 15 min.
or until set but not firm.
Carefully spoon fruited gelatin over creamy layer in dish.
Refrigerate at least 3 hours or until firm.
Cut into 9 squares.
Serve topped evenly with the remaining whipped topping.
6bf369490a.pred:
Heat water in large saucepan.
Add dry gelatin mixes; stir until dissolved.
Add pineapple, undrained, and ice cubes; stir.
Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens.
Remove from heat; stir in COOL WHIP.
Pour into 8-inch square pan sprayed with cooking spray.
Refrigerate until firm.
Cut into 8 squares.

5c462ab39b.gt:
Mix all ingredients well and refrigerate for a few hours to let the flavors blend!
Its that simple!
My mom got this recipe from a friend of hers more than 20 years ago.
Her friend got the recipe while staying at an Inn/B&B named The Magnolia in Napa Valley.
5c462ab39b.pred:
Place all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well.
Refrigerate for 24 hours before serving.
Serve with salad, chicken, or possibly as a sandwich spread.

51e70cd927.gt:
Heat oven to 425 degrees F.
Cut potatoes lengthwise in half; place, cut sides down, on foil-covered rimmed baking sheet.
Bake 30 to 35 min.
or until tender.
Scoop out centers of potatoes into bowl, leaving 1/4-inch-thick shells.
Add Neufchatel, milk, sugar and cinnamon to potatoes; mash until blended.
Fill shells with potato mixture; top with nuts.
Bake 8 min.
or until potatoes are heated through and nuts are toasted.
51e70cd927.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
Cut sweet potatoes lengthwise into 1/2-inch-thick slices.
Place in single layer on baking sheet.
Sprinkle with Neufchatel cheese.
Bake 20 min.
or until cheese is melted.
Remove from oven; top with brown sugar and cinnamon.
Bake 5 min.
or until sugar is melted and potatoes are tender.
Sprinkle with nuts.
Serve immediately.

5bcccb4e9b.gt:
Heat 1 Tbsp.
oil in medium nonstick skillet on medium-high heat.
Add potatoes and red pepper, cook 8 to 10 min.
or until tender; transfer to bowl; set aside.
Meanwhile in small bowl, whisk eggs and pepper.
Heat remaining oil in skillet.
Add egg mixture; cook 2 to 3 min.
or until eggs are almost set, lifting edge with spatula and tilting skillet to allow uncooked portion to flow underneath.
When egg mixture is set but top is still slightly moist, top with potato mixture and cheese.
Slip spatula underneath omelette, tip skillet to loosen and gently fold omelette in half.
Cook 1 to 2 min.
Slide or flip onto serving plate; cut in half.
5bcccb4e9b.pred:
Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add potatoes and red pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes.
While potatoes are cooking, whisk eggs, black pepper, and 1/4 cup cheese in a bowl.
Pour egg mixture over potatoes and peppers.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until eggs are set, about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle remaining cheese over top and cook until melted, about 1 minute.
Serve immediately.

26e693a67f.gt:
Heat oven to 425F.
Spray pie pan with cooking spray.
Place crust in pan and crimp edges.
Toss apples with lemon juice.
Stir in sugars and flour.
Pour into prepared crust.
Mix sugar into oatmeal.
Cut margarine into oatmeal, I do this with my fingers, you can use two forks or pastry blender.
Sprinkle oatmeal mixture on apples.
Place in oven for about 25 minutes Then take out and place foil around edges and put back in oven for about 20 minutes more.
Allow to cool before serving at least 15 minutes.
26e693a67f.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Mix together pie crust, apples, lemon juice, spiced sugar, white sugar, flour, oatmeal and light margarine.
Place in a 9 inch pie pan.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Cool on a wire rack.

78bbc2284a.gt:
1.
Place the grapes on a parchment-lined plate in the freezer.
2.
Pour the boiling water over the hibiscus flowers, cover and allow to steep 15-20 minutes.
Whisk in the sugar until it dissolves.
3.
Pour the red wine and sliced peaches into a small pitcher.
Strain the hibiscus tea over the top, discarding the flowers.
4.
Chill this mixture until ready to serve.
5.
Stir in the frozen grapes, and enjoy while watching the sunset.
78bbc2284a.pred:
In a small saucepan, combine the grapes, boiling water, dried hibiscus flowers, and sugar.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and let cool.
Strain the mixture through a fine sieve into a pitcher.
Add the peach slices and wine.
Stir well and serve.

f87c45ee62.gt:
Place margarine, marshmallow creme and vanilla in small bowl; beat on medium speed until well blended.
Gradually add sugar, beating after each addition until well blended.
Blend in 1 Tbsp.
of the milk.
Add remaining 1 Tbsp.
milk if necessary for desired spreading consistency.
f87c45ee62.pred:
Place margarine in a large bowl.
Add in the marshmallow creme and vanilla.
Mix well.
Add in powdered sugar, mixing until smooth.
Add in 1 Tbsp.
of milk.
Mix until smooth.
Add in remaining milk, 1 Tbsp.
at a time, mixing until smooth.
If frosting is too thick, add in more milk.
If frosting is too thin, add in more powdered sugar.
Use immediately.

4a46bab1e9.gt:
Mix all ingredients together, I use my stand mixer with the dough hook.
Let mixer kneed the dough for about 5 minutes.
Dough should be moist and pliable but not sticky, if it is dry add more water, if it is too sticky add a little extra flour.
Coat a bowl with a little oil place dough in the bowl and cover with cling wrap and leave for about 1 hour or till doubled in size.
Once doubled in size dust bench lightly with flour turn out dough and lightly press down to remove a little of the air.
Form into your choice of loaf, I like to use a proofing basket, but you could use a tin or free form.
Let the loaf rise for another 40 min to 1 hour.
Pre heat your oven to super hot 450 F/ 250C.
I use a pizza stone but it can go straight in the oven on a tray if you don't have one.
Leave oven temp on high for 10 min then reduce to 375 F/ 190 C for a further 20 minute.
Enjoy!
4a46bab1e9.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the flours, honey, yeast, and salt.
Stir in the Greek yogurt and water.
Mix well and knead for about 10 minutes.
Cover with a towel and let rise for 1 hour.
Punch down and knead for 2 minutes.
Shape into a ball and let rise for 1 hour.
Divide into 12 equal pieces and shape into loaves.
Place in a greased loaf pan and let rise for 1 hour.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Cool on a wire rack.

3182df418c.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the dressing ingredients.
In a medium bowl, combine the watermelon, cucumbers, onions, cilantro, and dressing.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.

aacb2f290c.gt:
Preheat grill to medium high.
Drizzle oil and lemon juice over romaine and season with salt and pepper.
Place on grill and cook for 1-2 minutes per side.
Place cooked romaine on 2 plates and drizzle with dressing top with anchovies, cheese and or croutons.
Enjoy!
aacb2f290c.pred:
Grilled Caesar Salad:
In a large bowl, toss together romaine lettuce, olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Sprinkle with croutons and anchovies, if desired.
Pour prepared Caesar salad dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Top with freshly shaved Parmesan cheese, if desired.
Grill chicken breasts, if desired.
Serve immediately.

35f4aac182.gt:
Place rice into the bento, cover the whole surface with bonito flakes, and drizzle with a round of soy sauce.
Top it with shredded nori seaweed and roasted sesame.
The crackly texture and aroma of the baked seaweed is delicious.
Cover with lots of kettle-cooked shirasu.
Shred shiso leaves and scatter.
It smells great.
Top it with ginger to taste .
Grate a daikon radish, lightly squeezing out the excess water, mix with ponzu sauce in a small container to make grated ponzu sauce.
It tastes great to eat this with the grated ponzu sauce from Step 5.
In addition to the bento: Misakiko fried tuna katsu, Kanagawa komatsuna and daikon radish, aburaage stir-fry, Odawara fish paste with shiso leaves and pickled plums, imitation crab meat fried eggs, and tomatoes and shiso leaves.
Try eating the fried tuna katsu with lots of grated daikon and ponzu sauce from Step 5 ..
35f4aac182.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Serve with a bowl of rice and a side of ponzu.
Enjoy!

6f3b4ebeac.gt:
Cut the apple/pear and ginger into fine pieces.
Thinly slice the chili.
Mix chili, ginger, syrup, cinnamon, orange juice and zest in a saucepan and heat until it is boiling.
Add the apples/pears and bring to a boil again.
Add walnuts and raisins, and boil for about 5 minutes.
Pour into a glass with a tight fitting lid and cool completely.
(It will thicken up a bit when cooled down.)
Store in the fridge for a few weeks.
Serve with home baked baguettes, artisan bread and lots of wonderful cheeses.
Yum!
Enjoy!
6f3b4ebeac.pred:
In a large saucepan, combine apples, ginger, chili, maple syrup, cinnamon, orange zest and juice, walnuts and raisins.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

4816a33066.gt:
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering.
Add onion and salt and stir until coated with oil.
Reduce heat to medium, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is soft, about 10 minutes (if onion begins to burn after 5 minutes, reduce heat to low).
Add garlic and chili powder and cook, uncovered, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add beef and cook, breaking up meat with wooden spoon, until just pink, about 3 minutes.
Add 1/4 teaspoon pepper, brown sugar, tomato puree, ketchup, water, and hot sauce.
Simmer until Sloppy Joe sauce is slightly thicker than ketchup, 8 to 10 minutes.
Adjust seasonings.
Spoon meat mixture onto hamburger buns and serve.
Make Ahead: If you find yourself with leftover Sloppy Joes or just feel like making a double batch, the meat mixture freezes well for up to one month.
To return the meat mixture to its original consistency, you may need to add a little water when it is reheated.
4816a33066.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the salt, garlic, chili powder, and ground beef.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until the beef is browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the pepper, brown sugar, tomato puree, ketchup, water, hot pepper sauce, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the meat is very tender, about 1 hour.
Serve in buns.

27b86a0c47.gt:
Combine Parmesan cheese, lemon juice, anchovy paste, pepper, Worcestershire sauce, egg yolk, and minced garlic in a mini food processor; process 15 seconds.
With the processor on, gradually add olive oil, processing until combined.
Toss with romaine lettuce.
27b86a0c47.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a small bowl.
Makes 1 cup.

842d3c7eb8.gt:
Combine and mix all of the ingredients together in a bowl.
Mix the egg whites in a cutting motion.
Strain the mixture through a sieve and cook the tamagoyaki in a tamagoyaki pan.
Once cooled, cut into long strips.
842d3c7eb8.pred:
In a small bowl, beat the eggs and add the shiro-dashi.
In a medium non-stick frying pan, heat the water and sugar.
When the water starts to boil, add the eggs and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until the eggs are almost cooked.
Add the sake and salt and continue to cook until the eggs are fully cooked.
Turn off the heat and let the omelette cool.
When it's cool enough to handle, cut it into 4 equal pieces.
To assemble the sushi rolls, spread a thin layer of the omelette on a sheet of nori.
Roll the omelette up with the nori, and cut the roll into 4 pieces.
Serve with soy sauce and wasabi.

131faa12b8.gt:
Stir together 1 cup yogurt, 2 tablespoons oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, salt and spices.
Add chicken and turn until well coated.
Marinate at room temperature for 20 minutes.
While the chicken is marinating, preheat grill.
While grill is heating, stir together remaining 1 1/4 cups yogurt and 1 1/2 tablespoons lemon juice and salt to taste.
Reduce grill to moderate heat.
Grill chicken (discard marinade), on lightly oiled grill rack, turning occasionally (closing grill between turns), until cooked through, 10 to 12 minutes total.
Transfer chicken to a platter.
Toss together mint, shallot and remaining oil in a small bowl.
Drizzle chicken with yogurt sauce and top with mint salad.
131faa12b8.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the yogurt, oil, lemon juice, salt, chili powder, cumin, coriander, pepper, cinnamon and mint.
Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine the chicken, shallots and mint.
Pour the yogurt mixture over the chicken and shallots and toss to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Grill the chicken, turning once, until cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Serve with grilled vegetables and rice.

fd5fe058a6.gt:
Heat oil in skillet.
Add garlic and shallots saute until tender.
Add wine and oregano.
Simmer 4 minutes.
Add clams and heat just until they open.
Discard any that do not open.
fd5fe058a6.pred:
Place the clams in a bowl and cover with cold water.
Let stand for 20 minutes.
Drain and rinse with cold water.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the garlic and shallot and cook until softened, about 2 minutes.
Add the oregano and cook for 1 minute.
Add the white wine and bring to a boil.
Add the clams and cover.
Cook until the clams open, about 5 minutes.
Discard any clams that do not open.
Squeeze the lemon over the clams and serve.

0b797c29a0.gt:
Reserve 1 tablespoon of olive oil,now heat the remainder in a medium saucepan
Add the garlic and a pinch.of salt and over low heat.stirring until golden brown.then remove the pan from the heat.do not let the garlic burn as it will taint its flavor.if its burn you will have to start over.
Meanwhile, bring a large saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil.add the spaghetti and remaining olive oil and cook for 10 to 12 minutes, until tender.
Drain the spaghetti thoroughly and return to the pan.
Add the oil and garlic mixture to the spaghetti and toss to coat.season with pepper,add the chopped fresh parsley, and toss to coat.
Put on a plater and serve warm, serve immediately.
0b797c29a0.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the garlic and crushed red pepper and cook for 1 minute.
Add the spaghetti and cook for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the spaghetti is al dente.
Drain the spaghetti and add the parsley.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

56045e7740.gt:
Heat gas grill on medium or charcoal grill until coals are ash white.
Thread meat, pineapple, red bell pepper and onion alternately onto skewers.
Combine butter, hoisin sauce and orange zest in bowl; stir until well mixed.
Spread about 1/3 mixture onto 1 side of each skewer.
Place skewers onto grill, glaze-side up.
Grill 2-4 minutes or until browned.
Turn skewers; brush grilled side with about 1/3 glaze.
Continue grilling, turning often and brushing with glaze, 8-12 minutes or until meat reaches desired doneness.
56045e7740.pred:
Place beef in a large zip-top plastic bag.
Add the melted butter, hoisin sauce, and orange zest; seal the bag and shake to coat.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Remove beef from the bag and thread onto the skewers.
Grill over medium-high heat until cooked through, about 5 minutes per side.
Serve with the pineapple, red bell pepper, onion, and teriyaki sauce.

fda9c36818.gt:
Put all of the ingredients in a jar for the dressing and shake to mix throughly.
That's all.
It keeps up to 1 week.
Thinly cut daikon radish into match sticks.
Add sliced onions.
Wakame seaweed.
Pour the dressing over the salad.
Daikon radish & carrot with crispy boiled and chirimen jako salad.The combination is great.
I found this salad dressing container at a 100 yen shop.
Perfect for storing liquids!
Cheap and convenient!
Just put all the ingredients to shake it up.
fda9c36818.pred:
Place all ingredients in a small bowl and mix well.
Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.
Serve with a salad or as a dip.

1d309c893f.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken, soup, cheese, milk, salt, pepper and butter.
Mix together and pour mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 5 to 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly, and casserole is hot in the center.
1d309c893f.pred:
In a large saucepan, combine the chicken, soup, cheese, milk, salt, pepper and butter.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve over rice or noodles.

1e5cac3aa5.gt:
Arrange tomato slices on a serving platter.
Lay 1 avocado slice on top of each tomato, and top with fresh mozzarella.
Drizzle olive oil, then balsamic vinegar over the tops, and season with salt and pepper.
1e5cac3aa5.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the tomato slices, avocado slices, and cheese.
Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Season with coarse sea salt and freshly ground pepper.
Toss gently to combine.

3e392f1d33.gt:
Melt chocolate in oil (microwave), and add the rest in the order shown making sure that the eggs don't cook in the warmed oil/chocolate.
Before adding the flour, mix the salt and baking powder into the flour - then mix the flour mixture into the batter.
Pour the completed mixture into a greased and floured 9 inch x 13 inch cake pan.
Sprinkle some chopped nuts on top if desired.
Bake at 350F (180C) for 30 minutes.
Let cool at least 15 minutes.
3e392f1d33.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Grease 9x13 pan.
Mix together chocolate and oil.
Add sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder and salt.
Stir in nuts.
Pour into pan.
Bake for 25-30 minutes.

0e781ad046.gt:
Roast a whole butternut pumpkin.
When soft, scoop out the flesh and mash or process before adding a teaspoon of ground cumin, crunchy peanut butter and a splash of chilli sauce to taste.
Add a drizzle of olive oil, and stir well.
Serve in a bowl with crackers or pita bread.
0e781ad046.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Cut pumpkin into 1 inch cubes.
Place pumpkin cubes in a baking dish.
Sprinkle with cumin.
Drizzle with olive oil.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Place pumpkin in a food processor.
Add peanut butter and chili sauce.
Blend until smooth.
Serve with tortilla chips.

6970e8f99b.gt:
Preheat oven to 300F and grease an 8x8 baking pan.
Combine unsweetened chocolate and butter in a medium saucepan and melt over medium low heat, stirring constantly until pieces are almost melted.
Remove from the heat and stir until smooth.
In a large bowl using an electric mixer on medium speed, beat eggs until light yellow in color--about 5 minutes.
Add sugar and blend on low until thoroughly combined.
Add vanilla and melted chocolate to the egg sugar mixture.
Blend on low until smooth.
Add the flour and mix thoroughly.
Pour batter into greased pan.
Smooth surface with a spatula, and sprinkle uniformly with chocolate chips.
Bake on center rack of oven for 45-55 minutes.
The batter should be set and a toothpick inserted into the center should come out clean.
Do not overbake.
Cool to room temperature.
Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour.
Cut and serve chilled.
6970e8f99b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Line a 9x13-inch baking pan with foil.
Melt the chocolate and butter in a double boiler over low heat.
Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
Beat the eggs and sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
Add the vanilla and beat until well blended.
