Add the chocolate mixture and flour and beat until just combined.
Fold in the chocolate chips.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 25 to 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with a few moist crumbs attached.
Cool completely before cutting into bars.

65e738299c.gt:
Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a large, heavy pot.
Saute the onion for a couple of minutes until softened but not browned.
Add the rice and saute for a minute or two until it turns slightly translucent.
Add the wine and stir until absorbed.
Next, add the broth one ladle at a time, stirring very frequently.
When the rice begins to dry out, add another ladle.
After about 15 minutes, begin to check the grains.
When the rice begins to break down but is still slightly tough inside, add the vegetables, basil, salt and pepper.
Add the last few ladles of veggie broth and work in the vegetables.
If youve run out of broth, use water and add salt, if needed.
Within 5 to 10 minutes, the rice will become tender and creamy.
Once the mix is thick and starchy, take it off of the heat and stir in the cheese.
Garnish with a bit more basil and more cheese, if desired.
65e738299c.pred:
In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the rice and stir to coat with the oil.
Add the wine and cook until the liquid is absorbed.
Add the broth, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly.
Cook until the rice is tender and creamy.
Add the zucchini, mushrooms, peas, basil, salt, and pepper.
Cook until the vegetables are tender.
Add the Parmesan cheese and stir until melted.
Serve immediately.

496db791a3.gt:
In a bowl, stir together the strawberries, sugar, orange juice, and Grand Marnier.
Set aside for 30 minutes to macerate.
Position a rack in the upper third of the oven and preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, cocoa, and baking powder.
Whisk in the sugar and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together the egg, cream, butter, and vanilla.
Stir the cream mixture into the flour mixture.
Using a tablespoon, drop 6 to 8 shortcakes onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing the mounds evenly (the shortcakes will expand slightly as they bake).
Bake the shortcakes until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 15 to 18 minutes.
Transfer to a rack and let cool.
To whip the cream: In the bowl of a mixer fitted with the whip attachment, on medium-high speed, beat the cream, sugar, and vanilla to medium-stiff peaks.
Do not overbeat.
To serve, split the shortcakes horizontally.
Top the bottom half with a big spoonful of strawberries (including some of the juices) and a big dollop of whipped cream.
Top with the top layer of shortcake, and spoon some berries over the top.
Top with more whipped cream, drizzle with some of the juices, and serve.
496db791a3.pred:
].
Chop strawberries and place in a bowl.
Add sugar and orange juice and mix well.
Let stand for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Butter and flour 8 (3-inch) muffin cups.
Sift together flour, cocoa, baking powder, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat together the egg, sugar, and vanilla.
Add the whipping cream and butter and beat until smooth.
Add the flour mixture and beat until just combined.
Divide the batter among the muffin cups.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool for 5 minutes in the pan, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely.
In a small saucepan, combine the strawberries, sugar, and liqueur.
Cook over medium heat, stirring, until the berries are soft and the sauce is thickened.
Cool slightly.
Split the shortcakes in half horizontally.
Spread the strawberry sauce on the bottom halves.
Top with the whipped cream and the top halves.

56c2b059eb.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In four small cast iron skillets or one medium skillet, crumble half the cookie dough into small pieces, spreading in an even layer over bottom of skillet(s).
Drizzle hot fudge sauce over cookie dough.
Crumble remaining cookie dough on top of hot fudge, making sure to spread in an even layer.
Bake for 1820 minutes, or until top is golden brown and set.
Remove skillet(s) from oven and allow to cool slightly.
Serve with vanilla ice cream and extra hot fudge sauce, if desired.
Enjoy!
56c2b059eb.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place cookie dough in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Mix together the hot fudge sauce and vanilla ice cream.
Pour over the cookie dough.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the edges are golden brown.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream on the side.

e6bf3951b6.gt:
Cook meat and onion and green pepper until meat is browned and vegetables under tender.
Drain.
Stir in remaining ingredients and cover and simmer for 1 hour.
Remove Bay leaf when finished.
e6bf3951b6.pred:
Cut the onion into small pieces.
Cut the green pepper into small pieces.
Put the ground beef into a large skillet.
Add the onion and green pepper.
Cook over medium heat until the meat is browned, stirring occasionally.
Add the tomatoes, kidney beans, tomato sauce, salt, chili powder, and bay leaf.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Serve with cornbread.

e2b5a77d87.gt:
Heat oil in pan on low to medium heat, then throw in onion and sugar.
Cook for a couple of minutes, stirring from time to time.
Throw in mustard, stir to combine, and cook until onion is done to your liking, stirring as necessary.
Combine eggs, salt, pepper and cream cheese - don't worry if the cheese doesn't incorporate, it will once it's heated - and throw into pan, stirring everything together.
If mixture is too thick, add a little milk.
Add tomatoes, stirring and cooking until eggs are almost done, then add grated cheese and stir to melt and heat through.
Add extra salt & pepper if desired.
e2b5a77d87.pred:
In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream cheese, cheddar cheese, mustard, sugar, milk, and salt.
In a large nonstick skillet, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and cook until they begin to break down, about 5 minutes.
Add the egg mixture and cook, stirring constantly, until the eggs are set.
Serve immediately.

27e3ef474d.gt:
This recipes makes about 1 quart of frozen yogurt.
Place the blackberries in the bowl of a food processor.
Process until smooth.
Strain the blackberries through a fine mesh sieve set over a large mixing bowl.
Using the back of a spoon, press the mixture against the sieve to extract all the juice.
Discard the seeds and any pulp.
Add the yogurt to the blackberry juice and stir to combine.
Add about 3/4 cup of honey and taste for sweetness.
You may need more honey depending on how sweet the blackberries are.
I used just under 1 cup.
Add vanilla if desired and blend until smooth.
Process in an ice cream maker according to manufacturers instructions.
Serve immediately if you prefer a soft serve consistency or put it into a freezer safe container and freeze until firm.
If frozen remove from the freezer about 15 minutes before serving.
Recipe adapted from Southern Living Magazine.
27e3ef474d.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend on high speed until smooth.
Serve immediately.

ec1a27fd77.gt:
In a ceramic bowl over boiling water melt the chocolate, water and butter together over a pot of boiling water.
(Bain marie method)
Pour the melted chocolate over the sugar and mix well.
Then separate the egg yolks from the egg whites.
And one by one add the yolks to the mixture mixing after each one.
Beat the egg whites until they are firm.
Then fold the egg whites into the chocolate mixture.
Once its all nicely mixed spoon into invidual ramekins.
Leave in the fridge for two hours to set.
Once set decorate your mousse.
I sprinkled powdered suger over mine just before serving and added a few slices of banana.
ec1a27fd77.pred:
Place the chocolate in a heatproof bowl.
Place the bowl over a saucepan of simmering water.
Stir the chocolate until it has melted.
Remove the bowl from the heat and set aside to cool.
In a small bowl, beat the eggs and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the melted chocolate and water and beat until smooth.
Pour the mixture into a serving dish.
Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.

f31dd42e03.gt:
Turn crock pot on high while preparing ingredients.
In crock pot, mix together both packages of bearnaise sauce mix, wine, tarragon, turmeric and garlic powder until well blended.
Add shallots, ham, red pepper, potatoes artichokes and chicken.
Stir gently.
Cover, reduce heat setting to low and cook 6 hours.
f31dd42e03.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
Mix bearnaise sauce mix and wine in a small saucepan.
Add tarragon, turmeric, garlic powder and shallots.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium high heat.
Add ham and cook until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Add red pepper and potatoes and cook until potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes.
Add artichokes and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
Add chicken and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
Pour sauce over chicken and vegetables and stir to coat.
Place chicken mixture in a 13x9-inch baking dish.
Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes.
Serve with rice.

8fe5441410.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Bake the yams until they are not quite done.
Remove them from the oven and allow them to cool.
Cut off the ends, peel them and cut them into approximately 1 slices.
Heat a heavy 10 skillet or pot on medium-low and melt the Earth Balance.
Add the honey, maple syrup, and barley malt syrup and stir.
Add the sliced yams to the pan, wedging them all in there.
Lift the pan (wearing pot holders), tilting it so that the sauce covers the yams.
Cook for 10 minutes, lifting and tilting occasionally.
Carefully turn the yams over.
Cook for another 10 minutes, lifting and tilting your pan again so the sauce covers the yams.
8fe5441410.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Peel and cut the yams into 1/2 inch cubes.
Place the yams in a large bowl and toss with the Earth Balance Margarine.
Mix in the honey, maple syrup and barley malt syrup.
Spread the yams on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes.
Serve hot.

3d9830c9de.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Combine all the ingredients except for the artichoke bottoms and the beef broth.
Divide and mound the meat mixture on the artichoke bottoms, about 4 tablespoons each.
In a well greased baking pan, place the filled artichokes, filled side up, in one layer.
Pour the broth over the whole thing.
Bake, lightly covered with foil, for 1 1/2 hours.
Uncover and bake another 10-15 minutes, until browned.
Serve hot.
3d9830c9de.pred:
In a large skillet, brown the ground beef with the onion and garlic.
Add the mushrooms and celery and cook until the vegetables are tender.
Add the tomato puree, water, salt, pepper and thyme.
Simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and let cool.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Fill the artichoke bottoms with the meat mixture and place in a baking dish.
Pour the beef broth over the artichokes.
Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 45 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for 15 minutes more.

8b0f1ee273.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large saucepan combine broth, undrained tomatoes and orzo.
Bring to boiling.
Stir in Grilled & Ready Southwestern Chicken Strips.
Transfer mixture to a 2-quart baking dish.
Bake, covered, for 25 to 30 minutes or until pasta is tender.
Uncover and sprinkle with cheese during last 5 minutes of baking.
Let stand, covered, for 10 minutes before serving.
8b0f1ee273.pred:
Heat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a large skillet, cook chicken strips over medium heat until no longer pink.
Add broth, tomatoes and chile peppers.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 10 minutes.
Stir in orzo and cheese.
Transfer to a 1 1/2-quart casserole dish.
Bake, uncovered, 20 minutes or until heated through.

96679eee56.gt:
Blend four, 1 cup sugar, 3 tbsp melted butter, and milk until smooth.
Pour into greased 1 1/2 quart baking dish.
Pour fruit on top of batter.
Sprinkle remaining sugar on top.
Dot with remaining butter.
Bake on 375 for 45 min or until golden brown on top.
NOTE: If using fresh fruit, boil fruit with 1/4 cup water and 1 tbsp sugar until water is reduced to a syrup.
96679eee56.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a bowl, mix together the flour, sugar, and melted butter.
Stir in the milk and unmelted butter.
Pour into a 1 1/2 quart baking dish.
Place in the oven and bake for 40 minutes.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

46dc2bc350.gt:
Break noodles
Mix everything together.
Mix flavor packets with 1 cup oil, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 cup white vinegar,
Mix with other ingredients and refrigerate over night
Stir next morning allowing noodles to soften
Will ne ready to serve in afternoon or evening
46dc2bc350.pred: Mix all ingredients together and serve.

c99df4226f.gt:
Preheat oven to 425F.
Grease the muffin tins.
Mix, in a medium bowl, cornmeal, flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and white pepper.
Add cheese and nuts.
In another bowl, whisk the eggs.
Add milk and melted butter.
Mix the dry ingredients into the liquid mixture.
Stir until just combined.
Spoon the batter into prepared muffin tins.
Bake for ten minutes.
Let the muffins sit in the tins for a few minutes before removing.
Let cool on wire racks.
c99df4226f.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Grease a 12-cup muffin tin.
In a large bowl, combine the cornmeal, flour, sugar, salt, and pepper.
In a separate bowl, combine the cheese, nuts, and eggs.
Add the milk and butter to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Fill the muffin tin 3/4 full.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
Remove from the tin and serve.

1fda5d9400.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease one 9x5 inch loaf pan.
Cream butter and sugar together.
Beat in eggs one at a time.
Beat smooth.
Stir in milk, vanilla, and almond flavoring.
In large bowl combine flour, baking powder, and salt.
Stir in fruit, raisins, and nuts.
Add all at once to first bowl.
Stir only to moisten.
Turn into greased 9x5x3 inch loaf pan.
Bake for 1 hour in 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven until it tests done.
Let stand 10 minutes.
Remove from pan.
Cool and wrap.
1fda5d9400.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
In a large bowl, cream together the margarine and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the milk and vanilla extract.
Combine the flour, baking powder, and salt; stir into the creamed mixture.
Stir in the candied fruit, raisins, and almonds.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for 50 to 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely.

b0d84623b8.gt:
Toss the chicken cubes with taco seasoning.
In a heavy skillet with a tight fitting lid, heat the oil and add the chicken and cook, stirring, until it changes color.
Stir in rice and stir to mix.
Add salsa and water.
Bring to a boil and reduce heat to a simmer.
Cover and allow to cook about 20 minutes.
Remove from heat and allow to stand about 5 minutes before serving.
If you like, you may sprinkle with chopped cilantro.
b0d84623b8.pred:
Mix all ingredients except chicken and rice.
Pour mixture over chicken and marinate for 30 minutes.
Cook chicken in oil in a skillet over medium heat until done.
Add rice to a pot and cover with water.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer until rice is tender and water is absorbed.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add chicken and cook until heated through.
Add salsa and stir to combine.
Serve over rice.

a89dfedebf.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Lightly grease cookie sheets.
In a large bowl, cream together the margarine, oil, brown sugar and white sugar until smooth.
Beat in the egg substitute, vanilla and water.
Combine the flour, baking soda, cinnamon and nutmeg; stir into the sugar mixture.
Stir in the oats, oat bran, wheat germ, raisins and walnuts.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheets.
Bake for 18 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the edges are lightly browned.
Remove from cookie sheets to cool on wire racks.
a89dfedebf.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large bowl, cream together the margarine and oil.
Add the brown sugar, white sugar, egg substitute, vanilla extract and water; mix well.
Add the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and oat bran; mix well.
Stir in the oats, raisins and walnuts.
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.

e6f5055f34.gt:
Melt butter and cook minced onion in it.
Add rice; brown lightly.
Combine other ingredients with rice mixture and bring to boil.
Cover; reduce heat and steam until liquid is absorbed.
If rice is not done, add more water sparingly.
e6f5055f34.pred:
Mix the butter, salt, basil, and thyme in a saucepan.
Add the rice and consomme and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 20 minutes.
Add the mushrooms and liquid from the can and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in the green onions and serve.

295fa6c307.gt:
Combine oil and garlic in a small bowl and rub the mushroom caps on all sides with the mixture.
Place caps, top side down, in a circle on an oiled baking sheet.
Season with salt and pepper.
Arrange the cheese, basil, and tomato slices alternately in a circle on top of the mushrooms.
Sprinkle with oregano, if using.
Bake at 450 until the cheese melts, about 3 minutes.
295fa6c307.pred:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the mushrooms and cook until they are tender, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Remove from heat and set aside.
In a bowl, combine the mozzarella cheese and basil.
Spread the mushroom mixture on a pizza crust.
Top with the cheese mixture.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Sprinkle with oregano leaves, if desired.
Cut into 8 slices and serve.

43c305486e.gt:
Combine butter and onion in small microwave-safe dish and cook on high for three minutes or until onion is soft and then stir it to make it sure it is combined.
Beat eggs with sour cream in a small cup or bowl and then pour over onion.
Cook on high about 1 1/2 minutes, stirring several times.
Sprinkle bacon along rim of dish and cook on high for 30 seconds.
43c305486e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Microwave bacon on high for 2 minutes.
Microwave eggs in a bowl for 1 minute.
Mix sour cream, onion, and bacon in a bowl.
Place 1/2 of the bacon mixture in a 1-cup microwave-safe dish.
Cover with 1/2 of the eggs.
Repeat layers.
Microwave on high for 4 minutes.
Let stand 1 minute.
Cut into 4 pieces.

72392b90a9.gt:
Place steak in a 6" x 9" baking dish.
Combine marinade ingredients; pour over meat.
Cover with plastic; refrigerate 1/2 to 2 hours.
Combine salad ingredients in a bowl; chill until ready to serve.
Remove meat from marinade; pat dry.
Coat grill or broiler pan with cooking spray.
Heat grill on high.
Grill or broil steak 3 minutes on each side for medium-rare.
Transfer to a platter and let rest 10 minutes.
Remove onion from marinade.
Coat a nonstick skillet with cooking spray.
Cook onion over medium-high heat until tender, 5 minutes.
Move to a bowl.
Cut meat thinly.
For lettuce rolls: Layer rice, salad, soybean paste, onions and steak in the center of each lettuce leaf; roll up.
Serve 4 rolls per person.
72392b90a9.pred:
To make the steak in lettuce rolls, first marinate the steak in the soy sauce, apple juice, ginger, and garlic for 15 minutes.
Then, heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the steak and cook until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes.
Remove the steak from the skillet and keep warm.
Add the scallions, chiles, rice vinegar, soybean paste, and sesame oil to the skillet and cook until the scallions are softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the marinated steak and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes.
To serve, place the steak in the lettuce leaves and top with the scallion mixture.
Serve with brown rice.

38c1babf26.gt:
In a small bowl combine graham cracker crumbs melted butter and 2 tablespoons of sugar.
After mixing well, press into the bottom of a cheesecake pan; set aside.
In a large bowl, combine room temperature cream cheese, eggs, vanilla, whipping cream and 1 cup sugar.
Beat until smooth and creamy.
Pour batter into the cheesecake pan and cook for 35 to 40 minutes at 350F.
If you like your cheesecake with a sour cream topping, remove from the oven after cooking, then combine 1 pint of sour cream, 2 tablespoons of sugar and 1 teaspoon of vanilla.
Spoon on top of the cheesecake and cook for 10 additional minutes at 420 degrees.
If I am adding fruit to the top of the cheesecake, I do not add the sour cream topping.
For chocolate cheesecake, add a bag of melted chocolate chips to the mixture and use chocolate cookie crumbs for the crust.
The vanilla can be substituted with any flavoring extract.
It is a very flexible basic recipe that can be changed to incorporate any favorite flavor.
38c1babf26.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the Graham Cracker Crumbs, melted butter, and sugar.
Press into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and set aside.
In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add the vanilla and whipping cream.
Pour the mixture into the prepared crust.
Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.
Turn off the oven and leave the cheesecake in the oven for 1 hour.
Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack.
Refrigerate overnight.
Serve with fresh fruit and a dollop of whipped cream.

06e92239ab.gt:
Combine all of the ingredients in a mason jar, screw on the top and shake to thoroughly mix.
Let sit for at least 20 minutes.
Keep refrigerated.
Makes about 3/4 to 1 cup of dressing.
06e92239ab.pred:
Place all ingredients in a jar with a tight fitting lid.
Shake well and refrigerate.
Serve over salad or as a dip.

4ea5a98674.gt:
For the crust: combine the graham cracker crumbs, butter and sugar in a bowl and then press into an ungreased 13x9x2 dish.
Chill for 1/2 hour.
In a mixing bowl, cream butter, confectioners sugar, milk & vanilla.
Spread over crust, chill for 1/2 hour.
Layer strawberries, bananas, pineapple, and coconut (if desired).
Any fruit can be substituted and chocolate syrup can be added also.
Spread Cool Whip over the fruit.
Top with nuts or toasted coconut.
Keep refrigerated.
4ea5a98674.pred:
Strawberry Banana Split Cake:
In a medium bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, butter, and sugar.
Press the mixture into the bottom of a 9x13 pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and cool completely.
In a large bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the vanilla and milk and beat until well combined.
Add the flour and beat until smooth.
Spread the batter over the cooled crust.
Arrange the sliced strawberries, bananas, and pineapple on top of the batter.
Pour the canned pineapple juice over the fruit.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Cool completely.
Top with whipped topping and optional toppings.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

08647377e3.gt:
Soak the kiriboshi daikon in water and then squeeze it to remove the excess water.
If there is water in the canned soybeans, drain them well.
Julienne the carrots.
Cut the bacon into thin strips.
Heat the olive oil in a frying pan.
Add the ingredients and stir-fry.
Season with salt and black pepper.
All done.
My recipe for quiche, "Easy!
Kiriboshi Daikon Quiche with Homemade Crust" uses this as a filling!
08647377e3.pred:
Place the bag of kiriboshi daikon in a bowl and cover with cold water.
Let it soak for 10 minutes.
Drain and rinse under running water.
Slice the carrot into thin julienne strips.
Place the carrot, soy beans, and bacon in a large skillet.
Heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the black pepper and coarse salt.
Stir-fry until the daikon is tender, about 5 minutes.
Serve with rice.

57a8e4271c.gt:
Pour ingredients into empty gallon container or empty gallon milk jug.
Fill the rest of the container with water.
Put into spray bottle and refill as needed.
57a8e4271c.pred:
Place all ingredients in a bucket and mix well.
Use a sponge or rag to apply the mixture to the surface you want to clean.
Scrub the surface vigorously, then rinse with water.
Repeat as necessary.
The Best All Purpose Cleaner is a powerful and effective cleaner that can be used on various surfaces, including countertops, floors, and appliances.
The picture shows a bottle of rubbing alcohol, sudsy ammonia, and liquid dish soap.
The mixture is used to clean and disinfect the surface.
The sudsy ammonia helps to break down grease and grime, while the rubbing alcohol and soap remove dirt and bacteria.
The water is used to rinse away the cleaning solution.
The best all purpose cleaner is a great solution for those who want a powerful cleaning product that is effective on a wide range of surfaces.
It is also a great alternative to harsh chemical cleaners and is safe for use around children and pets.

579917be2c.gt:
Light the grill or heat the broiler.
Coat the chicken with 1 tablespoon of the oil and season with 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper.
Grill or broil until just done, 4 to 5 minutes per side.
Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes and then cut crosswise into 1/4-inch slices.
In a large pot of boiling, salted water, cook the fusilli until just done, about 13 minutes.
Drain, rinse with cold water, and drain thoroughly.
In a large bowl, toss the pasta with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil.
Add the chicken, artichoke hearts, scallions, parsley, the remaining 5 tablespoons oil, the vinegar, the remaining 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and the Parmesan to the pasta and toss well.
579917be2c.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and cook until browned on both sides and cooked through, about 5 minutes per side.
Transfer the chicken to a plate and let cool.
Meanwhile, in a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the pasta until al dente, about 8 minutes.
Drain the pasta and transfer to a large bowl.
Add the chicken, artichokes, scallions, parsley, vinegar, and cheese.
Toss to combine.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

b653472a7b.gt:
In soup pot dissolve curry paste with water , add cherry tomato ,bring to the boil on medium heat
Prepare banana blossom while soup is boiling ,cut half on runny water or in water bowl
Cut into 4 pieces ,now select only white leaves,take off small young banana inside
Cut to small pieces, this always soak in water to prevent from color change
Add to soup pot,increase to high heat ,stir to let all sink in hot boil soup ,let it simmer about 15 mins
Add fishsauce,add green leaves ,stir to mix,heat off ,serve hot with sticky rice by northern thai way or with steamed jasmine rice
b653472a7b.pred:
In a large pot, bring water to a boil.
Add the chicken tights, wings, and chopped local green vegetables.
Cook until the chicken is tender.
Add the banana blossom and red curry paste.
Cover and cook for 10 minutes.
Add the cherry tomatoes and chicken stock.
Cook for 5 minutes.
Add the fish sauce and serve.

fd91c2f3e6.gt:
Sift maizena and flour together
Add castor sugar
Rub butter into the dry ingredients and knead until a stiff dough its formed
Press dough into a 20 x 29cm greased baking tray
Mark the slices lightly and prick with a fork
Bake at 150C for 50 minutes
Once baked, drench the shortbread with castor sugar
Cut the shortbread into squares
Allow to cool and then enjoy
fd91c2f3e6.pred:
Cream of Tartar,1 egg,1/2 tsp.
salt,1/2 tsp.
baking powder,1/2 tsp.
vanilla extract,1/2 tsp.
1 cup of milk.
Preheat oven to 180C.
Line a baking tray with parchment paper.
Mix the flour, sugar, butter, and maizena in a bowl until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs.
Add the egg, salt, baking powder, and vanilla extract and mix until the dough comes together.
Roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface to 1/2 cm thickness.
Cut out shapes using cookie cutters.
Place the cookies on the prepared baking tray and bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack.

89a10ab4d0.gt:
Soak chiles in hot water 15 min.
or until softened.
Drain chiles, reserving 1/4 cup of the soaking water; place chiles and reserved water in blender container.
Cover.
Blend on medium speed until smooth; set aside.
Heat dressing in large skillet on medium-high heat.
Add pork; cook and stir 5 min.
or until evenly browned.
Remove pork from skillet; set aside.
Add alcaparrado condiment, cloves and chile puree to skillet; cook 2 min.
Return pork to skillet.
Stir in broth; bring to boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce heat to medium-low; cover.
Simmer 30 min.
Add potatoes and peanuts; cover.
Cook 45 min.
until potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally.
Top each serving with egg slices.
89a10ab4d0.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees.
In a medium saucepan, combine the dried guajillo chiles, hot water, and dressing.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and set aside.
In a large Dutch oven, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add the pork and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the alcaparrado condiment, cloves, and beef broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour.
Add the potatoes, peanuts, and eggs.
Cook until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Transfer to a 2-quart casserole dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
Serve with hard-cooked eggs, if desired.

54ea4ac023.gt:
Place the eggs into a saucepan in a single layer and fill with water to cover the eggs by 1 inch.
Cover the saucepan and bring the water to a boil over high heat.
Remove from the heat and let the eggs stand in the hot water for 15 minutes.
Drain.
Cool the eggs under cold running water.
Peel and chop the cooled eggs.
Cook the bacon in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat until evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
Drain on a paper towel-lined plate; crumble once cool.
Combine the eggs, bacon, mayonnaise, mozzarella cheese, paprika, sugar, white wine vinegar, and mustard in a bowl to make a chunky dip.
Garnish with paprika.
54ea4ac023.pred:
In a medium bowl, beat eggs and mayonnaise until smooth.
Stir in cheese, sugar, vinegar, mustard, and paprika.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and chill for at least 2 hours.
Serve with bacon slices and paprika.

59f0023fcf.gt:
Cut tops off peppers and remove insides
Mix ground beef, rice, and taco seasoning in mixing bowl
Fill peppers with mix.
You shouldn't have any left over.
Stuff them!
Place filled peppers in crock pot
Spoon a little rotel on top of each pepper.
Pour remainder into bottom of crockpot (gives a little extra juice)
Cook on low 6-8 hours and high 3-4 hours.
(The uncooked meat will cook the pepper.
No need to precook the beef or add any liquid)
20-30 minutes before meal time add cheese on top of each pepper.
Enjoy!
59f0023fcf.pred:
Mix all ingredients except peppers in crockpot.
Add peppers.
Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.
Serve with sour cream, salsa, and guacamole.

b500700d75.gt:
Pre-heat oven
In a bowl, grate the carrots and apple
Mix flour, baking soda, baking powerd , sugar , salt ,cinnamon and walnuts
Add the eggs, oil , milk ,vanilla extract
Add the carrots and apple
Spoon equal amount into the muffin tray
Bake for 20-30 min
b500700d75.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine eggs, milk, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, salt, sugar, cinnamon, and walnuts.
Stir in the carrots, apple, and flour.
Mix well.
Spoon batter into 12 muffin cups, filling each cup 2/3 full.
Bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack.

01483cc0de.gt:
Place the water and asparagus in a saucepan, and bring to a boil over medium heat.
Cook covered 5 minutes.
Remove cover and cook 1 or 2 minutes, until tender.
Drain and set aside, but keep warm.
Melt the margarine in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook the turkey cutlets 2 to 3 minutes on each side, or until browned and no longer pink on the inside.
Remove turkey from the pan and set aside.
Add the garlic and shrimp to the already heated skillet.
Cook over medium-high heat 1 or 2 minutes, stirring constantly until the shrimp is heated through.
Prepare hollandaise sauce according to package directions.
Place each turkey cutlet on a plate.
Top with the asparagus and shrimp.
Spoon hollandaise sauce over all.
01483cc0de.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place asparagus in a 13x9-inch baking dish.
Combine water and margarine in a small saucepan; bring to a boil.
Add asparagus; cover and cook 5 minutes.
Remove asparagus from saucepan; set aside.
Place turkey in a 13x9-inch baking dish.
Combine garlic and shrimp; sprinkle over turkey.
Combine margarine and hollandaise sauce mix in a small bowl; pour over turkey.
Bake, uncovered, 30 minutes or until turkey is done.
Serve with asparagus.

0121dfda05.gt:
Heat oil in large pot over medium-high heat.
Add shallots, ginger, and garlic and let cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Stir in peanut butter, turmeric, cumin, and curry paste and let cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Whisk in water, coconut milk, lime zest, brown sugar, and salt until combined.
Add tofu, sweet potato, and kale, and bring to a boil.
Let simmer, covered, for 30 minutes, or until sweet potatoes are fork tender.
Stir in lime juice and adjust seasoning to taste.
Garnish with cashews and serve over rice or quinoa.
0121dfda05.pred:
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add shallots and ginger and cook, stirring, until softened, about 2 minutes.
Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
Add peanut butter and curry paste and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Add water and coconut milk and bring to a boil.
Add lime zest, brown sugar, sea salt, tofu, sweet potato, and kale.
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes.
Stir in roasted cashews and lime juice.
Serve hot.

5b23053aa4.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Combine flours, Splenda, cocoa, and baking soda.
Add bananas, yogurt, egg whites, vanilla, and 1/2 cup walnuts.
Stir.
Coat a 9" x 13" cake pan with cooking spray.
Pour batter into pan, spreading evenly.
Bake about 35 minutes.
Cool.
Raise oven to 375F.
Toast remaining 1/4 cup walnuts 6 minutes.
To make frosting, pour 1/4 cup milk into a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Stir in Splenda, cocoa, and cornstarch.
Slowly add remaining 3/4 cup milk and bring to a low boil, stirring continuously until thick.
Remove from heat and stir in butter and vanilla.
Cool and spread over cake.
Sprinkle walnuts over cake.
5b23053aa4.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour 2 9-inch round cake pans.
In a large bowl, combine the flours, baking soda, cocoa powder, cornstarch, and 1/2 cup Splenda.
In a medium bowl, combine the yogurt, egg whites, vanilla, and 1/2 cup Splenda.
Stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until just combined.
Fold in the mashed bananas and chopped walnuts.
Pour the batter into the prepared pans and bake for 25 to 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool the cakes in the pans for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
To make the frosting, combine the butter and 1/2 cup Splenda in a medium bowl.
Beat at medium speed until creamy.
Add the lowfat milk and beat until smooth.
Add the remaining 1/4 cup Splenda and beat until the frosting is of spreading consistency.
Frost the cakes with the frosting.

8fdec3f08f.gt:
Bring a saucepan of water to the boil, begin to cook the spaghetti
Prepare the topping.
Finely slice garlic, cut red pepper into thin strips, cut olives in half, cut crab sticks into cubes, slice salmon into small slices.
Shallow fry garlic, red pepper and olives until softened.
Add the crab sticks, salmon and shrimps and cook until it's pretty much there.
Throw in a dash of white wine and a dash of lemon juice.
Season to taste with salt, pepper, basil.
Drain spaghetti and combine with topping.
Generously slash it with olive oil.
Boom.
8fdec3f08f.pred:
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add the shrimp and cook until pink and opaque, about 2 minutes.
Add the crab sticks and cook until opaque, about 3 minutes.
Add the olives, red pepper, and basil and cook until the red pepper is soft, about 3 minutes.
Add the smoked salmon and cook until hot, about 1 minute.
Add the spaghetti and cook until al dente, about 10 minutes.
Add the white wine and lemon juice and cook until the wine has evaporated, about 1 minute.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with a sprinkle of basil.

669da1896f.gt:
Peel the pears, cut them into quarters and remove the cores.
Cut each quarter in half and put them in a bowl.
Shave the cheese with a vegetable peeler and mix three-quarters of it with the pears.
Beat the oil and the lemon juice together and add salt and pepper to taste.
Spoon about half this dressing over the pears and leave for 1 hour.
Spoon the pears into a deep dish and shower with the remaining cheese.
Surround with the rocket and drizzle the rest of the dressing over it.
Serve immediately.
Serves 4.
669da1896f.pred:
Cut the pears in half and remove the core.
Cut the cheese into small cubes.
Combine the pears, cheese, olive oil, lemon juice, and rocket in a bowl.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

dde6859b7c.gt:
1.
Brown turkey in a nonstick skillet over medium high heat.
After about 7 minutes, drain the liquid off and return the meat to the pan.
Cook another 3 to 5 minutes or until browned.
Drain and set aside.
2.
Add bell pepper, mushrooms, and onion to the skillet and cook about 3 minutes.
The onions and/or mushrooms should be softened.
Add the garlic and cumin; cook another minute.
3.
Add the turkey back to the veggies, then stir in the BBQ sauce, ketchup, hot sauce, and Worcestershire sauce.
Cook, stirring often, until heated through (about 5 minutes).
4.
Spoon mixture into hollowed out rolls (makes it a bit less messy) and serve with your favorite baked chips!
dde6859b7c.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Place the turkey, green pepper, mushrooms, onion, garlic, cumin, BBQ sauce, ketchup, hot sauce and Worcestershire sauce in a large bowl.
Mix well.
Spoon the turkey mixture into the hollowed out rolls.
Place the rolls in the prepared baking dish.
Bake for 25 minutes or until the turkey is no longer pink.
Serve with additional BBQ sauce, if desired.

aff56897c3.gt:
Combine all ingredients and stir.
Serve with sprinkled Parmesan cheese on top.
aff56897c3.pred:
In a large pot, combine the rice and peas.
Add the bacon, butter, and salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cover.
Simmer for 15 minutes.
Serve hot.

646d990717.gt:
Cut the chicken breast into thin slices.
Soak dried shiitake mushrooms in lukewarm water until soft.
Cut off hard stems and cut in halves.
Cut onion into thin slices.
Chop cilantro.
In a large skillet with a lid, mix all the simmering sauce ingredients and bring to a boil.
Add chicken, mushrooms and onion and cook over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes, or until chicken is done and onion is tender.
Beat eggs in a small bowl, then pour over the chicken and cover with a lid.
Cook until the egg is set, about 1 minute on low heat.
Sprinkle cilantro on top.
To serve: put about 1 1/4 cup of rice in a large, deep bowl and gently lay 1/4 of the chicken and egg mixture on top.
Pour simmering sauce over and serve immediately.
646d990717.pred:
In a large pot, bring water to a boil.
Add chicken and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove chicken from pot and set aside.
Add onion and simmer until tender.
Add mushrooms and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add soy sauce, mirin, and sugar and simmer for 1 minute.
Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes.
Add rice and mix well.
Garnish with cilantro.

33b543f946.gt:
Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
Fry mustard seeds in oil until they begin to pop.
Add red pepper flakes and shallot and saute until shallot is soft.
Add garbanzos, turmeric, cumin, ginger, salt and enough water to prevent sticking.
Simmer for 15 minutes.
Sprinkle with cilantro and serve.
33b543f946.pred:
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
Add mustard seeds, crushed red pepper, shallots, and garbanzo beans.
Cook until shallots are soft, about 5 minutes.
Add turmeric, cumin, ginger, salt, and cilantro.
Cook for 2 minutes.
Serve with rice.

e827f8e8c3.gt:
In a medium bowl, combine the soy sauce, dark soy and cornstarch.
Whisk to blend well, and add the chicken to the sauce.
Toss to evenly coat the chicken and set aside for 15 to 20 minutes.
In a medium bowl, combine the ketchup, stock, chili garlic sauce and sugar.
Stir to combine and set aside until ready to use.
Place a wok over high heat and add the vegetable oil to the pan.
Swirl the wok to be sure to coat well with the oil.
Add the ginger, garlic, green onions, dried chilies and jalapenos to the wok.
Cook, stirring often until the garlic is fragrant and the chilies begin to brown, about 20 to 30 seconds.
Add the chicken, bell peppers and onions to the pan and stir-fry until the chicken is no longer pink, about 4 to 5 minutes.
Add the sauce to the pan and bring to a boil, being sure to toss well in order to coat all the chicken and vegetables evenly, about 1 to 2 minutes.
Sprinkle the sesame seeds, sesame oil and cilantro into the pan and toss to combine.
Remove from the heat and serve on a platter with steamed white rice.
e827f8e8c3.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, dark soy sauce, cornstarch, chili-garlic sauce, sugar, and ginger.
Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine the chicken, ketchup, chicken broth, and the soy sauce mixture.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, until no longer pink, about 10 minutes.
Add the bell pepper, jalapeno, onion, and garlic.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the sesame seeds and sesame oil.
Serve over rice.

903a5e2cd4.gt:
Pop Trader Joe's frozen brown rice in the microwave, or make a batch of rice the traditional way.
While rice is cooking, make the dressing by whisking together half of the chopped garlic, tahini, lemon zest, lemon juice, and 3 tbs.
olive oil.
Add the hot water to thin a bit, and then 2 teaspoons salt.
Set aside.
Add 3 tbs.
olive oil to a big skillet over medium-high heat, swirling to coat the pan.
Be sure the chickpeas are completely dry, or they'll spit at you during this next step!
Add the chickpeas and a sprinkling of salt.
Let the beans saute for a couple minutes, until they get a toasty little crust on them.
Add remaining garlic and onions.
Stir for a minute.
Stir in the asparagus with another pinch or two of salt, then cover with a lid for a minute to steam until the asparagus softens a touch.
Uncover and stir in the rice and almond slivers, reserving a few almonds for garnish.
Adjust seasonings, adding more salt if needed.
Serve family-style in a big bowl drizzled with a few tablespoons of the tahini dressing, letting each person add more dressing to their tastes.
Watch as this magical concoction disappears before your eyes!
903a5e2cd4.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a large bowl, combine the rice, garlic, tahini, lemon zest, lemon juice, 1 tablespoon of the olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Mix well.
Spread the rice mixture in a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes.
Stir in the chickpeas, asparagus, and almonds.
Bake for 15 minutes more, or until the rice is golden brown and the vegetables are tender.
Sprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Serve warm.

1690800ec2.gt:
Peel and quarter the potatoes, then wash them thoroughly.
Place the potatoes in a large pot with enough cold, salted water to cover them and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 min, or until cooked through, and drain.
Meanwhile put butter, lemon and garlic in a saucepan over very, very low.
Let it simmer for 20-30 minutes.
Discard lemon and garlic.
When potatoes are done, drain and mashed to your liking.
Fold in avocado and butter.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
If you like creamer mashed potatoes, you can add some milk.
1690800ec2.pred: Mix all ingredients together and serve.

606b8ac522.gt:
Cut mars bars in 1cm thick slices, and place in a pyrex bowl.
Set the bow over a pot off boiling water and allow the chocolate to melt.
The nugget and caramel will take longer to melt then the chocolate, so stir vigorously until all the lumps have melted.
Remove from the heat, add the wipped cream and stir well.
You can add a little milk if the consistency is too thick.
Serve over ice cream.
Add a tot of brandy if you want hot chocolate brandy.
(Great for a cold day)
606b8ac522.pred:
Cream,1 tsp.
vanilla extract,1 tsp.
cocoa powder,1/2 tsp.
sugar,1/2 tsp.
hot chocolate mix.
Melt Mars bars in microwave.
Add in cream, vanilla, cocoa powder, sugar and hot chocolate mix.
Mix well.
Pour into a glass and add ice-cream.
Enjoy!

3a699000d0.gt:
Cut bread into 1/2 - 3/4 inch cubes.
Rub serving dish with garlic and add bread cubes.
Mix cornstarch and brandy together.
Heat wine until it starts to boil.
The add grated cheeses, stirring constantly until the cheese has melted.
DO NOT BOIL.
Add the cornstarch mixture to the melted cheese, stirring until it is a cream consistency.
Add nutmeg and pepper.
Serve at once in fondue pot.
3a699000d0.pred:
Fill a pot with water and bring to a boil.
Add the cheese and wine and cook for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and add the kirschwasser and cornstarch.
Stir until the cheese is melted.
Add the garlic and seasonings.
Serve with French bread.

b7aac475a1.gt:
Place haddock and water in a dutch oven and heat to boiling.
Cover and reduce heat to low and simmer approximately 10-15 minutes or until the fish is white and flakes easily.
Remove the halibut, reserving (set aside) the 'broth' (liquid); cut the haddock into bite size pieces.
Return 1 CUP of the reserved broth to the dutch oven.
Add the potatoes, onion and green pepper and simmer 15 minutes or just until the potatoes are tender.
Add the remaining broth, the haddock, tomato, milk, salt and pepper.
Heat until hot, but do not boil; sprinkle with cheese before serving.
b7aac475a1.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
Place haddock in a 13x9x2-inch baking dish.
Combine water, potatoes, onion, bell pepper, tomatoes, milk, salt and pepper in a 2-quart saucepan.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce heat to medium-low; cover and simmer 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
Stir in cheese.
Spoon over fish; cover and simmer 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
Sprinkle with paprika.

2219f566cb.gt:
Heat oil in large skillet on medium heat.
Add onions and red peppers; cook and stir 3 min.
Stir in corn and zucchini; cook and stir 5 min.
or until all vegetables are crisp-tender.
Remove from heat.
Stir in parsley, black pepper and 2 Tbsp.
cheese.
Top with remaining cheese.
2219f566cb.pred:
Heat oil in large skillet on medium heat.
Add onion and pepper and saute until onion is translucent.
Add corn and zucchini and saute until vegetables are tender.
Add parsley and pepper and toss to combine.
Serve with cheese.

b4e4245834.gt:
Slice bananas and lay them out on cookie sheets, put into freezer for about 2 hours.
Take them from the freezer to your food processor or blender and blend them up, stopping every few min or so to scrap the sides down.
It does take a lil while but once it reaches the creaminess u like you can serve it as is and it will be more like a custard or put into a container and put into freezer til nice and thick like ice cream.
Update: If planning to keep this for a few days or so add a crushed vitamin C tablet and give it a good stir!
That's it!!!
Enjoy!!
!
b4e4245834.pred:
Ice cream.
I put the bananas in the freezer for about 2 hours.
I took them out and put them in the food processor.
I blended the bananas until they were smooth.
I put the banana mixture in a bowl and put it in the freezer for about 1 hour.

f40e32cead.gt:
In a blender or food processor, combine cumin, coriander, turmeric, red pepper flakes, mustard seed, and ginger.
Process to a fine powder.
Store in an airtight container.
f40e32cead.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a small bowl.
Mix well.
Add to your favorite curry.
Cook as usual.

9af737b60b.gt:
Blend all ingredients in blender on high speed until smooth.
Serve immediately.
9af737b60b.pred:
In a blender, combine the lemonade and pectin.
Add the blueberries and ice cubes.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a glass and top with COOL WHIP.

a106242e0e.gt:
Preheat oven 350 degrees F.
Salt the zucchini lightly and let it sit for 15 minutes.
Squeeze out all the excess moisture using your hands.
I usually put enough into my palm and and squeeze.
Repeat as necessary.
Combine all crust ingredients except the olive oil, and spread into an olive oiled 9 x 13 inch baking pan.
Bake 20-25 minutes until the surface is dry and firm.
Brush the top with olive oil and broil it, under moderate heat for 5 minutes.
Do not let it burn.
Spread the pizza or tomato sauce evenly over the crust and scatter olives, green peppers, onions, mushrooms, artichoke hearts, mozzarella cheese, Swiss cheese, and Parmesan cheese over the crust or use your own topping of choice and bake in a 350 F oven for about 20-25 minutes.
Remove from oven and scatter fresh basil leaves.
Return the pizza to oven and bake for additional 2-3 minutes.
Serve hot, cut into squares.
Eaten with fork and knife.
a106242e0e.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the zucchini, eggs, flour, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, basil, olive oil, pepper, pizza sauce, and olives.
Mix well.
Spread the mixture on a pizza pan or baking sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and top with the remaining ingredients.
Bake for 15 minutes more.
Serve hot.

79efd7e435.gt:
Grate 1 teaspoon zest from 1 orange and reserve.
Cut peel, including white pith, from oranges with a sharp knife.
Cut segments free from membranes into a bowl.
Squeeze 1 tablespoon juice from membranes into a large bowl and whisk together with reserved zest, vinegar, oil, mustard, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper until emulsified.
Add escarole, endive, and orange segments to vinaigrette and gently toss.
79efd7e435.pred:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut the oranges in half and squeeze out the juice.
In a small bowl, whisk together the orange juice, vinegar, oil, and mustard.
Season with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, toss the escarole with the dressing.
Arrange the endive leaves on a platter.
Drizzle the dressing over the endive and escarole and serve.

d7f427bc2d.gt:
Combine peanut butter, graham crackers, powdered sugar and butter.
Press into 9 x 13 inch pan.
Melt chocolate chips and spread over peanut butter mixture.
Allow to harden.
(Cut while still soft or layers will separate.)
d7f427bc2d.pred:
Mix peanut butter, graham crackers, confectioners' sugar and butter together.
Melt chocolate chips in a double boiler.
Add chocolate to peanut butter mixture and mix well.
Pour into a 9x13 pan and refrigerate until set.
Cut into squares.

a3eee86647.gt:
Mix everything together and pat into 2 loaves (apx 5"x8").
Freeze or bake at this point.
Mix the topping (brown sugar, ketchup and mustard) and spread on top right before baking.
Bake uncovered at 350 for 50 - 60 minutes (or Microwave for 15-20 minutes).
If from frozen - let thaw in refrigerator overnight, then add topping and bake.
(oops - it should be 6-8 servings per loaf - thanks I'mPat!
).
a3eee86647.pred:
Mix all ingredients except the topping.
Shape into a loaf.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.
Top with topping.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Serve with ketchup.

4877a08f4e.gt:
In a bowl, whisk together the yogurt, black peppercorns, garlic and 2 tablespoons of water.
Gradually whisk in the olive oil until emulsified.
Stir in the herbs and season with salt.
4877a08f4e.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the yogurt, peppercorns, garlic, olive oil, herbs and salt.
Mix well and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Serve over salad greens or use as a marinade for grilled chicken.

62dc1dc5a4.gt:
Bring 6 cups water to boil in large saucepan.
Add tea bags, broken cinnamon sticks, and fresh ginger.
Remove from heat.
Cover; steep 10 minutes.
Mix in juice concentrate and sugar.
Chill until cold.
Strain tea mixture into pitcher.
(Can be made 1 day ahead.
Cover and chill.
).
Fill 8 wineglasses with ice.
Pour tea mixture over.
Garnish with cinnamon sticks and ginger rounds.
62dc1dc5a4.pred:
toast, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place rounds of toast on a baking sheet.
Bake toasts in oven until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Cool toasts.
Place 1 tablespoon of frozen raspberry-cranberry juice concentrate on each toast.
Sprinkle with cinnamon and ginger.
Serve with a cinnamon stick.

928bc6c81b.gt:
Saute onions garlic and salt in the oil.
Add bell peppers and cumin and cook until peppers are softened.
Remove from heat and set aside.
Mash the beans by hand in a large bowl.
Add the rice parsley and lemon juice and mix.
Add the sauteed veggies.
Shape the mixture into small patties.
Fry in a pan coated with cooking spray until lightly browned on each side.
928bc6c81b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the olive oil, onions, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Add the bell pepper and cumin and mix well.
Add the cooked white beans, parsley, rice, and lemon juice and mix.
Shape the mixture into 12 patties.
Place the patties on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
Serve with a side of tahini sauce.

3e75168d43.gt:
Heat oven to 375.
Place bananas cut sides up in a buttered baking dish (8 or 9-in square) and sprinkle with marshmallows, chocolate chips, and brown sugar.
Mix cornflakes with butter and sprinkle over top.
Bake about 12 minutes or until bananas are tender.
3e75168d43.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place peeled and cut bananas in a greased 13x9 inch baking dish.
Mix marshmallows, chocolate chips, brown sugar and butter.
Sprinkle over bananas.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Serve warm.

aa4d853e28.gt:
Combine syrup, sugar, salt, butter and vanilla and mix well.
Add slightly beated eggs.
Pour into unbaked pe shell.
Sprinkle pecans over all.
Bake in preheated 350F (180C).
oven for approximately 45 minutes.
When cool, you may top with whipped cream or ice cream.
aa4d853e28.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium saucepan, combine corn syrup, brown sugar, and salt.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture comes to a boil.
Boil for 2 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in butter and vanilla.
In a large bowl, beat eggs slightly.
Stir in pecans and pour mixture into pie shell.
Bake for 45 minutes.
Cool on a wire rack.

7ea397998a.gt:
Place the potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water.
Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until tender, 8 to 10 minutes.
Drain and allow to steam dry for a minute or two.
Place potatoes in a large bowl.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat; grease with cooking spray.
Cook and stir the green beans and onion until tender, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the garlic; cook and stir until garlic is fragrant, about 1 minute more.
Transfer the green bean mixture into the large bowl with the potatoes.
Add the balsamic vinaigrette, roasted red peppers, and basil; toss lightly.
Stir in the goat cheese.
7ea397998a.pred:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
Combine potatoes, green beans, onion, and garlic in a large bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil spray and toss to coat.
Spread onto a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
Add dressing and toss to coat.
Sprinkle with roasted red peppers and basil.
Top with crumbled goat cheese and serve.

79aa81e6ca.gt:
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat; whisk in flour, and cook until flour turns from white to a nutty brown color, 2 to 3 minutes.
Stir in onion and cook until transparent, about 5 minutes.
Add meats and brown until no longer pink, 10 to 12 minutes; stir in Cajun seasoning and garlic powder; drain fat.
Cool to room temperature.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of 1/4 inch.
Use a 5 inch diameter round cookie cutter or cut around a saucer to make a round of dough.
Place a heaping tablespoon of meat filling in the center of each round.
Fold dough over filling and seal edges closed by pressing with a fork or fingers.
Repeat to make 15 pies, re-rolling dough scraps as needed.
Heat oil for frying in deep fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Deep fry pies in small batches until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes.
Drain on paper towels.
Or bake pies on greased cookie sheets in preheated 350 degree F (175 degrees C) oven 15 to 20 minutes, or until golden brown.
79aa81e6ca.pred:
Preheat the oil to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, cook the onion and sausage over medium heat until the meat is no longer pink.
Add the ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in the Cajun seasoning and garlic powder.
Remove from heat and allow to cool.
Roll out the pie dough on a lightly floured surface to a 12-inch circle.
Place the meat mixture in the center of the dough and fold the dough over to form a half-moon.
Press the edges together to seal.
Repeat with the remaining dough.
In a large deep fryer or deep saucepan, heat the oil to 350 degrees F.
Fry the pies until golden brown, about 3 minutes.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve warm.

bb2454b288.gt: Shake all of the ingredients over ice and strain into a shooter glass.
bb2454b288.pred:
Place all ingredients in a cocktail shaker.
Shake well.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

d0702f3d7d.gt:
Put cole slaw mix into bowl.
Mix together the oil, vinegar, sugar, salt & pepper.
Pour over cole slaw mix.
Toast almonds on cookie sheet at 350 degrees for 5 minutes.
Put almonds and craisins into slaw mix and toss.
d0702f3d7d.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the coleslaw mix, oil, vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper.
Stir to combine.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Just before serving, stir in the toasted almonds and cranberries.

b6c3e41018.gt:
After rinsing the chives and shaking off the excess water, put them into a vinyl bag.
Bend slightly to fit on your microwave plate.
Pop in the microwave and cook one side for 1 minute, flip the bag over, then cook the other side for 30 seconds.
While microwaving the chives, shred as many crab sticks as you desire.
Add water to the bag with the chives to cool it down, squeeze well to remove the excess water, then cut into 3 cm sections.
Toss the shredded crab sticks and the chives together, sprinkle on ponzu sauce, then it's ready to serve.
Serve with a dab of Japanese mustard or a sprinkling of sesame seeds.
b6c3e41018.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
Prepare the dipping sauce:Mix together ponzu, vinegar, and soy sauce.
Serve with chopsticks.
Pour the dipping sauce over the chives and crab sticks.
Enjoy!

120df8a501.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Put thawed potatoes in a large bowl.
Cube turkey-ham and add to potatoes.
Dice onion and add to bowl.
Add cheese to bowl.
Mix well.
In a small bowl put sour cream, soup, melted butter, salt and pepper.
Mix well.
Add to potato mixture.
Mix well, make sure everything is coated.
Put in a 9x13 pan and cover.
Cook for 30 minutes.
Uncover and cook for 15 minutes longer.
Take out and let rest 10 minutes to set.
120df8a501.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, cook the potatoes, onion, and turkey-ham over medium heat until the potatoes are tender.
Stir in the cheese and sour cream.
Spread into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
In a small bowl, mix the soup, butter, salt and pepper.
Pour the soup mixture over the potato mixture.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Serve hot.

f69122a346.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Melt the butter or margarine in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the garlic, bay leaves, onion and green bell pepper and saute for about 5 minutes.
Add the meat and saute until slightly browned on all sides.
Transfer mixture to a 2 quart casserole dish and pour the tomatoes over the mixture.
Cover and bake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for about 2 hours.
(Note: Also can be done in a slow cooker on low setting for 6 to 8 hours.)
f69122a346.pred:
Heat butter in large skillet.
Add garlic and bay leaves.
Cook until garlic is golden brown.
Add onions and peppers.
Cook until onions are soft.
Add steak and tomatoes.
Cook until steak is done.
Serve with rice.

4ff0a3ff39.gt:
In a large bowl, combine flour, granulated sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt.
Make a well in the center of flour mixture.
In medium bowl, combine egg, buttermilk, orange juice concentrate and melted butter; add all at once to flour mixture.
Stir just until moistened (batter should be lumpy).
Fold in walnuts.
Line twelve 2-1/2-inch muffin cups with paper bake cups.
Fill the cups 3/4 full with batter.
Bake in a 400 degree F. oven for 18 to 20 minutes or until muffins are golden.
Remove the muffins from the pans.
In a small bowl, combine powdered sugar, orange peel and enough orange juice (2 to 3 teaspoons) to make a drizzling consistency.
Drizzle over warm muffins.
4ff0a3ff39.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, beat egg.
Add buttermilk, orange juice concentrate, melted butter, and walnuts.
Stir in flour mixture until just combined.
Spoon batter into muffin cups.
Bake for 15 minutes or until tops are golden brown.
Cool in pan for 5 minutes.
Remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack.
Dust with powdered sugar.
Serve with orange slices.

243f0c78f6.gt:
In a small bowl, combine dressing ingredients, whisk and set aside.
In a really large salad bowl, combine cabbage, lettuce, cilantro and green onions and toss gently.
Sprinkle in the sesame seeds and peanuts.
Add the chicken.
Pour in the dressing and toss.
Enjoy!
243f0c78f6.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the hoisin sauce, peanut butter, brown sugar, asian chili paste, ginger, rice vinegar, sesame oil, chicken, sesame seeds, cabbage, romaine, cilantro, carrots, and peanuts.
Mix well.
Serve with scallions.

608984ae45.gt:
Melt butter in 1-quart saucepan until sizzling; add onion.
Cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, 2-3 minutes or until softened.
Stir in flour, thyme and pepper.
Reduce heat to medium; stir in chicken broth and half & half.
Cook, stirring occasionally, 2-4 minutes or until smooth and bubbly.
Serve gravy over chicken, biscuits and/or potatoes.
608984ae45.pred:
In a saucepan, melt butter and saute onion until tender.
Add flour and cook for 1 minute.
Add broth and Half & Half and stir until thickened.
Add thyme and pepper.
Serve over meat.

ccc0ef6d85.gt:
Melt butter in large skillet over medium-low heat.
Add leeks; saute until tender, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stir in parsley.
Cool.
Spread leek topping evenly over pizza shell; sprinkle tomatoes over.
Top with cheese.
Drizzle 1 tablespoon oil over.
Bake about 10 minutes at 450 F.
Remove from oven and brush crust with olive oil.
ccc0ef6d85.pred:
Preheat oven to 450F.
Mix butter, leeks, parsley and tomatoes in a bowl.
Spread mixture on pizza dough and top with cheese.
Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Serve with a salad.

b85277a635.gt:
In a large bowl, mix together the ginger, soy sauce, sake and mirin.
Add the sliced pork, cover, and marinate for about 1 hour.
Heat the oil in a skillet or wok over high heat.
Add the pork, and fry until brown.
The pork should have a dark crispy look to it.
Do not cook on low or medium heat, as the juices will not cook fast enough to get a crispy texture.
Discard leftover marinade.
b85277a635.pred:
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add pork and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add ginger and cook for 1 minute.
Add soy sauce, sake, and mirin.
Stir and cook until the pork is cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Serve with rice.

b8e018f7cd.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Spray lined baking sheet with cooking spray.
Remove eyes and scrape away bruises and dice potatoes.
Add olive oil, salt, pepper and any other seasonings you like and toss to coat.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, turn and bake for another 15-20 minutes.
b8e018f7cd.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Wash and dry potatoes.
Toss potatoes with olive oil, salt, pepper, and herbs.
Spread potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until potatoes are tender.
Serve with your favorite sauce.

d4627b79b5.gt:
Line a 4 1/2-by-8 1/2-inch loaf pan with 2 sheets of plastic wrap, leaving a 3-inch overhang on long sides.
In a blender, puree raspberries and sugar, scraping down sides as needed.
Strain through a fine-mesh sieve, pressing on solids; discard solids.
In a large bowl, whip cream until soft peaks form.
With a rubber spatula, fold in lemon curd.
Spoon 2 cups cream mixture into pan and smooth top.
Dip ladyfingers in raspberry puree and arrange in pan, parallel to long edges.
Pour remaining raspberry puree on ladyfingers.
Top with remaining cream mixture and smooth top.
Wrap pan with overhanging plastic and freeze 8 hours (or up to 2 weeks).
To serve, invert onto a serving platter, remove plastic, and slice.
Looking for more dessert ideas?
Check out our homemade chocolate chip cookie recipes, apple pie recipes, and chocolate cake recipes.
d4627b79b5.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium saucepan, combine raspberries, sugar and lemon juice.
Cook over medium heat until raspberries are soft and juices have thickened.
Remove from heat and cool.
In a medium bowl, beat the cream until soft peaks form.
Add the lemon curd and beat until stiff peaks form.
Fold the raspberry mixture into the cream mixture.
Line a 9-inch springform pan with ladyfingers, breaking them to fit.
Pour the raspberry mixture into the pan.
Bake for 30 minutes or until the semifreddo is set.
Cool to room temperature.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.

eec8247b03.gt:
Bring water to a boil in a saucepan; add rice and red pepper flakes.
Cover saucepan with a lid and remove from heat; let stand until water is absorbed, about 5 minutes.
Fluff rice with a fork and cool, about 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir rice until coated in oil, 15 to 20 seconds.
Add egg to wok; cook and stir until scrambled and cooked through, 1 to 2 minutes.
Stir green onions and garlic into rice mixture and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add cabbage, pineapple, cilantro, and bean sprouts to rice mixture; cook and stir until cabbage starts to wilt, about 5 minutes.
Stir soy sauce into rice mixture and cook for 30 seconds more.
eec8247b03.pred:
Place all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add egg and cook until set.
Add rice and green onions and stir fry until rice is heated through.
Add pineapple, cabbage, cilantro, and bean sprouts and stir fry until cabbage is crisp-tender.
Add soy sauce and stir fry until heated through.
Serve immediately.

2d86850b18.gt:
Mix all ingredients thoroughly and turn out onto a floured board, knead lightly and then roll out gently and cut into biscuits.
Brush lightly with melted butter or margarine.
Place of greased cookie sheet and bake at 450 degrees for about 15 minutes.
2d86850b18.pred:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
Combine starter, biscuit mix, baking powder and oil.
Roll out dough and cut into 12 biscuits.
Place biscuits on a baking sheet and bake for 12 minutes.
Serve warm.

fbb3258d67.gt:
In a very large skillet, heat 3 tablespoons of the olive oil.
Season the shrimp with salt and pepper, add to the skillet and cook over moderately high heat until lightly browned, 1 to 2 minutes per side.
Transfer to a plate.
In the same skillet, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
Add the garlic and chiles and cook over moderately low heat, stirring, until softened, about 1 minute.
Add the clam juice and bring to a boil, then simmer over moderate heat until the broth has reduced by one-fourth, about 3 minutes.
Whisk in the butter a few cubes at a time until incorporated.
Add the shrimp and cherry tomatoes, season with salt and pepper and simmer until the shrimp are just cooked through, about 2 minutes longer.
Stir in the lemon juice, cilantro and chives and serve.
fbb3258d67.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add the shrimp and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are just cooked through, about 2 minutes.
Remove the shrimp to a plate and keep warm.
Add the garlic and chile peppers to the skillet and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add the clam juice or stock and bring to a simmer.
Add the butter and stir until melted.
Add the shrimp and tomatoes to the skillet and cook, stirring, until the shrimp are heated through, about 1 minute.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Transfer the shrimp and sauce to a serving dish and garnish with the cilantro and chives.

ab4c597668.gt:
BEAT margarine at medium speed of electric mixer until light and fluffy; beat in jelly powder.
Mix in egg.
Stir in flour and baking powder.
SHAPE dough as illustrated; chill 2 hours.
CUT and bake at 350F for 8-10 min.
; cool.
GLAZE: Mix 2 cups icing sugar and 3 Tbsp water until smooth.
Blend in 3 to 4 drops food colouring to tint to desired colour.
Dip edges of cookies in frosting and dry on rack.
ab4c597668.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Pour into a greased 13x9-inch pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes.
Cool.
Cut into squares.
Serve.

e8a204dd36.gt:
Bring water to a boil in a saucepan; add oats and miso paste.
Cook for about 1 minute.
Add spinach, walnuts, and seaweed to oat mixture; cook, stirring occasionally, until oatmeal is desired consistency, about 5 minutes.
Pour oatmeal into a bowl and top with avocado.
e8a204dd36.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
Serve in a bowl and top with the walnuts and seaweed.
Enjoy!

13260b1790.gt:
In a large skillet over medium heat heat the oil.
Add the next 4 ingredients (onion - garlic), cover and cook for 5 minutes or until vegetables are softened.
Transfer vegetables to crockpot.
Add next 7 ingredients (vegetable broth - pepper).
Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.
Stir in Tabasco and liquid smoke.
Divide rice into soup bowls and top with gumbo.
13260b1790.pred:
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
Add onion, celery, green chili pepper, and garlic; cook and stir 5 minutes or until tender.
Stir in broth, tomatoes, tomato juice, zucchini, thyme, salt, and pepper; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer 30 minutes or until zucchini is tender.
Stir in rice and liquid smoke; cook 5 minutes or until heated through.
Ladle into bowls and serve.

d1a0efbcd6.gt:
Combine flour, salt and baking powder.
Beat eggs with milk and add melted shortening.
Combine the 2 mixtures lightly.
Drop from tablespoon into shallow shortening or oil heated to 365 degrees.
Fry until brown and cooked in center, 4 to 5 minutes.
Drain on absorbent paper.
Optionals: - 1 1/2 cups whole cooked corn for corn fritters - 1 cup apples for apple fritters - 1 cup cooked, chopped shrimp for shrimp fritters
d1a0efbcd6.pred:
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the flour, salt, baking powder, and eggs.
Mix well.
Add the milk and vegetable shortening.
Mix well.
Drop by spoonfuls into hot oil.
Fry until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve with ketchup.

c0a887dc12.gt:
1.
Combine all ingredients together and transfer to an airtight container.
2.
Can be stored up to 6 months refrigerated.
3.
Rub; let meat marinade for 24 hours refrigerated.
4.
Cook, add you favorite BBQ sauce near the end of cooking cycle if desired and enjoy.
c0a887dc12.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a small bowl.
Store in a tightly sealed jar.
Use 1/2 teaspoon of the rub for every 1/2 pound of meat.
Rub onto meat and let sit for 1 hour before cooking.

02f021290a.gt:
Cream butter & sugar, add eggs (1 at a time) beating after each one.
Dissolve baking soda in buttermilk.
Add to creamed mixture.
Add dates and orange slice to flour to coat.
Add coconut.
Combine the two mixtures.
Makes stiff dough that should be mixed with your hands.
Bake in a greased and floured 13x9x3 pan at 250* for 2 1/2 hours.
Combine orange juice and powered sugar and our over the hot cake.
Let it stand over night before serving.
02f021290a.pred: Mix all ingredients together and bake in a 9x13 pan at 350 degrees for 35 minutes.

2cf467b3f7.gt:
Season all sides of the beef with a fair amount of salt and pepper.
In a large Dutch oven, or other heavy pot that has a tight cover, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over moderately high heat.
Add the garlic and the beef to the pot, browning the meat on all sides, taking the time to get a nice crust on the outside.
Add the onion and allow to lightly brown, about 3 to 4 minutes.
Add the crushed tomatoes, plus 1 tomato can of water, spices, season with salt and pepper, to taste, and add enough water to cover the meat.
Bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer with a lid for 3 hours, or until the meat is fork tender.
Let meat cool some in the liquid.
Shred meat and place in store bought taco shells, make your own taco shells, or even roll up in warm flour tortillas.
Garnish with lettuce, cheese and chopped tomatoes--if desired.
2cf467b3f7.pred:
Add all ingredients into a slow cooker.
Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.
Remove meat from slow cooker and shred.
Return meat to slow cooker.
Add 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup beef broth.
Cover and cook on high for 1 hour.
Remove meat from slow cooker and let cool.
Stir in 1 cup sour cream and 1/2 cup chopped cilantro.
Serve with taco shells and toppings.

9141916c8a.gt:
Cream butter and flour together, add to hot juice.
Stir quickly or use egg beater to smooth.
Cook until it thickens.
Heat milk until slight scum forms, lower heat, add tomato mixture slowly, stirring constantly.
Salt to taste.
Serve hot with buttered popcorn or crackers.
9141916c8a.pred:
Place all ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in 1/2 cup of heavy cream and 1/2 teaspoon of salt.
Serve hot.

acbf7b5cb9.gt:
Combine flour, salt and pepper in a bag.
Add ribs and coat well.
In skillet, brown ribs in butter; place in slow cooker.
To same skillet add all remaining ingredients.
Cook and stir until mixture boils.
Pour over ribs.
Cover and cook on low for 9 hours.
acbf7b5cb9.pred:
In a large bowl, combine flour, salt, and pepper.
Rub ribs with butter, then coat with flour mixture.
Place ribs in slow cooker.
In a large skillet, saute onions, garlic, chili powder, and Worcestershire sauce until onions are tender.
Pour onion mixture over ribs in slow cooker.
Add broth, vinegar, brown sugar, chili sauce, catsup, and Worcestershire sauce.
Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.
Serve with baked beans and corn bread.

a004c9c6ff.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F Butter 8x8x2-inch glass baking dish.
Cook sausage in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat until brown, breaking into small pieces with back of spoon, about 5 minutes.
Mix in flour, then milk.
Cook until mixture thickens and comes to boil, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes.
Layer potatoes in prepared dish.
Top with 1/3 of green onions, 1 cup cheese, 1/3 of green onions, sausage mixture, sprinkle the herbs on top, and the remaining 1/4 cup cheese.
Bake casserole until potatoes are tender, about 45 minutes.
Sprinkle with remaining green onions and serve.
a004c9c6ff.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
In a large skillet, cook sausage over medium heat until browned.
Drain fat and add flour, stirring until smooth.
Cook until bubbly.
Add milk, stirring constantly until thickened.
Stir in hash browns, green onions, parsley, rosemary, and cheese.
Transfer to a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake for 45 minutes.

d8f274c0df.gt:
Chill the bowl of a stand mixer and the whisk attachment in the freezer for 10 minutes.
Place all of the ingredients in the bowl and whisk on high speed until medium peaks form, about 1 to 2 minutes.
(Alternatively, you can use a hand whisk and a large chilled bowl.
Whisk all of the ingredients until medium peaks form, about 5 to 6 minutes.)
Serve immediately.
d8f274c0df.pred:
Place creme fraiche in a medium bowl and whip with an electric mixer until soft peaks form.
Add sugar and whip until stiff peaks form.
Use immediately or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.

390edd893c.gt:
1.
In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat the butter and oil until the butter froths up a bit.
Add in the leeks, garlic, carrots and celery and cook for 5 minutes, or until just softened.
2.
Add in the sweet potato, potato and celeraic and stir and cook for a further 5 minutes.
Pour in the vegetable stock, red lentils, cumin, bay leaf and thyme and bring to a boil.
Once boiling, reduce to a simmer and cover the pot.
Taste and add salt and pepper as needed.
Let it simmer for 30 minutes, or until all the vegetables have softened.
At the moment the vegetables have softened, remove the pot from the heat immediaely.
3.
Ladle the soup into bowls and grate the fresh Parmesan over top.
Recipe slightly adapted from Cannelle et Vanillecannellevanille.com.
390edd893c.pred:
Heat oil and butter in a large pot over medium heat.
Add leek, garlic, carrots, celery, sweet potatoes, potato, celeraic, and stock.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add lentils, cumin, bay leaf, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Simmer for 15 minutes more.
Remove bay leaf.
Ladle soup into bowls and garnish with Parmesan cheese.

30db4ac55b.gt:
Warm milk in a saucepan on medium heat.
add all morsels to milk and mix until smooth, about 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and whisk in peanut butter until smooth.
Stir in Boiling water.
Serve immediately or keep in small crockpot.
Dip Apple Slices, Pretzel Rods, Marshmallows and even cooked bacon!
30db4ac55b.pred:
Add all ingredients to a fondue pot and heat until warm.
Serve with apple slices, pretzel rods, marshmallows, and thick cut bacon.

ad6361ec32.gt:
Grate apple
Chop onion and add it to apple
Add oil, soy sauce, honey, red pepper and sesame.
I add 3 drops of apple venegar to balance the taste.
Mix them all and add carrot and beef.
Put it into fridge and let it wait for 1 hour.
No bbq?
Use a flat pan with aluminum foil to cook bulgogi.
I like to serve it with an omelette and steamed rice.
ad6361ec32.pred:
Add all ingredients except the beef in a bowl and mix well.
Add the beef and mix well.
Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the marinated beef and cook for 3 minutes.
Turn the meat over and cook for another 3 minutes.
