Bake 30-35 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool 10 minutes before cutting into 12 squares.

66d695cd65.gt:
For the butter: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Slice the head of garlic in half crosswise and place it on a sheet of aluminum foil.
Drizzle with the olive oil and wrap the foil around the garlic tightly to seal.
Roast for about 1 hour, until the garlic is soft and caramelized.
Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly.
Squeeze the garlic cloves into the bowl of a food processor with the butter and salt and blend until smooth.
For the steaks: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Stir together the pepper and salt in a shallow dish and press both sides of each steak into the mixture to coat.
Add the steaks to the pan and cook for 4 to 5 minutes per side, or until cooked to your liking.
Transfer to a cutting board and let steaks rest for 10 minutes.
Slice the steaks into thin slices and spoon the garlic butter over the top.
66d695cd65.pred:
Place steaks in a shallow dish.
Mix garlic, oil, butter, salt and pepper in a small bowl.
Pour over steaks and turn to coat.
Cover and refrigerate 1 hour.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Grill steaks 5 to 6 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Serve with roasted garlic butter.

1dcfb48390.gt:
Prep: Smash the tofu until it turns into a paste.
Add the tempura batter crumbs and let them soften.
Finely shred the cabbage.
Mix the ingredients together.
Mix the ingredients and cabbage with the tofu and mix very very well.
That's the batter.
Pan fry: Heat oil in a frying pan, cook the pork and pour in the batter.
When the pork is cooked, turn the pancake over to brown the other sides.
When done, transfer to a serving plate, top with the okonomiyaki sauce, mayonnaise, ketchup etc.
to your liking and it's done.
Add some aonori seaweed powder and bonito flakes to taste, and enjoy.
1dcfb48390.pred:
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Add in the cabbage and tofu and stir fry for 2 minutes.
Add in the tempura batter crumbs and stir fry for 1 minute.
Add in the flour and katakuriko and stir fry for 1 minute.
Add in the water and dashi stock granules and stir fry for 1 minute.
Add in the mayonnaise, ketchup, okonomiyaki sauce and stir fry for 1 minute.
Top with bonito flakes and aonori.
Flip and cook for 1 minute.

60d7ee5f76.gt:
Cover beans with cold water, cover pot and bring to boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 3 hours, adding water as needed.
In a skillet, slowly brown ground beef.
When crumbly, add onion and saute until limp.
Add to beans along with rest of ingredients except the salt and pepper.
Cover and simmer for three hours or until beans are tender and liquid is somewhat thickened.
Add salt and pepper and serve.
60d7ee5f76.pred:
In a large pot, combine the beans, chili sauce, vinegar, chili powder, onions, red hot pepper sauce, and tomatoes.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 1 hour.
Serve with hot dogs or franks.

176a112293.gt:
Dissolve coffee in water; set aside.
In a mixing bowl, combine milk, pudding mix and cinnamon.
Beat on low speed for 2 minutes; stir in coffee.
Fold in whipped topping and spoon into serving dishes.
Garnish with whipped topping if desired.
176a112293.pred:
Grease a 1 1/2 quart casserole dish.
Combine coffee granules, boiling water, and milk in a medium saucepan.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat; stir in pudding mix and cinnamon.
Stir until pudding is completely dissolved.
Pour into prepared casserole dish.
Cool to room temperature.
Refrigerate until chilled.
Top with whipped topping just before serving.
Serve with a dollop of whipped topping and a sprinkle of cinnamon.

e29121a9a8.gt:
In a food processor, puree the avocados with the chickpeas, lemon juice and tahini.
Add the 1/2 cup of oil and puree until smooth; season with salt and pepper.
Transfer the dip to a bowl, drizzle with olive oil and serve with crudites, bread and chips.
e29121a9a8.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a food processor, combine the avocados, chickpeas, lemon juice, tahini, olive oil, salt and pepper.
Process until smooth.
Transfer to a serving bowl and drizzle with more olive oil.
Serve with crudites, bread and tortilla chips.

9c8b451253.gt:
Combine the potatoes, tomato, carrot, onion, and bay leaves in a slow cooker.
Place the chicken breasts atop the vegetables.
Stir the tomato sauce, chicken broth, and Italian seasoning in a bowl; pour over the chicken breasts.
Add water as needed to assure the chicken is completely covered.
Cook on Low for 6 hours.
Remove the chicken breasts and cut into bite sized chunks and return to slow cooker.
Continue cooking until the vegetables are tender, another 1 to 2 hours.
9c8b451253.pred:
In a large skillet, saute the onion and carrot in 1 tablespoon of olive oil until the onion is translucent.
Add the chicken and cook until browned.
Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
Add the potatoes, tomatoes, bay leaves, and Italian seasoning to the skillet.
Cook for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the chicken broth and water and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1 hour.
Add the tomato sauce and cook for 15 minutes longer.
Serve with crusty bread.

c1e7a519f3.gt:
Place graham squares, side by side, in single layer in ungreased 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Microwave caramels and water in microwavable bowl on HIGH 2 to 3 minutes or until caramels are completely melted, stirring after each minute.
Pour over grahams; spread to evenly cover graham squares.
Sprinkle immediately with marshmallows, chocolate and peanuts; press gently into caramel mixture with back of spoon to secure.
Cool completely.
Cut into 24 squares to serve.
c1e7a519f3.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
Line 13x9-inch pan with foil.
Spray foil with cooking spray.
Place graham crackers in single layer in pan.
Melt chocolate in large microwaveable bowl on HIGH 1 min.
Stir until chocolate is completely melted and smooth.
Add caramels and marshmallows; stir until chocolate is completely melted.
Stir in peanuts.
Spread chocolate mixture evenly over graham crackers.
Bake 15 min.
or until chocolate is set.
Cool completely.
Cut into 24 squares.

6ee25d7bfc.gt:
Prepare bread pans,.
I just use Pam cooking spray.
In large mixing bowl: Beat eggs until frothy, add sugar, oil, molasses, vanilla, and zucchini, mix well.
Combine flour slowly, add soda,baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
Also add nuts if desired.
Pour into bread pans, bake at 325F for 40 to 45 minutes or until you can stick a toothpick in and it comes out clean.
This recipe makes 3 large or 6 small bread pans.
This may vary.
6ee25d7bfc.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
In a large bowl, combine eggs, brown sugar, white sugar, corn oil, vanilla, molasses, flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
Stir in zucchini and walnuts (if using).
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Sprinkle raisins (if using) over top.
Bake for 50 to 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

78e1fe788f.gt:
Stir together all sauce ingredients in a small bowl.
Heat oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then stir-fry garlic and ginger until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add shrimp and stir-fry until almost cooked through, about 3 minutes.
Add half of romaine and stir-fry until it begins to wilt, then add remaining romaine and stir-fry until just wilted and shrimp are just cooked through, about 1 minute.
Stir sauce, then add to stir-fry and simmer, stirring, 2 minutes.
78e1fe788f.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the garlic and ginger and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add the shrimp and cook, stirring, until they turn pink, about 2 minutes.
Add the broth, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and cornstarch and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring, until the sauce thickens, about 2 minutes.
Add the romaine and cook, stirring, until wilted, about 1 minute.
Serve over rice.

1832d9054d.gt:
In a medium saucepan over medium heat, toast the barley in 1 tablespoon olive oil for 2 minutes until it is fragrant and nutty.
Add the chicken stock, bring to a boil, reduce heat to a simmer, cover and cook 45 minutes or until most of the liquid is absorbed.
In a large cast iron (or other oven safe) skillet over medium heat, saute the onion and corn kernels in the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil until onions are slightly softened.
Season with salt and pepper.
Shove the onion and corn to the side of the pan, and add the chorizo into the pan.
Cook the chorizo, breaking it apart as it cooks.
When it is almost browned and cooked through, mix it with the corn and onions then shove the entire mixture to the side.
Create as much open surface on the base of the skillet as possible.
Add the kale, pressing down and turning over until it is wilted.
Season with salt and pepper, then mix it in with the chorizo, corn and onion.
Remove from heat.
Preheat your broiler to high.
Add the cream and 1 cup of cheese into the corn mixture.
Add the cooked barley and mix well.
Spread the entire mixture into an even layer, and top with the panko and remaining cheese.
Place skillet 6 inches under the broiler for 3 minutes until the top is melted and brown.
1832d9054d.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the barley and stock and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer until barley is tender, about 45 minutes.
Stir in the corn, chorizo, and kale.
Season with salt and pepper.
In a small bowl, combine the heavy cream and 1/2 cup cheese; stir until smooth.
Add the cream mixture to the barley mixture and stir until combined.
Transfer the mixture to a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Sprinkle the remaining cheese over the top.
Combine the panko and remaining 1/2 tablespoon of olive oil; sprinkle over the top of the casserole.
Bake until the top is golden brown and the cheese is melted, about 30 minutes.

36b3caf34c.gt:
Preheat the oven to 325.
In a large enameled cast-iron casserole, heat the peanut oil.
Season the pork with salt and pepper.
Add the shanks to the casserole and cook over moderate heat, turning, until browned all over, about 20 minutes; transfer to a plate.
Add the onion to the casserole and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 4 minutes.
Stir in the water, miso, brown sugar, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, chiles and scallions.
Add the shanks and any juices and bring to a boil.
Cover and braise in the oven for 2 hours, until the pork is very tender.
Garnish with scallions and serve with rice.
36b3caf34c.pred:
Heat the oil in a large, heavy pot over medium-high heat.
Add the pork shanks and brown on all sides, about 5 minutes.
Transfer the pork to a plate and set aside.
Add the onion, garlic, ginger, chiles, and scallions to the pot and cook, stirring, until the onion is softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the water, miso, sugar, and soy sauce and bring to a boil.
Return the pork shanks to the pot, cover, and simmer until the pork is tender, about 2 hours.
Transfer the pork to a platter and let cool slightly.
Skim and discard the fat from the cooking liquid.
Return the liquid to the pot and bring to a boil.
Add the rice and cook, stirring, until the liquid is absorbed, about 10 minutes.
Serve the pork shank with rice.

94d70d2bcc.gt:
Wash, dry, and cut broccolini into thirds.
Heat oil over high in a wok or similar type pan.
Stir fry the stems first for about 3-4 minutes.
You may need to turn the heat down to medium high.
Add the top leaf portion, and cook for another 3-4 minutes.
Shut off heat and add oyster sauce, stirring to coat.
Serve.
94d70d2bcc.pred:
Place the broccolini in a bowl and cover with water.
Let it sit for 30 minutes.
Drain and pat dry.
Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the broccolini and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the oyster sauce and cook for 2 more minutes.
Serve immediately.

13ce606661.gt:
May ajust these seasonings to your own taste !
Grind porkfat and mix with lean pork.
Combine well.
Combine all seasonings and mix with pork.
Mix in well with hands and make a small patty and fry until done, Taste your product and ajust seasonings if needed.
Shape into patties and freeze on cookie sheets until hard.
Store in freezer containers until needed.
I use a slider mold to make patties.
Cook time is time in freezer.
13ce606661.pred:
Mix all ingredients except salt and pepper.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Mix well.
Shape into 1/4-inch thick patties.
Cook on a hot grill or in a skillet over medium heat until browned on both sides.
Serve with your favorite sauce.

a040895990.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Mix together all ingredients except olive oil and garlic.
Place olive oil in the bottom of a casserole dish or square glass baking dish.
Rub the dish with one bulb of chopped garlic and leave the garlic in the dish.
Pour mixture into baking dish and bake for 30-40 minutes at 325 degrees.
a040895990.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine the egg, milk, rice, parsley, onion, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper.
Mix well.
Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and sprinkle with garlic.
Bake for 10 minutes more.
Serve hot.

ea87319f86.gt:
Roast the eggplant directly over a gas flame, turning occasionally, until charred all over and soft, about 12 minutes.
Transfer to a colander and let cool slightly, then peel and let cool completely.
Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, cook the garlic in the oil over moderate heat until sizzling, about 2 minutes.
Remove from the heat and whisk in the vinegar, honey, rosemary, oregano and minced parsley.
Season the vinaigrette generously with salt and pepper.
Heat a large cast-iron skillet.
In batches if necessary, add the piquillos to the skillet in an even layer.
Cook over high heat, turning once, until lightly charred on both sides, about 2 minutes total.
Add the piquillos to the warm vinaigrette and let cool completely.
In a food processor, combine the eggplant with both cheeses and puree until smooth.
Scrape into a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Spread the whipped eggplant on toasts and, using a slotted spoon, spoon some of the marinated piquillos on top.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with anchovies.
ea87319f86.pred:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut the eggplant into 1/4-inch slices.
Place the eggplant slices in a colander and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Let the eggplant drain for 1 hour.
Pat the eggplant dry with paper towels.
In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, honey, rosemary, oregano, parsley, and salt and pepper.
Add the eggplant slices and toss to coat.
Spread the eggplant slices in a single layer on a baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool.
Meanwhile, prepare the piquillo peppers.
Place the piquillo peppers in a bowl and cover with boiling water.
Let sit for 10 minutes.
Drain and pat dry.
Place the piquillo peppers on a baking sheet and roast for 10 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool.
To assemble the toasts, spread the whipped eggplant on the toasts and top with the piquillo peppers.
Serve with the cream cheese and goat cheese.
Garnish with chopped parsley.

57e41370a3.gt:
Combine flour, baking powder, nutmeg, and salt in one bowl.
In another bow, beat egg yolks slightly.
Beat in milk, bananas, and oil.
Add egg mixture to flour mixture all at once.
Stir just till combined but still slightly lumpy.
In small bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold beaten egg whites into flour mixture, leaving a few puffs of egg white.
Do not overmix!
Pour batter onto pre-heated, lightly greased waffle maker.
Bake waffles according to manufacturer's directions.
Serve hot and fresh.
I topped mine with butter and syrup, and they were delicious!
57e41370a3.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix flour, baking powder, salt and egg yolks.
Add milk, bananas and oil.
Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into batter.
Pour batter into hot waffle iron and bake until golden brown.
Serve with butter and syrup.

86b69c2d99.gt:
Combine the vinegar, horseradish cream, and measured salt and pepper in a medium, nonreactive bowl and whisk until thoroughly mixed.
Whisking constantly, slowly pour the oil in a thin stream down the side of the bowl.
Whisk until completely incorporated.
Taste and adjust the seasoning as desired.
86b69c2d99.pred:
Place all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.
Refrigerate until ready to use.
Serve over salad greens.

522f19c745.gt:
Place flat bread or shell on 14 inch pizza pan (or lightly grease a 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Unroll the pizza dough onto the greased pan, using your hands to press the dough into a 14x 9 inch rectangle, build up the edges slightly.
Bake pizza dough in a 425F oven for 5 minutes.
remove from oven).
In a mixing bowl combine chicken and barbecue sauce, toss to coat.
Spread chicken mixture evenly over pizza crust.
Sprinkle with cheese and chopped spinach.
Bake in a 425F oven for 10 minutes or until crust edge is lightly browned.
Cut flat bread or bread shell into wedges (or cut rectangular pizza into squares.
522f19c745.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the chicken, barbecue sauce, and cheese.
Spread the mixture evenly over the bread or pizza crust.
Top with the spinach.
Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

8c32c6a022.gt:
Make the dough.
Put all the dough ingredients except for the olive oil into a plastic bag, and knead it well to make the dough.
When the dough comes together, add the olive oil and keep kneading (10 minutes).
Leave it to rise in the bag (30 minutes).
When the dough has risen, press it down lightly to deflate.
Place it on a kitchen parchment paper lined oven tray and leave to rest for 10 minutes.
Cut up the toppings for the pizza crust.
Slice the sausages diagonally.
Slice the onion and cherry tomatoes.
Defrost the seafood mix.
Put olive oil on your hands, and spread the dough out to cover the oven tray.
Preheat the oven to 300C (or 250C if your oven doesn't get that hot).
Spread the dough with pizza sauce, and cover evenly with toppings of your choice.
Add the pizza cheese to finish.
Bake at 300C for 13 minutes.
Top with something like fresh basil leaves and cut into 8 portions.
It's very hot so be careful.
I tried varying the toppings by section.
You won't get bored with the toppings this way, and looks like fun too.
8c32c6a022.pred:
Cut the sausages into 4 pieces.
Slice the onion.
Add the sausage and onion to the flour.
Mix well.
Add the yeast, sugar, salt and water.
Mix well.
Add the olive oil.
Mix well.
Add the seafood.
Mix well.
Add the tomatoes.
Mix well.
Add the cheese.
Mix well.
Add the pizza sauce.
Mix well.
Put the dough on a floured surface and knead.
Roll out the dough to a 1/4 inch thickness.
Cut the dough into 4 pieces.
Place the pieces on a greased baking sheet.
Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes.
Serve with a salad.

ac2ebd1a37.gt:
Preheat oven to 450F.
Prebake fresh pizza crust, if using, for 3 to 4 minutes.
Remove from oven, and set aside to cool slightly.
Brush oil on crust.
Top crust with sauce and artichokes.
Sprinkle with soy mozzarella, goat cheese and sun-dried tomatoes.
Bake for 12 to 15 minutes.
Remove from oven, and serve.
ac2ebd1a37.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the pizza crust, olive oil, pizza sauce, and salt and pepper to taste.
Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the crust.
Top with the artichokes, goat cheese, and sun-dried tomatoes.
Bake at 400 degrees F for 15 to 20 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted.

03321392c1.gt:
Spread cut sides of roll with dressing and mustard.
Fill with remaining ingredients.
03321392c1.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees.
Cut roll in half.
Spread dressing on cut side of roll.
Layer turkey, tomato, pepper strips and carrots on top of dressing.
Cover with remaining half of roll.
Bake 10-15 minutes or until heated through.

95fc2c99a6.gt:
Combine dry ingredients in large bowl.
Whisk remaining ingredients together; stir into dry mixture just until moistened.
Pour batter by 1/4 cupfuls onto a hot nonstick griddle coated with nonstick cooking spray.
Turn when bubbles form on top of pancakes; cook until second side is golden brown.
95fc2c99a6.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine buckwheat flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg, buttermilk, and butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Pour the batter onto a hot, lightly greased griddle or skillet.
Cook until the pancakes are golden brown on both sides and the edges are crispy.
Serve with butter, syrup, and fruit.

b067e71075.gt:
Heat the oven to 450 degrees F and arrange a rack in the middle.
Place a baking sheet upside down in the oven while its heating.
Remove chorizo from its casing and place in a medium frying pan over medium-high heat.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 7 minutes.
Remove to a plate and set aside.
Add 2 tablespoons of the olive oil to the pan.
Add mushrooms and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Cook, stirring rarely, until beginning to brown, about 10 minutes.
Roll out pizza dough to a 10-inch round, remove the hot baking sheet from the oven, drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil, and carefully place dough on the upside-down baking sheet.
Scatter chorizo, mushrooms, Jack cheese, and Parmesan cheese on top.
Drizzle with olive oil and bake until cheese is melted and crust is crisp and browned, about 15 minutes.
b067e71075.pred:
Heat oven to 450 degrees F.
Spread olive oil on a large baking sheet.
Add chorizo to a large skillet and cook over medium heat until browned and crumbly, about 5 minutes.
Remove chorizo from skillet and set aside.
Add mushrooms to skillet and cook over medium heat until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add chorizo to skillet and cook until heated through, about 1 minute.
Remove from heat and set aside.
Roll out pizza dough on a lightly floured surface to a 12-inch round.
Transfer dough to a pizza stone or baking sheet.
Spread pizza sauce over dough.
Top with chorizo and mushroom mixture, then sprinkle with cheeses.
Bake in preheated oven until crust is golden and cheese is melted and bubbly, about 12 minutes.
Let cool for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

3427daffb8.gt:
Mix the oils and teriyaki sauce in a skillet, and warm over medium heat.
Baste eggs in skillet, turning constantly, until eggs turn dark brown (5 minutes).
Remove eggs from pan.
Mix garlic salt and pepper into oils in skillet.
Stirfry broccoli until tender crisp (3 minutes), then melt cheese on top.
Serve eggs with broccoli.
3427daffb8.pred:
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the eggs and cook until set.
Remove from heat and set aside.
Heat oil in the same skillet over medium heat.
Add broccoli and cook until tender.
Add teriyaki sauce and garlic salt and pepper.
Stir and cook until broccoli is coated with sauce.
Add eggs to the skillet and stir to combine.
Serve immediately.

08e438e0f5.gt:
If you happen to use larger potatoes for the double batch, halve the large potatoes because the small ones for the regualr batch can be left whole.
Place all the potatoes in a deep pot and cover with water.
Place a lid on the potatoes and bring it to a boil.
Once it starts to boil, uncover and cook until tender (about twelve to fifteen minutes).
Then drain potatoes and put them back into the hot pot.
Add the butter, the seasoning package, milk and cheese.
It really depends on how creamy and cheesy you like your potatoes when deciding how much you want to add of the milk and cheese.
Smash the potatoes until they are the desired texture.
Add the amount of salt and pepper to taste you like and enjoy.
08e438e0f5.pred:
In a large pot, boil the small red potatoes until tender.
Drain and mash with a potato masher.
Add the butter, Italian salad dressing mix, milk, and mozzarella cheese.
Mix well.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve warm.

934deaadde.gt:
Boil chicken, salt& poultry in approximately 2 quarts of water.
Remove chicken and set aside.
Add 3 cups milk (more for a richer flavor), bouillon cubes, and butter to broth.
Bring to almost a boil.
Add water to the flour to make a thin solution and pour in broth.
Stir well, reduce heat, and let simmer to thicken.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Pinch each biscuit to small pieces and put in broth.
Stir often so dumplings won't stick together.
When dumplings begin to sink, they are almost ready.
Pick chicken to small pieces and add to broth.
When dumplings are not gummy to taste, it is ready to eat.
934deaadde.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large pot, combine the chicken, salt, poultry seasoning, and chicken bouillon cubes.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour.
Remove chicken from pot and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine the butter, milk, flour, and 1/2 cup of the chicken broth.
Stir until smooth.
Add the chicken back to the pot and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour.
Meanwhile, make the dumplings.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt, and milk.
Stir until smooth.
Drop dumpling batter by tablespoonfuls onto the simmering chicken mixture.
Cover and cook for 10 minutes.
Serve over rice.

1f141c8991.gt:
Heat oven to 375 degrees F. In bowl, mix together tomatoes, onion and cilantro.
Squeeze lime into the tomato mixture and toss until blended.
Arrange a single layer of chips on heatproof platter or baking sheet.
Top with spoonfuls of chili, tomato mixture, olives and cheese.
Add jalapeno slices, if desired.
Repeat layers until all the ingredients are used.
Bake 15 minutes or until cheese is completely melted.
Serve nachos hot.
1f141c8991.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the tomatoes, onion, cilantro, lime juice, and jalapeno chile.
Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from oven and top with cheese.
Bake for 5 minutes, or until cheese is melted.
Serve immediately.

c799c55881.gt:
Combine the sun-dried tomatoes, parsley, butter, and Tabasco in a medium bowl and mix into a uniform paste.
Taste and season with salt and pepper as needed.
Place 8 slices of the toasted bread on a work surface.
Spread an even amount of the tomato butter on each slice, using it all up.
Set the remaining 4 unbuttered bread slices aside.
Place 2 pieces of bacon each on the buttered sides of 4 of the bread slices.
Top the bacon with 1/4 cup of the arugula per sandwich.
Top the arugula with a slice of the unbuttered bread.
Place a quarter of the sardines on top of each unbuttered piece of bread and season with pepper.
Top the sardines with another 1/4 cup of the arugula per sandwich, and finish with a slice of buttered bread, buttered-side down.
Slice each sandwich in half and serve.
c799c55881.pred:
Heat a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the butter and allow it to melt.
Add the sun-dried tomatoes and parsley and cook until the tomatoes are softened, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Remove from the heat and set aside.
Toast the bread slices.
Cut the bacon into 1/2-inch pieces.
Arrange the toasted bread slices on a work surface.
Top each slice with 2 slices of bacon and 1/2 cup of the sun-dried tomato mixture.
Top with the remaining bread slices.
Cut each sandwich into 4 triangles.
Arrange the triangles on a platter.
Sprinkle with the arugula and serve.

79b26bed8a.gt:
Spray 8 x 8-inch casserole dish with vegetable cooking spray or grease with olive oil.
In a skillet, saute onion and garlic until soft in a little olive oil.
Toss with the cooked pasta.
Add and toss with the herbs, salt, pepper, a little (about 2 tsp.)
of the Parmesan cheese, all the ricotta, and beaten egg.
Toss well together.
Spread and press down half of the mixture in the prepared casserole dish.
Layer with half the tomato slices and zucchini.
Sprinkle with half of the Parmesan and mozzarella.
Repeat the process again.
Cover dish with foil and bake in a preheated 350F (180C) oven for 35 minutes.
Uncover and bake another 5 to 10 minutes, until cheese in oozy and light golden brown.
Let cool for 5 to 10 minutes before cutting into squares like lasagna.
79b26bed8a.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a large bowl, combine the pasta, onion, garlic, eggs, ricotta, basil, parsley, salt and pepper.
Spread the mixture into a greased 13x9-inch baking dish.
Bake for 40 minutes, or until the pasta is tender and the cheese is melted.
Sprinkle with parmesan and parmigiano-reggiano cheese.
Bake for 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.

d859113e86.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Grease and flour a loaf pan and set aside.
Combine the eggs, oil, pumpkin and water in a large bowl.
Sift the dry ingredients together and stir into the pumpkin mixture.
Stir in walnuts.
Pour into the prepared loaf pan and bake for one hour or until a tester inserted near the center comes out clean.
d859113e86.pred:
In a large bowl, combine eggs, oil, pumpkin, water, sugar, flour, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, and baking soda.
Mix well.
Pour into a greased 9x5 loaf pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes.
Remove from pan and cool on a wire rack.
Slice and serve.

91e966c057.gt:
Wash, scrape and slice carrots into 1/4 inch thick rounds.
Bring water to a boil in a heavy saucepan.
Add carrots and garlic, cover, and cook about 15 minutes, or until tender (but still firm).
Drain carrots and place in serving bowl.
Mix remaining ingredients and pour over the carrots.
Toss, then cover with plastic wrap and set aside for about 30 minutes before serving at room temperature.
91e966c057.pred:
Mix all ingredients except the carrots in a small bowl.
Add the carrots and toss well.
Serve immediately.

a22e0c83cf.gt:
1.
Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat.
Drain.
Place pasta in a large bowl; keep warm.2.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onion; saute 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add garlic and tomatoes; saute 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Sprinkle shrimp with Cajun seasoning, red pepper, and salt.
Add shrimp mixture to pan; saute 3 minutes or until shrimp are almost done; remove from heat.
Stir in half-and-half.
Pour shrimp mixture over pasta; toss.
Sprinkle with parsley.Wine note: Linguine with Spicy Shrimp combines peppery heat with a creamy sauce, making a fuller-bodied white a good partner.
Little Penguin Chardonnay 2008 ($6), from Australia, has tropical and pear fruit, with just a bit of sweetness and refreshing acidity.
--Jeffery Lindenmuth
a22e0c83cf.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the butter and oil over medium-high heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring, until the onion is softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes, shrimp, Cajun seasoning, red pepper, and salt.
Cook, stirring, until the shrimp are pink and just cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Add the half-and-half and simmer until the sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.
Serve over the linguine.
Garnish with the parsley.

5131480fd6.gt:
Combine all ingredients.
Marinate fish from 1-2 hours depending on thickness.
Use to baste while cooking.
5131480fd6.pred:
In a small bowl, combine all ingredients.
Marinade fish in the refrigerator for 15 minutes.
Remove fish from marinade and pat dry.
Grill or broil fish until cooked through.

74d3b41960.gt:
Use both hands to massage the Honey Vinegar Miso Chicken Breasts to soften the muscle fibers.
Break it up into large pieces.
Salt the cucumber and roll on a cutting board.
Lightly wash, then use a spatula to smash while breaking it apart with your hands.
Add Step 1 (together with the miso) and Step 2 to a bowl, and mix together with Japanese mustard if you like.
74d3b41960.pred:
Place the chicken breasts in a shallow dish and pour the honey vinegar miso over them.
Cut the cucumber into 1/2 inch slices.
Sprinkle the salt over the chicken and let it sit for 15 minutes.
Drain the cucumber slices and place them on a plate.
Serve with the chicken.

2f09be220e.gt:
Preheat oven to 350.
Combine all ingredients in a mixing bowl.
Spoon out into a glass pie plate or casserole dish.
Bake for 25 minutes.
Serve with nachos or corn chips.
2f09be220e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Place the green pepper, onion, and olives in the baking dish.
Top with the cream cheese, mozzarella cheese, and cheddar cheese.
Pour the salsa over the top.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Serve with tortilla chips.

dcc524d157.gt:
Brown hamburger and onions in the oil.
Combine all other ingredients in the crockpot (Except for the cheese)
Cover and cook 1 hour on high then turn your crockpot to low and cook for an additional 4 hours.
When finished cooking sprinkle the cheese on top and let sit in the cooker for about 5-10 more minutes until its all melted through.
dcc524d157.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cook macaroni and hamburger in crock pot until macaroni is tender.
Drain.
Add remaining ingredients and stir.
Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours.

30325f1814.gt:
Beans: trim and remove strings if you choose, then wash them.
Cook beans until they are crisp-tender.
Drain and set aside.
Cook bacon and reserve fat.
In a deep pan or pot, add olive oil.
Once hot, add the onion and saute for a little bit.
Now add garlic and simmer until the onions are clear.
Add the mushrooms, red bell pepper and parsley.
After 5 minutes of simmering, add cooking wine, chicken broth and some of the reserved bacon fat.
Cook until desired taste or when some of the liquid steams away.
Add salt to taste.
Remove liquid mixture from the stove, add the string beans, almonds and crumbled bacon.
Mix well and put in a serving dish.
Enjoy!
30325f1814.pred:
Combine all ingredients except the almonds and broth in a large skillet.
Cook over medium heat until the onions are softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the mushrooms and bell pepper; cook until the mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the parsley and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Add the broth and almonds; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer until the almonds are tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the chicken broth.
Season with salt and pepper.

5a55d2d191.gt:
Preheat oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C).
Line a baking sheet with paper towels.
Fill a bowl with lightly-salted water.
Rinse the grated sweet potato in the water, and drain into a sieve.
Pat the grated sweet potato dry with a cloth or paper towels, then place into a bowl.
Squeeze excess moisture from the grated onion, and place into the bowl with the sweet potato.
Stir the eggs and pepper into the mixture until well combined.
Heat the olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat until it shimmers, and spoon about 1 heaping tablespoon of the potato mixture per patty into the hot oil.
Flatten the patties with a fork, and fry until golden brown and crisp on the bottom, 5 to 8 minutes.
Flip and cook on the other side, sprinkle with salt, then set the cooked patties aside on the prepared baking sheet in the preheated oven while you finish cooking the latkes.
Stir the potato mixture before cooking each batch of patties.
Serve hot with applesauce and yogurt.
5a55d2d191.pred:
Place the grated sweet potato, onion, eggs, black pepper, olive oil, and salt in a bowl and mix well.
Add the applesauce and yogurt and mix until the batter is smooth.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Drop the batter by tablespoonfuls into the hot oil.
Fry until golden brown on both sides, about 2 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve with applesauce and sour cream.

df8f764b0d.gt:
Sprinkle the patties with salt and pepper and grill the hamburgers; Transfer the patties to a warmed platter and start the eggs.
Heat 4 teaspoons of butter in a skillet and carefully break the eggs and cook them sunny side up until the whites are firm.
Remove from the skillet and place one egg on each pattie.
Sprinkle the eggs with salt and pepper;.
Arrange the anchovies (if desired) on top of the eggs.
Heat 4 tablespoons in a skillet; When it gets foamy, add the capers and parsley.
When the butter just starts to brown, pour equal amounts of the sauce over each egg/pattie and serve hot.
df8f764b0d.pred:
Mix all ingredients except the steak and eggs.
Shape the meat into 4 patties.
Grill the patties until cooked through.
Place the patties on the bottom half of the buns.
Top with the egg, and then the anchovy fillets and capers.
Place the top half of the bun on top.

c7e9cae7ae.gt:
In a large saucepan with boiling salted water, cook pasta 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente.
Drain and put back in the saucepan.
Meanwhile, in another saucepan, bring to boil heavy cream and dry onion flakes.
Add asparagus and smoked salmon, cook at low heat until warm.
Remove from the heat, add 1/2 cup of parmigiano reggiano and stir.
Add salt and pepper.
Add sauce to the pasta and stir to coat well.
Sprinkle each serving with remaining parmigiano reggiano.
c7e9cae7ae.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
Cook linguine in large pot of boiling salted water until al dente.
Meanwhile, in a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add cream and bring to a simmer.
Add asparagus and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add salmon and heat through.
Remove from heat and stir in cheese.
Season with salt and pepper.
Drain linguine and toss with sauce.
Serve immediately.

dafbe725ac.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).
Mix ingredients well in the order given.
Drop by teaspoon on cookie sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.
Under bake for a chewy cookie.
dafbe725ac.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugars.
Add the flour, baking soda, salt, and baking powder.
Beat in the eggs and vanilla.
Stir in the raisins and coconut.
Stir in the cereal.
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.

1ebd581dca.gt:
In a large mixing bowl combine rhubarb, strawberries, sugar, lemon juice, cornstarch and the pinch of salt, stirring together well.
Spoon mixture into an 8x8 in (20x20 cm) glass baking dish.
In a second bowl, combine brown sugar, oats, cinnamon, nutmeg and butter, and stir with a fork until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Sprinkle this mixture over the fruit mixture.
If using oven, place in a 325F preheated oven, and bake uncovered for 20-25 minutes until golden brown on top and fruit is tender.
If using an outdoor grill, position the pan on a cool side of the grill (that means for a gas grill no heat directly underneath).
Maintain the heat to a medium-low temperature (around 300F).
Close lid of grill and cook 25-30 minutes.
Make sure to rotate the baking dish on the grill about every 8 minutes for even cooking.
Either way, the fruit should be tender and the juices bubbling when finished cooking.
I love serving with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or frozen yogurt.
1ebd581dca.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine rhubarb, strawberries, sugar, lemon juice, cornstarch, salt and cinnamon.
Stir until sugar is dissolved.
Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Cover with foil.
Bake for 45 minutes.
Remove foil and bake for 15 minutes more.
Sprinkle with nutmeg.
Serve warm or cold.

540bbf9ab0.gt:
For the muffins: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 2 muffin tins.
In the bowl of a stand mixer, add butter and 1 cup sugar.
Cream for 3-5 minutes or until fluffy and pale in color.
Add the vanilla.
Add the eggs one a time, mixing after each addition.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder, cream of tartar, and nutmeg.
Add the flour mixture and sour cream alternately to the butter mixture, starting and ending with the flour.
Scrape down the bowl as needed.
Fold in the cinnamon chips.
In a small bowl, whisk together remaining 1 cup of sugar and tablespoons of cinnamon.
Using an ice cream scoop, scoop the batter into the cinnamon-sugar mixture and roll around to coat completely, making sure not to press your fingers into the batter while you roll.
Place the coated muffins into the prepared tins.
Bake for 20-22 minutes, or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and let cool in the pans for 5 minutes before removing them to a wire rack to cool completely.
For the glaze: In a small bowl, whisk together powdered sugar, vanilla and milk until smooth.
Drizzle the glaze over the warm muffins with a spoon or a fork.
540bbf9ab0.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Line a 12-count muffin tin with paper liners.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add the vanilla and flour, alternating with the milk, beating until just combined.
Stir in the baking soda, baking powder, cream of tartar, nutmeg, cinnamon, and cinnamon chips.
Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups.
Bake for 18 to 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Dust with powdered sugar and serve.

f89bbed17a.gt:
Bring sweet potatoes and beets to a boil.
Slice sweet peppers lengthways.
Finely chop parsley.
Grate carrots and put aside in a bowl.
Cut beets into squares of medium to small sizes but not large.
Crush sweet potatoes and place both in a large bowl.
Chop up kale as finely as you can.
Ensure not to add the stalk.
Mix all dry ingredients in a bowl adding the salt and black pepper to taste.
Add sweet corn and cream style corn to bowl and mix.
In greased dish add approximately half of mixture.
Then add a layer of cheddar cheese and add all of the feta cheese.
Add remainder of mixture and layer top with cheddar cheese.
Bake at 190C for 30-45minutes.
Enjoy!
:)
f89bbed17a.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Wash and peel beets, sweet potatoes, and carrots.
Cut beets into 1/4 inch slices, sweet potatoes into 1/2 inch slices, and carrots into 1/2 inch slices.
Cut peppers into 1/4 inch slices.
Cut kale into 1/4 inch slices.
Place all vegetables in a large bowl.
Add salt, pepper, and margarine.
Toss well.
Place vegetables in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 45 minutes.
Remove from oven and sprinkle with feta cheese.
Return to oven and bake for 15 minutes more.
Remove from oven and sprinkle with cheddar cheese.
Return to oven and bake for 15 minutes more.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Serve.

abf7924ee4.gt:
Start by heating olive oil in a skillet over high heat.
When the pan is pretty hot, add the garlic and cook for 1 minute literally.
You dont want the garlic to burn.
We used 3 cloves of garlic, but we probably should have used 4.
I love that stuff!
Add the butter and stir to melt.
Then add the heavy cream.
Stir well and heat for 5 minutes.
Add the flour.
This will help thicken the sauce.
Although corn starch could be used instead, I tend to stay away from that unless I absolutely need to use it.
Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Then add the salt and pepper.
We used more pepper than salt, but thats entirely up to you.
Add the ground nutmeg, and stir.
At the end of the process, add the grated cheese, stir and then add in the parsley, which will add some green and liven up the dish.
Serve with pasta (we used tortellini) and enjoy!
abf7924ee4.pred:
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes.
Add butter and cream and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer until sauce is thick, about 10 minutes.
Stir in flour and season with salt and pepper.
Cook for 1 minute.
Stir in nutmeg and Parmesan cheese.
Remove from heat and stir in parsley.
Serve over pasta.

c33ce732c6.gt:
Add a pinch of salt to a pot of boiling water.
Cut the broccoli into small florets and boil for 40 seconds to a minute!
* Do not over boil and drain in a sieve.
Finely chop the bacon and garlic.
Pour a generous amount of oil into a pan and fry the bacon until it is brown and crispy.
Add the garlic.
When the garlic is fragrant, add the broccoli.
Sprinkle salt and pepper to taste.
Allow the flavours to blend and it's done!
c33ce732c6.pred:
Mix broccoli, bacon, garlic, and olive oil.
Stir fry until broccoli is tender.
Season with salt and pepper.

6d750b6d49.gt:
Heat pan, brown ground meat of choice
Finely chop peppers and onions.
Heat seperate pan with olive oil and saute peppers and onions with salt and pepper to taste.
Peel and dice Avocados.
Set aside.
Once peppers and onions are finished, combine meat, peppers, and avocados together.
Add 1 3/4 cups of Balsamic Vinaigrette to mixture and cook on low.
Add salt, black pepper, and garlic to taste.
Slice limes into wedges and set aside.
Finely dice Cilantro and set aside.
Cut heads off of Romaine lettuce and set aside.
Since we are using the lettuce as the wrap, the outer leaves typically work better.
Take two leaves of Romaine lettuce and spread hummus on the inside.
Add meat, pepper, onion, avocado, balsamic mix to wrap.
Finish off with Cilantro and Lime!
There are many things you can add to this such as rice, cheese, etc.
This is a healthier option we chose.
Enjoy!
6d750b6d49.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Place the lettuce leaves on a large plate.
Sprinkle the meat over the lettuce leaves.
Top with the green, red, and yellow peppers.
Sprinkle with the onion.
Slice the avocados and place on top of the lettuce.
Drizzle with the Hummus.
Squeeze lime juice over the top.
Sprinkle with cilantro.
Drizzle with the Balsamic Vinaigrette.
Drizzle with olive oil.
Sprinkle with cheese, if desired.
Serve with rice, if desired.

102b043149.gt:
1.
Make the seasoned rice vinegar (sushi-su): Combine the vinegar, sugar, salt, and kombu (if you are using it) in a small saucepan.
Place the saucepan over medium-high heat and cook, stirring until the sugar and salt dissolve.
When the mixture is clear, remove the saucepan from the heat and set it aside to cool.
Discard the piece of kombu.
The vinegar can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.
2.
Make the sushi rice: Cook rice according to package directions.
Transfer freshly cooked hot rice to a wide shallow bowl.
Pour a small amount of the seasoned vinegar evenly over the rice.
Toss the rice by gently cutting into it vertically with your rice paddle (or spatula), and then lifting the rice and turning it over.
As you do this, fan the rice with a hand fan or piece of cardboard (or get someone to help you).
Add more of the seasoned vinegar and continue the cutting, folding, and fanning process.
Fanning the rice facilitates quick cooling, which gelatinizes the surface of the rice and gives a glossy finish to it.
Towards the end, taste the rice occasionally to decide how much of you seasoned vinegar you want to add.
3.
Cover the seasoned rice with a moist cloth or plastic wrap until ready to use.
102b043149.pred:
Mix all ingredients except rice vinegar and kombu in a bowl.
Add rice vinegar and kombu.
Mix well.
Place rice in a large bowl.
Add the rice vinegar and kombu mixture.
Mix well.
Cover and let stand for 15 minutes.
Serve with soy sauce.

8872296451.gt:
Mix all ingredients and blend well.
Pour into a greased 2 1/2 quart casserole baking dish.
Bake at 350 degrees for 45 to 50 minutes or until light brown on top.
Note: 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar cheese may be sprinkled on top during last 10 minutes of baking (optional).
8872296451.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Mix cornbread mix, corn, eggs, sour cream, and butter.
Pour into baking dish.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes.

3fe0a3e464.gt:
1.
Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil.
Add soba; cook 3 minutes.
Add broccoli to pan; cook 3 minutes or until soba and broccoli are done.
Drain.2.
Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat.
Coat pan with cooking spray.
Sprinkle chicken evenly with salt and pepper.
Add chicken to pan; grill 6 minutes on each side or until done.
Remove chicken from pan.
Cut into 1-inch pieces.3.
Combine vinegar, sesame oil, soy sauce, peanut butter, 1 teaspoon sesame seeds, sugar, crushed red pepper, and garlic in a large bowl, stirring with a whisk.
Stir in noodle mixture and chicken.
Sprinkle with remaining 1 teaspoon sesame seeds and green onions.
3fe0a3e464.pred:
Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the broccoli and cook, stirring occasionally, until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, until no longer pink, about 5 minutes.
Add the soba and cook, stirring occasionally, until the noodles are tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the rice vinegar, sesame oil, soy sauce, peanut butter, sesame seeds, brown sugar, and crushed red pepper.
Stir to combine.
Serve immediately.

d070cb5476.gt:
In a small bowl, mix together rosemary, thyme, marjoram, salt, and pepper.
Rub herb mixture over tenderloin.
Place in a container, and pour hard cider over roast.
Add water until pork is completely submerged.
Cover, and refrigerate 6 to 8 hours, or overnight.
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Place roast in a roasting pan, elevated from the bottom, and pour marinade around the meat.
Bake for 1 hour in preheated oven.
In a large bowl, mix apples and onion.
Put mixture around and on top of roast.
Spoon brown sugar over entire pan evenly.
Place roast back into oven, and continue to cook for 1 hour more, or until meat reaches 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
Transfer roast, apples, and onion to a serving platter.
For the gravy, brown flour in a skillet.
Pour the marinade/drippings mixture into the skillet.
Stir in syrup.
Cook and stir over high heat until liquid has thickened to desired consistency.
Slice roast, and serve with gravy.
d070cb5476.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a small bowl, combine the dried rosemary, thyme, marjoram, salt and pepper.
Rub the pork tenderloin with the spice mixture.
Heat a large skillet over medium high heat.
Add the pork tenderloin and brown on all sides.
Transfer the pork to a roasting pan.
Add the apples, onion, brown sugar, flour and maple syrup to the skillet.
Cook until the apples are tender, about 10 minutes.
Pour the cider into the skillet and bring to a boil.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and roast for 1 hour.
Remove the pork from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes.
Slice the pork and serve with the apple and onion mixture.

4edb974667.gt:
Pre-heat broiler.
Prepare pan with non stick spray.
in a small bowl combine chili powder, paprika, cumin, pepper, & cinnamon.
Place steak on wax paper, sprinkle cinnamon mixture over both side of steak.
Let stand for 15 minutes.
Broil steal 5" from heat for approx 6 minutes on each side.
Slice steak against grain.
4oz per serving.
4edb974667.pred:
Place the London Broil in a shallow dish.
Combine the spices and rub them all over the meat.
Let the meat marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Place the meat on a rack in the middle of a roasting pan.
Roast the meat for 15 minutes.
Reduce the heat to 350 degrees F and continue roasting for 15 minutes more.
Let the meat rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

fdb9200291.gt:
start by heating a large skillet with butter, garlic & olive oil cook on med heat about 1 minute add in diced serrano chili cook another minute.
add in shrimp & chopped lobster and all seasonings along with chili paste.
Cook 6-7 minutes till shrimp are nice & pink.
This is a spicy dish Enjoy!
fdb9200291.pred:
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the olive oil and butter.
Once the butter has melted, add the garlic and saute for 1 minute.
Add the chili paste and hot shot seasoning and cook for 1 minute.
Add the lobster tail and serrano chili and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the shrimp and cook for 2 minutes.
Season with the black pepper and garlic salt.
Serve with rice.

fc990de78b.gt:
Cut leeks diagonally into thirds and then diagonally in half to form 6 triangular pieces from each leek.
Rinse under cold water; drain.
Melt margarine in a heavy skillet; add leeks.
Cook until lightly browned, stirring gently, approx 15 minutes.
Stir in the broth cover and simmer for 30 minutes or until golden and the broth has mostly evaporated.
fc990de78b.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
Cut each leek into 4 pieces lengthwise, then cut each piece crosswise into 1/4-inch slices.
Place leeks in a 13x9-inch baking dish.
Pour chicken broth over leeks.
Sprinkle with salt and margarine.
Cover with foil.
Bake 45 minutes.
Uncover and bake 15 minutes longer.

7106d13160.gt:
preheat oven to 350
cream together brown sugar, butter, milk and eggs
mix in bisquick
in pieces add bananas 1 at a time until incorporated
pour batter into greased bread pan or baking dish of choice (i use an 8x10 casserole because i dont have a bread pan)
bake at 350 for 45-55 minutes
remove from oven, cool for 5 minutes for easier removal from pan
7106d13160.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Pour into a greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

1ce32e6812.gt:
Toss lettuce with croutons and bacon in large bowl.
Add dressing and cheese; mix lightly.
Serve with lemon wedges.
1ce32e6812.pred:
Mix dressing, cheese, lemon juice and lemon wedges in large bowl.
Add lettuce, croutons and turkey bacon.
Toss to coat.

92214874b7.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
Cook lasagna in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 8 minutes.
Drain.
Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat; stir cream cheese into hot butter until it begins to melt, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt, onion powder, and black pepper.
Whisk warm milk gradually into cream cheese until smooth; stir in 1 1/2 cup Swiss cheese.
Bring sauce to a simmer, stirring constantly, until cheese has melted and sauce has thickened, 5 to 10 minutes.
Remove from heat.
Spread 3/4 cup of cheese sauce into bottom of a 9x9-inch baking dish.
Arrange 1/3 of the lasagna noodles over the sauce and spread half the cooked chicken and half the ham over the noodles.
Pour 1 cup sauce over chicken and ham.
Repeat layers starting with half the remaining lasagna noodles, remaining chicken, remaining ham, and 1 more cup of cheese sauce.
Finish by layering remaining lasagna noodles, remaining sauce, 1/2 cup Swiss cheese, and bread crumbs; sprinkle top with Italian seasoning.
Cover dish with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until casserole is bubbling, about 25 minutes.
Remove foil and continue to bake until crumbs are browned, about 10 more minutes.
Let casserole stand 5 to 10 minutes before serving.
92214874b7.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together the cream cheese, butter, salt, onion powder, and black pepper.
Spread 1/2 cup of the cream cheese mixture on the bottom of a 13x9-inch baking dish.
Arrange 3 lasagna noodles on top of the cream cheese mixture.
Spread 1/2 cup of the cream cheese mixture over the noodles.
Top with 1/2 cup of the warm milk.
Repeat the layers twice, ending with the cream cheese mixture.
Sprinkle with the Swiss cheese and Italian seasoning.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and let stand for 10 minutes.
Cut into 12 squares.

24452e5a07.gt:
Stir the cream cheese, sour cream, jalapeno pepper, salsa verde, red salsa, onion, lime juice, and chili powder seasoning together in a bowl until well blended.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.
24452e5a07.pred:
Place cream cheese and sour cream in a bowl.
Mix well.
Add jalapeno pepper, salsa verde, red salsa, onion, and lime juice.
Mix well.
Season with chili powder.
Serve with tortilla chips.

fec819225d.gt:
Bring the orange juice, soy sauce, chicken stock, and orange zest to a boil in a saucepan.
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until the sauce has reduced to half of its original volume, about 30 minutes.
fec819225d.pred:
Place the orange juice, soy sauce, and chicken broth in a small saucepan and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in the orange zest and remove from the heat.
Cool slightly and serve.

a7cd3b464c.gt:
Heat oil in large saucepan or Dutch oven.
Add garlic, ginger, lemon peel and hot pepper flakes.
Cook gently until very fragrant.
Add broth, soy sauce and lemon juice and bring to boil.
Add carrots.
Reduce heat and simmer gently for 15 minutes.
Add scallops, shrimp, sesame oil and green onions, Cook for just a few minutes, or until seafood is barely cooked.
Serve sprinkled with cilantro.
a7cd3b464c.pred:
In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat.
Add garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add lemon peel and red pepper flakes and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add broth and soy sauce and bring to a boil.
Add carrots, scallops, and shrimp and simmer until scallops are opaque, about 5 minutes.
Add sesame oil and green onions and cook until onions are soft, about 3 minutes.
Add cilantro and serve.

12f49a25e6.gt:
Take the meat out of the fridge at least 30 minutes before cooking and pound it to tenderize.
Use your hands to re-shape the meat back into it's original thickness and season with salt and pepper.
In a pan that is hot enough to cause the beef fat to smoke, cook one side of the meat on a strong heat until browned.
Flip it over and cook the other side for 1 minute.
Then flip over again and cook for another 1 minute to finish.
Pour over your choice of sauce and serve.
I recommend this steak sauce,.
By the way, this is the dinner that I made for my husband's birthday.
12f49a25e6.pred:
Tricks to Cooking a Delicious & Tender SteakUse ingredients:1 Beef,1 Salt and pepper,1 Beef tallow (or vegetable oil, butter),1 Your choice of sauce.
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
Season steak with salt and pepper.
Heat beef tallow in a skillet over medium-high heat.
When the tallow is hot, add the steak and cook until browned on both sides, about 3 minutes per side.
Transfer steak to a baking dish and place in the oven.
Cook for 6 to 8 minutes for medium-rare.
Remove from oven and let rest for 5 minutes before serving.
Serve with your choice of sauce.

0979acfd51.gt:
Slice the sausages diagonally.
Heat the oil in a pan, and fry the sausage until browned.
Sprinkle on a generous amount of cracked black pepper.
The sausages are done when they are close to becoming burnt.
If you have the time, top them with a sunny-side-up egg.
The creaminess of the egg yolk is divine.
0979acfd51.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Add fish sausages and fry until golden brown.
Season with cracked black pepper.
Serve with a beer.

73d8122a4e.gt:
In food processor, mix all ingredients until you have a lumpy paste.
Put in a saucepan (I used a small saucepan and it was perfect).
Bring to boil and let simmer slowly about 15 minutes.
Add salt to taste.
Pour in a jar and let cool.
It's good up to one month in the fridge.
73d8122a4e.pred:
to make the hot pepper paste.
Mix all ingredients in a blender until smooth.
Use immediately or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

4368d128b9.gt:
Brown the ground beef using the seasonings i have listed to flavor the meat.
(I usually add these seasonings to taste since i rarely measure them, so the measurements i have listed are a guideline) Add 1/4 cup of water and let meat and seasonings simmer until liquid is mostly cooked off.
You don't want it soupy.
Drain on paper toweling.
Clean lettuce, tear into bite sized pieces.
Toss with all of the rest of the ingredients adding about 1/2 cup of the dressing and tossing again well.
Serve with salsa and sour cream on the side if desired.
I list Doritos here because, let's face it, they're good!
But when I have time, i like to cut up corn tortillas into wedges, fry in a bit of oil, and season with Mexican style spices.
4368d128b9.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large skillet, brown ground beef over medium heat.
Drain fat and return to skillet.
Add chili powder, cumin, Mexican oregano, onion powder, garlic powder, paprika, and salt.
Stir to combine.
Cook until meat is no longer pink, about 5 minutes.
Add iceburg lettuce, tomatoes, onion, avocados, and Dorito Nacho Chips.
Stir to combine.
Spoon into a 9x13 baking dish.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Serve with tortilla chips.

7112e492e4.gt:
Heat oil and slowly cook onion, carrot and celery over medium heat for approx 8 min until soft.
Add zest of lemon and rice.
Stir.
Add chicken broth and boil on low for approx 20 min until vegetables are tender.
Add peas, chicken, lemon juice and parsley 5 minutes before serving.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
7112e492e4.pred:
In a large saucepan, saute onion, carrots, and celery in oil until soft.
Add lemon zest, rice, chicken broth, peas, and lemon juice.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add chicken and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with parsley.

c5696489b7.gt:
Soften cream cheese and mix well with sour cream, cheese and salsa.
Make sure to drain the salsa if it has to much liquid.
Garnish with chopped tomato or cilantro.
c5696489b7.pred:
Place all ingredients in a food processor or blender.
Process until smooth.
Serve with chips or tortilla chips.

11f49e3f17.gt:
In a bowl combine pecans and wafers and mix together.
Sift in icing sugar and cocoa powder and ensure it is blended well.
Add corn syrup and rum.
Stir.
Let chill for at least 30 minutes.
Take a teaspoonful and roll into a ball.
I rolled them in chocolate sprinkles because that just seemed so rum-ball-like but you could dip them in chocolate or roll them in icing sugar or cocoa.
Place in the refrigerator to chill.
These can be kept for 2 weeks in an airtight container.
Serve at room temperature.
11f49e3f17.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix pecans, vanilla wafers, icing sugar, cocoa powder, corn syrup, banana rum and chocolate sprinkles in a bowl.
Roll into balls and coat with chocolate, icing sugar or cocoa.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.
Let cool and serve.

e3bc640873.gt:
In a mixing bowl beat eggs, sugar, corn syrup and vanilla.
Add butter and mix well.
Stir in pecans and chocolate chips.
Pour into pie shell.
Bake at 350 F for 50-55 minutes or until set.
It is important for it to be set *before* you remove it from the oven.
It will not set afterward if you haven't baked it long enough.
Serve with ice cream if desired.
e3bc640873.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, beat eggs until light and fluffy.
Add sugar, corn syrup, and vanilla; beat until well blended.
Add melted butter and pecans; mix well.
Pour into unbaked pastry shells.
Bake for 45 minutes.
Cool on a wire rack.
Serve with vanilla ice cream.

7bf3659a3a.gt:
Place tomatoes, onions, celery, parsley and bay leaves in a large pot and cook, covered, on low heat for 1 to 2 hours, until quite soft and fragrant.
Remove bay leaves and blend tomato mixture in batches in a food processor or blender, then run through a sieve and return juice to pot.
Stir in salt, sugar, seasoning salt, pepper and garlic salt.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and cook, uncovered, 1 to 2 hours, until thickened.
7bf3659a3a.pred:
In a large pot, combine the tomatoes, onions, celery, parsley, bay leaves, salt, sugar, seasoning salt, pepper, and garlic salt.
Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1 hour.
Remove from the heat and let cool.
Strain the soup through a fine sieve into a large bowl, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
Discard the solids.
Cool the soup completely.
Refrigerate until chilled.
Serve in chilled bowls.

2989cc6886.gt:
Dredge the well drained oysters in some starch and toss them very gently in a bowl till the liquid turns dark.
Wash out the darkened liquid with cold water until the water becomes clear.
Drain well.
Place the oysters between paper towels and dry.
Coat the oysters lightly with some flour (not listed in the ingredients above).
Heat some salad oil in a non-stick frying pan, add garlic, stir fry till they become golden over medium heat.
Add oysters cook until golden.
Turn over, add the Sake and cover.
Cook for 2 to 3 minutes over low heat.
Add and melt the butter.
Add soy sauce and green onion and stir to coat the oysters with sauce.
Serve hot.
Washing oysters with starch to purify the taste is a method I learned from Chinese recipe while traditionalist Japanese chefs use graded Daikon radish juice.
Buttered ride recipe is available in my blog.
http://kcocoangela.blog132.fc2.com/blog-entry-6.html
2989cc6886.pred:
In a small bowl, combine the starch and garlic.
Heat the oil and butter in a frying pan.
Add the oysters and cook until they are golden brown.
Add the starch mixture and cook for a few minutes.
Add the sake or white wine and soy sauce and cook until the sauce is thickened.
Add the green onions and serve.

b9d49b2792.gt:
Marinade lamb in lemon juice, oil, garlic and chopped rosemary for at least an hour.
Combine lemon, onion, garlic and rosemary sprigs in a baking dish and place lamb rack with marinade on top.
Bake at 180 C for 35-40 mins or until cooked to your preference.
Remove lamb to a plate & keep warm.
Discard pan ingredients but reserve pan juices.
Heat pan juices and blend in flour.
Cook for 1 minute.
Gradually blend in stock and wine until smooth.
Cook stirring until sauce boils and thickens, Season to taste.
Serve roast, sliced into cutlets with sauce and vegetables of your choice.
b9d49b2792.pred:
Mix together the lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, rosemary, lemon wedges, onion, and garlic cloves.
Place the lamb rack in the marinade and refrigerate for 24 hours.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Remove the lamb from the marinade and pat dry.
Place the lamb on a rack in a roasting pan.
Roast the lamb for 1 hour.
Remove the lamb from the oven and let rest for 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a saucepan, combine the flour and vegetable stock.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the red wine and simmer for 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Carve the lamb into individual chops and serve with the sauce.
Garnish with the rosemary sprig.

128f70ff9b.gt:
Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
Heat the olive oil in a large, heavy pot over medium-high heat.
Stir in the onion, garlic, and serrano chili; cook until the onion has softened, about 1 minute.
Add the chicken, and continue to cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in the cilantro, peas, corn, and red pepper; cook for 1 minute.
Pour in the chicken broth, potatoes, and rice.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the chicken is opaque and the potatoes are tender, about 40 minutes.
128f70ff9b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is soft, about 5 minutes.
Add chicken, chile, cilantro, and 1/2 cup broth.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer 20 minutes.
Add potatoes, corn, and remaining broth.
Cover and simmer 30 minutes, or until potatoes are tender.
Add rice and simmer 15 minutes, or until rice is tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake 20 minutes.
Serve with a dollop of sour cream.

f0e5ecb2aa.gt:
Mix together 1 cup sugar and 1 Tbsp cinnamon in a small bowl.
Set aside.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a muffin pan or use paper muffin cups.
Cream the butter and 1/2 cup sugar until soft, about 3 to 5 minutes.
Add in the vanilla.
Add in the eggs one at a time and mix until well incorporated.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cream of tartar and nutmeg.
Add the flour mixture and the sour cream alternately to the egg-butter mixture in multiple additions.
Start with the flour and end with the flour.
Scrape the bowl occasionally.
Using an ice cream scoop, scoop out muffin batter one at a time and drop into the bowl filled with the cinnamon sugar mixture.
Roll the muffin around in the mixture until it is covered completely in cinnamon sugar.
Place muffin into muffin tin.
Depending on the size of your tins, you should get about 14 to 18 muffins.
Bake them for approximately 20-22 minutes or until they are golden brown.
f0e5ecb2aa.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg and cream of tartar.
Add dry ingredients to butter mixture and mix until just combined.
Stir in sour cream.
Spoon batter into muffin cups in a muffin tin.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

9d9d29f6e8.gt:
Slice the strawberries in about 1/2-inch size pieces.
Add about 1/3 of the strawberries to the bottom of the serving dish.
Next, add 1/2 of the whipped cream on top of the berries.
Then add 1/2 of the corn flakes on top of the whipped cream.
Add another layer of the strawberries (add about 3/4 of the remaining strawberries, leaving the rest of them for garnish).
Next add the remaining whipped cream, top with the corn flakes, and garnish with the remaining strawberries.
9d9d29f6e8.pred:
Stir together the strawberries and whipped cream.
Spoon the mixture into a bowl.
Top with the corn flakes.
Serve immediately.

7278a1d6dc.gt:
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Combine squash and next 5 ingredients (squash through garlic), and saute for 8 minutes or until lightly browned, stirring frequently.
Add bay leaves and 2 thyme sprigs, and stir in tomato paste.
Stir in flour and wine, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in the broth and chickpeas.
Cover and simmer 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Stir in 1/2 teaspoon salt, pepper, and chopped parsley.
Discard bay leaves and thyme.Discard mushroom stems; slice caps.
Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sliced mushrooms, and cook 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Serve ragout over mushrooms.
Garnish with additional thyme sprigs, if desired.
7278a1d6dc.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large, deep skillet, heat 2 teaspoons of the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the butternut squash, leek, carrot, parsnip, celery, and garlic.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are softened, about 10 minutes.
Add the tomato paste, flour, and 1/2 cup of the wine.
Cook, stirring, until the mixture thickens, about 5 minutes.
Add the chickpeas, vegetable broth, bay leaves, thyme, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Bring to a simmer, then cover and cook in the oven until the vegetables are tender, about 30 minutes.
Remove the bay leaves and thyme sprigs.
Stir in the parsley and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Serve over cooked pasta.
If you like, garnish with thyme sprigs.

4a4f70b53b.gt:
Spray skillet.
Heat it over medium heat.
Add potatoes and brown lightly.
Set aside.
Season chops with powders and pepper.
Put a little oil in skillet.
Cook chops for one minute on each side.
Drain fat if necessary.
Add water.
Cover and cook for 10 minutes.
Add potatoes and mushroom.
Cook for 10 more minutes.
Stir in sour cream.
Heat thoroughly, but don't boil.
4a4f70b53b.pred:
Put the potatoes in a pot and cover with water.
Bring to a boil and cook until tender.
Drain.
Mash the potatoes.
In a large skillet, heat oil.
Add onion powder, garlic powder, pepper, and mushrooms.
Saute until tender.
Add pork chops and cook until done.
Add sour cream and water.
Heat until hot.
Serve over mashed potatoes.

8c72bca7c7.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Heat olive oil in a large skillet; cook and stir zucchini, onion, and bell pepper in hot oil until tender, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in green chiles, eggs, salt, cumin, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper; set aside.
Mix sour cream and flour in a bowl.
Layer half the corn tortillas in a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Spread half the zucchini mixture and half the sour cream mixture on top; sprinkle with half the Cheddar cheese.
Repeat the layers.
Bake in preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 30 minutes.
8c72bca7c7.pred:
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat.
Add zucchini and onion; cook and stir 5 minutes or until tender.
Add green pepper and chiles; cook and stir 3 minutes.
Stir in eggs, salt, cumin, garlic powder, and cayenne.
Cook and stir 2 minutes or until eggs are set.
Stir in sour cream and flour.
Heat through.
Spoon into a 13x9 inch baking dish.
Top with tortilla wedges.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until heated through.

bf72159d6c.gt:
Follow ingredient instructions to microwave peppers.
Cut ingredients to fit in blender.
All all ingredients to blender and blend to desired consistency (add a sliver of the habenero to start).
Refrigerate leftovers.
NOTE: May need to add more salt or even cilantro if necessary.
Adjust ingredients according to taste or heat desired.
If too hot, add another tomato.
bf72159d6c.pred:
In a blender, combine tomatoes, onion, cilantro, jalapenos, habanero, salt, and pepper.
Blend until smooth.
Add more salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with tortilla chips.

6c3cf7db1f.gt:
Decase the sausage and saute in a large pot; use a wooden spoon to crumble the sausage as it cooks.
Once the sausage is nicely browned, stir in the onion, garlic, chili powder and cumin and continue cooking until the onion softens about 5 minutes.
Add the beer and allow it to simmer for an additional 5 minutes scraping up any brown bits from the bottom of the pan.
Stir in the tomatoes, tomato paste and allow it to simmer, uncovered for an additional 10-15 minutes on med-low, stirring occasionally.
Taste and adjust seasonings with salt and pepper.
Finally stir in the beans and the corn.
Let this come to a simmer and its ready to serve!
(Can be prepared a day ahead.
).
6c3cf7db1f.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sausage and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Remove sausage from skillet and set aside.
Add onion and garlic to skillet and cook until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add chili powder, cumin, and salt and pepper.
Cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add beer and bring to a boil.
Add sausage, beans, corn, tomatoes, tomato paste, and 1 cup of water.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in cheese.
Pour chili into a 9x13 baking dish.
Sprinkle with tortilla chips.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Serve with sour cream and grated cheese.

1f380be1bd.gt:
Put chocolate in small bowl.
Microwave for 35 seconds.
The chips will still look whole, DO NOT MICROWAVE ANY LONGER!
IT WILL BURN, instead stir for 20 seconds and all lumps will be smooth.
Lay out a piece of foil.
Dip pretzels with fingers in chocolate scrape off excess and lay on foil.
Wait 30 minutes to cool (Better if not put in fridge or freezer, they melt when they come out).
1f380be1bd.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Melt chocolate chips in a double boiler.
Stir until smooth.
Dip pretzels in the chocolate, coating them completely.
Place on a wax paper lined baking sheet.
Refrigerate until chocolate is set.
Melt chocolate chips in a double boiler.
Stir until smooth.
Dip pretzels in the chocolate, coating them completely.
Place on a wax paper lined baking sheet.
Refrigerate until chocolate is set.

ac586b07a8.gt:
Mix all ingredients except chicken in a small bowl.
Place chicken in the bottom of the crockpot and pour sauce over it.
Cook on low for 1 1/2 hours.
(Depend of chicken breast's size)
Remove chicken and pour sauce into small sauce pot.
Heat sauce over medium to a simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve chicken with sauce on top.
I made rice with veggies as a side dish but you can pick your own side dish.
ac586b07a8.pred:
Place chicken in crockpot.
Mix oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Pour over chicken.
Add broth, honey, mustards, and sriracha.
Cook on low for 8 hours.

783457d1f6.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F and spray a 9 square pan with baking spray (or coat with butter).
In a medium bowl, stir together flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt, and spices.
Set aside.
In a small bowl, combine eggs, buttermilk, and oil.
Add egg mixture all at once to the flour mixture.
Stir just until moistened.
Pour batter into the hot pan and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, until a knife inserted in the middle comes out clean.
783457d1f6.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9x9 baking pan.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and cardamom.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, buttermilk, and oil.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 25 minutes.
Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

4b78e53c53.gt:
In a bowl beat eggs and mix in all ingredients except beef.
Mix in beef and shape into six 1/2-inch patties.
Cook over medium heat, about 5 minutes per side.
Add cheese during the last 3 minutes of cooking.
4b78e53c53.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the egg, bread crumbs, salsa, green onions, red pepper, garlic, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper and hot pepper sauce.
Mix well.
Shape into 6 patties.
Place in the refrigerator for 15 minutes.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 1 tablespoon of oil to the skillet.
Add the patties and cook for 5 minutes on each side or until cooked through.
Remove from the skillet and place on a plate.
Top each patty with a slice of cheese and cover with a plate.
Refrigerate for 5 minutes.
Remove the cheese from the top of the patties and place on the bottom of the skillet.
Add 1 tablespoon of oil to the skillet.
Place the patties on top of the cheese.
Cook for 2 minutes on each side or until the cheese is melted.
Serve immediately.

86795284d9.gt:
In small saucepan bring broths, clam juice and Port to boil.
Season with pepper.
Divide scallops between 2 bowls.
Ladle over the very heated broth.
Garnish with the green onions or chives and serve.
86795284d9.pred:
In a large saucepan, combine the broths and the clam juice.
Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the scallops and simmer for 3 minutes.
Add the green onions and simmer for 1 minute.
Remove from the heat and let cool slightly.
Pour the soup into a blender and puree until smooth.
Return the soup to the saucepan and reheat over medium heat.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Ladle the soup into bowls and serve.

b8672866a8.gt:
Whisk together vinegar, a rounded 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper in a small bowl, then add oil in a slow stream, whisking well.
Put spinach, strawberries, and pecans in a large bowl and toss with just enough vinaigrette to lightly coat.
b8672866a8.pred:
In a small bowl, whisk together the strawberry vinegar and olive oil.
Set aside.
In a large bowl, toss the spinach with the strawberry vinaigrette.
Arrange the spinach on a serving platter.
Top with the strawberries and pecan halves.

63eaa4f8ef.gt:
In a 350 degree oven, toast the walnuts that have been tossed with the oil, salt and pepper.
