Bake for about 5-6 minutes, being careful to not let them burn.
In a large saute pan or skillet over medium high heat, add the vinegar, garlic and oil.
As soon as they are hot, add the onions and cook for only 30 seconds or so.
Next add the cabbage and cook for just about 2 minutes, stirring continually, until color changes from bright purple to pink.
Season with salt, pepper and a dash more vinegar.
Remove the wilted cabbage to individual salad plates and top with the apples, walnuts, goat cheese, and herbs.
63eaa4f8ef.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the walnuts, oil, salt and pepper.
Add the red cabbage, apple, garlic, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, and red onion.
Toss to combine.
Top with goat cheese and parsley.
Toss again.
Serve immediately.

d46cb1cc0e.gt:
Preheat oven to 375.
In a medium bowl, stir together the flour and baking powder; set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, beat eggs until they are light and fluffy.
Gradually add sugar and beat for about 3 minutes.
Stir in the oil and anise extract.
Fold in the dry ingredients and blend well.
Spread the mixture into a 9x13 inch pan and bake for 15 to 20 minutes in the oven.
When the pan cools slightly, cut the cookie down the middle, lengthwise.
Cut each half into 1/2 inch slices.
Place slices onto a cookie sheet and return to the oven long enough to brown on each side, like toast.
Watch so you don't burn them!
:).
Store in a tightly covered container.
d46cb1cc0e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, beat eggs and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add oil and anise extract and mix well.
Add flour mixture to egg mixture and mix until well blended.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.

54c3982f16.gt:
Place the bowl and blade of a food processor into the freezer to chill for 4 to 5 hours.
Refit the bowl and blade, turn on the food processor, and pour the cream through the feed tube.
Continue to process for about 10 minutes, until the Butter has hardened around the blade, leaving the liquid that has separated from the cream in the bottom of the bowl.
Transfer the Butter to a fine sieve and shake 2 or 3 times over the sink to allow any excess liquid to drain.
Put the butter in a bowl, cover, and chill for at least 1 hour before using.
Store it in the refrigerator, where it has a shelf life of about 1 week.
While holding the ruler, grab the end of the top layer of wax paper and slowly pull it toward you; this will form the Butter into the shape of a log.
Roll the paper around the log and chill.
Serve whole or cut off medallions as needed.
54c3982f16.pred:
Heat cream in a small saucepan over medium heat until it begins to bubble.
Remove from heat and add 1 tablespoon of salt.
Cover and let stand at room temperature for 24 hours.
Refrigerate for 24 hours.
Use within 3 days.
Store in refrigerator.

7bf15c7482.gt:
Put the chicken in a crock pot.
Season with salt & pepper: top with remaining ingredients.
Season with more salt & pepper.
Cook on LOW 7-8 hours.
During the last 30 minutes put crock pot on High, sprinkle on the Mozzarella Cheese to melt.
7bf15c7482.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees.
Place chicken in crock pot.
Combine spaghetti sauce, mushrooms, bell pepper, onion, garlic, salt and pepper in crock pot.
Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours.
Serve over spaghetti.
Top with shredded mozzarella cheese.

9dcd86738c.gt:
Mix together all of the ingredients except the shrimp.
Carefully fold in the shrimp so it doesn't break up.
Serve with potato chips or cut vegetables.
9dcd86738c.pred:
Place all ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Serve with chips.

836615e74d.gt:
Place all ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat and stir until tamarind is broken up.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until sugar is dissolved and mixture just comes to a boil, about 10 minutes.
Turn off heat and let cool slightly, at least 10 minutes.
Once cool, strain mixture into a container with a tightfitting lid; discard solids.
Store in the refrigerator until ready to use.
836615e74d.pred:
Add the tamarind paste to a small saucepan and bring to a boil.
Add the arbol chiles and water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in the sugar and simmer for 5 minutes more.
Remove from the heat and let cool.
Store in an airtight container.

ecab1caf21.gt:
Heat a 12 inch skillet over high heat for 4 minutes.
Toss shrimp with 1/2 of the red pepper flakes, 2T oil, 3/4 t salt.
Add shrimp to hot skillet quickly arrange in single layer sear until bottom of shrimp forms small spots of crust about 30 seconds.
Remove from heat and turn shrimp over and add cognac pause until cognac has warmed up slightly about 5 seconds,return to high heat ignite cognac shaking pan when flames are out about 15-30 seconds later pour shrimp into bowl set aside.
Allow skillet to cool return to burner over low heat add 3T oil, 3T garlic; saute until sticky about 7-10 minutes.
Add the rest of the red pepper flakes, 3/4t salt, sugar, tomatoes, and wine; heat on medium high and then simmer until thickened, about 8 minutes.
Stir in shrimp with accumulated juices, remaining 1T garlic and parsley; simmer until shrimp is heated through, about 1 minute.
Take off heat stir in 1T olive oil.
Cook pasta in salted water save 1/3 cup pasta water; drain.
In a pot add pasta 1/2 cup sauce (no shrimp) add 2-3T pasta water toss.
Put some pasta on plates top with sauce and shrimp.
ecab1caf21.pred:
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the shrimp and cook for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the red pepper flakes, garlic, and sugar.
Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add the tomatoes, wine, and brandy.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook the linguine in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente.
Drain the pasta and return it to the pot.
Add the shrimp mixture and toss to coat.
Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a serving bowl and sprinkle with parsley.

9a2ed3c6dc.gt:
Wisk all ingredients together until combined.
Do not overstir.
Heat lightly greased griddle or skillet over medium heat.
Pour or scoop batter onto griddle, apx 1/4 cup per pancake.
Brown on both sides.
Serve hot!
9a2ed3c6dc.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
In a large bowl, combine pancake mix, brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice, egg, milk, oil, and vinegar.
Mix until just combined.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add 1/4 cup batter to the skillet and cook until bubbles form on the surface, about 2 minutes.
Flip and cook until golden brown, about 1 minute more.
Repeat with remaining batter, adding more oil to the skillet as needed.
Serve immediately.

6f4d1ffc76.gt:
In la deep pot, bring water, a pinch of salt and oil to a boil.
Rinse rice a couple of times.
Add to boiling water.
Reduce heat to low, cover and cook until water evaporates (1520 minutes).
Fluff with fork, let it cool to room temperature or refrigerate until ready to use.
When ready to serve, add chopped cilantro and lime juice.
Season with salt.
6f4d1ffc76.pred:
Cilantro Lime Rice:
1.
In a medium saucepan, bring water to a boil.
2.
Add the vegetable oil and rice; stir to combine.
3.
Cover and simmer over low heat for 15 minutes, or until the rice is tender.
4.
Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 5 minutes.
5.
Stir in the chopped cilantro and lime juice.
6.
Season with salt as needed.

6b1de00aa7.gt:
Boil rigatoni according to package directions.
While pasta is cooking, mix ricotta, egg, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, and red pepper for the minicotti filling.
Season with salt.
You could add minced, sauteed mushrooms or chopped spinach here if you wish.
I season the filling a bit more than I would a normal manicotti; you want this one little bite to have some punch.
When rigatoni is al dente, drain and place pasta in cool water to stay soft while you work.
Place filling in an icing bag with a small tip, or a smaller plastic bag with a tiny corner nipped off will work just fine.
Pipe filling into rigatoni.
I like to fill the pasta halfway from one side and halfway from the other.
Place filled minicotti in a baking dish lightly sprayed with cooking spray.
Top minicotti lightly with pasta sauce.
Sprinkle lightly with Parmesan.
Bake at 350 F for 15-20 minutes.
Let sit at room temperature for 5 minutes before serving.
Enjoy!
6b1de00aa7.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, egg, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, and red pepper flakes.
Drain pasta, reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking water.
Add pasta to the ricotta mixture and stir until well combined.
Add pasta sauce and reserved cooking water.
Stir until well combined.
Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes or until heated through.

789488866b.gt:
Mix all wet ingredients and beat until everything is well incorporated.
Mix all dry ingredients.
Then add them to wet mixture a little at a time until everything is completely mix.
Divide mixture equally and pour in two loaf pans.
Bake between 55-60 minutes for 350F.
789488866b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
In a large bowl, combine carrots, coconut, raisins, oil, yogurt, eggs, vanilla, brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, baking soda, and nutmeg.
Mix well.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake for 55 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then remove from pan and cool completely on a wire rack.

43e0e4b926.gt:
Bring cream cheese and mozzarella to room temperature or just [slightly] warm in microwave.
Mix everything together in a bowl.
Except for anything that says, "reserve half."
Or, your purple onions, sweet chili sauce, hot mustard, wontons and oil in a bowl.
Look closely at the ingredient section for clarification.
Smear your cream cheese spread evenly atop of your pre-made crust[s].
Smear a thin layer of sweet chili sauce atop the cream cheese.
This chili sauce can seriously over dominate your pizza - flavor wise - so don't overdue it.
Unless of course, you prefer it as a primary flavor.
Lightly smear your hot mustard to taste and evenly sprinkle on your remaining crab meat.
Add your thin sliced purple and your reserved green onions, red pepper flakes and mozzarella cheese.
Thin slice your wontons and fry in hot oil for about 30 seconds - just until they're just slightly browned and crispy.
They'll brown more as they dry.
Don't over fry.
Place on clean napkins to drain oil then, place them on your pizza.
Bake on a pizza stone or cookie sheet at 425 for 25 minutes.
Or, until crusts are browned and cheese is bubbling.
Slice and serve hot with ice cold beers.
43e0e4b926.pred:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Place pizza crust on a baking sheet.
Spread 1 cup of the mozzarella cheese over the crust.
Top with the remaining 1 cup of mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and top with crab meat, sweet chili sauce, Parmesan cheese, green onions, hot yellow mustard, purple onions, garlic, red pepper flakes, Worshestershire sauce, ginger, soy sauce, and wonton wraps.
Bake for 5 minutes.
Serve immediately.

cb7e6bedc8.gt:
Preheat oven to 180C.
Melt the butter in the microwave.
Mix all the ingredients together.
Pour the mixture into a baking dish and cook for 45 minutes.
cb7e6bedc8.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix butter, flour, sugar and baking powder in a bowl.
Add pineapple and mix well.
Pour into a greased 9x13 pan.
Bake for 30 minutes.

49ba66ed9e.gt:
In a large saucepan, heat the butter or margarine and oil over medium heat.
Add the chicken and brown lightly on each side.
Once the chicken breasts are cooked (the juices should run clear) remove them from the pan and set aside.
Add the shallots and the chicken stock to the pan.
Simmer for 3 minutes.
Add the raspberry vinegar.
Bring all to a boil and simmer, stirring, until the mixture thickens.
Stir in the cream and return the chicken to the pan.
Heat for 1 minute to warm the chicken, turning the chicken pieces to coat with the sauce.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
49ba66ed9e.pred:
Place chicken breasts in a shallow baking dish.
Drizzle with butter and oil.
Sprinkle with shallots and season with salt and pepper.
Pour chicken stock over chicken.
In a small bowl, mix raspberry vinegar and heavy whipping cream.
Pour over chicken.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Serve with raspberry sauce.

af9b2fab3d.gt:
Add your garlic powder, onion powder, pepper and celery to your cut up meat
Heat oil in a big pot (I like using my dutch oven type) add your cubed seasoned beef, start browning over med high heat
When you have some good color, add the water, and the beef bouillon and bring to a boil and cook for about 2hrs, you want it to simmer, a low boil here, cover with a lid
Add tomato sauce, baby carrots, potatoes, continue cooking at a low boil, stirring occasionally for about 1 & 1/2hrs, keep lid on
Add your geen beans ( add 1 can beans and the liquid from can , the other can of beans you need to drain and just add the beans), and the corn, let cook about 30mins longer
af9b2fab3d.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Place meat in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and onion powder; cook and stir 1 minute.
Add beef, pepper, and celery; cook and stir 5 minutes or until meat is browned.
Add water, bouillon, tomato sauce, carrots, potatoes, and green beans; bring to a boil.
Cover and bake 1 hour or until meat is tender.
Uncover and bake 15 minutes longer or until vegetables are tender.

e0704be51f.gt: Add all ingredients together and blend until combined
e0704be51f.pred:
In a blender, combine cherries, banana, yogurt, ice, and honey.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a glass and enjoy!

d1c38e95f4.gt:
Note: You will also need a Babycakes cake pop machine.
For the donuts: Preheat your Babycakes cake pop machine.
In a large bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
Then add eggs, maple syrup, and vanilla.
Mix well.
Before adding apple pie filling, run a knife through the large chunks of apples to chop them into smaller pieces.
Then add to mixture and mix until all apples are incorporated.
Then add the milk.
The mixture will be on the thick side.
Pour 1 tablespoon of donut mixture into each reservoir of your preheated Babycakes cake pop machine.
Bake for 4 minutes, then remove and place on a plate or cooling rack to cool off.
For the glaze: In a small bowl mix together powdered sugar, vanilla, and milk.
You want the consistency to be runny, not thick.
Dip each donut in the mixture and flip it around by hand or with a fork until the whole donut is covered.
Then place back on the cooling rack until the glaze is dry.
For the coating: In a small bowl combine the powdered sugar and cinnamon.
Dip each donut into the mixture and roll around until all covered.
Then place finished donuts in an airtight container until ready to eat.
Oh, who are you kidding, go ahead and start eating!
d1c38e95f4.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
Add eggs, maple syrup, vanilla, apple pie filling, milk, and powdered sugar.
Mix until a soft dough forms.
Roll dough out on a floured surface to 1/4 inch thickness.
Cut into 2 1/2 inch rounds.
Place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown.
While donuts are baking, combine milk, powdered sugar, cinnamon, and vanilla.
Dip warm donuts in milk mixture and place on a wire rack to cool.
Serve warm.

3d07a1a906.gt:
Halve avocados and remove pit.
Roll limes or heat in microwave for 10 seconds to get juices flowing.
Halve the limes.
Rub the avocado halves gently with 1/2 lime to retard the browning.
Juice limes into small bowl and mix with sugar, chili powder and salt using a fork or small whisk.
Add extra-virgin olive oil in a slow stream while mixing dressing.
Pour dressing into the cavities of avocados, distributing it equally and serve.
Garnish with chives or cilantro as an optional garnish.
3d07a1a906.pred:
Place the avocadoes in a bowl and mash them with a fork.
Add the lime juice, sugar, chili powder and salt.
Mix well.
Add the olive oil and stir until well combined.
Garnish with chopped chives or cilantro if desired.
